Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: unctravel805
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Chicago in late February. The Seneca was perfect for our trip - great location right off Michican Ave. I was participating in the Hustle up the Hancock stair climbing race, and this hotel is literally right beside the Hancock building. Our room on the 15th floor was huge with a great view of the Hancock, and although the furnishings are a little dated, everything was very clean and comfortable. The entire hotel had a lot of great character, from the lobby to the exterior to the rooms. Our great room rate even came with a full hot breakfast - awesome deal!! The only negative I encountered was the surly front desk staff. Both the woman checking us in and the man checking us out said almost nothing - no "How can I help you", no "How was your stay" - the check-out guy literally just stared at me and grabbed my room cards. It was almost comical. Luckily those experiences only accounted for a couple minutes of my great weekend at the lovely Seneca hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Jennbte2ct
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty easy going traveler. I don't complain. If a restaurant brings me the wrong food, nine times out of ten, i'll eat it anyway. This hotel is the exception. Location was incredible and lobby gorgeous. I was visiting Chicago to spend a few last days with my son before he moved to a new Naval Base. My reservation was made months in advance for 2 doubles however when i arrived the hotel they didn't have 2 doubles available and "upgraded" me to a King Suite - not cool for an 18 year old boy to sleep with his mom. TVs are circa 1980, wallpaper is peeling, carpet is old and worn, no linens available for pullout couch. The coffee pot in the kitchen had prefilled coffee filters in the section where the water goes that had been there for months. I asked the front desk to bring a new coffee pot, they said they would, but 2 hours later it had still not arrived. No coffee was available in the lobby and the restaurant was not open yet. Vending machines were not powered on. I would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingphysio g
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with family. I found the place to be very comfortable. Its old but good. You may not find a lot of luxury but the property is good. We stayed in a suite with a bedroom, living room and a kitchen. very convenient if you want to prepare your own food and save a few bucks or eat healthy. Grocery store is a ten minute walk and Walgreens is a 5 minute walk. The plumbing is old and the toilet gave trouble on the last day, but they were prompt in getting it fixed. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Next door to the Hancock and water tower place. walking distance to the beach. A minute walk to the CTA bus stops and a 5 minute walk to the red line. You can find easy transportation to almost any place from here. Staff are fine. Reception staff were also very helpful. The wireless was good too

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Justine1976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the most affordable in the Magnificent Mile area for my 1st but short visit to Chicago & I couldn't be happier! We were upgraded from a Deluxe Queen to a King Suite due to being an Expedia VIP access member. The room was huge, not to mention that the apartment style setting provided a living room, formal dining table and a fully stocked kitchenette. Having access to a fridge, oven & microwave came in handy in reheating my deep dish pizza and other perishables & saved me from eating out 3x/day. It's not the most stylish hotel but the location can't be beat! It's across the Water Tower and next to the Hancock building. Restaurants & shops are a short walk away and it's also next to a couple of bus stops. I would definitely return to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Obdur8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a find for the price. It's only a block off of the Magnificent Mile but is in a relatively quiet area. The kitchenette is well stocked and the rooms are big and comfy. It's not the most modern but I like the lived in feel and the staff were friendly. My parents stayed here as well and really liked it. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to stay near the main shopping drag. The Museum of Contemporary Art is nearby by too.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a perfect world”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuySTL
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 4-star property that has a few quirks which, if overlooked, delivers a clean, safe place to stay in the downtown Water Tower area. The rooms are suites, converted apartments, that are actually more than the average hotel guest requires. On my last stay I had a room with five closets, four of which went unused. I prefer non-chain hotel properties and this fills the bill. Service can be a little uneven: on my last stay the clerk failed to give me coupons for breakfast when I checked in. The next morning the desk clerk told me that breakfast wasn't included in my room - although I was paying more than I had paid a week earlier when the coupons were included. A quick chat with the manager got things straightened out, although he also made a stab at declining. Customer service is such a moment of truth and word of mouth is now at light speed, one would think that managers wouldn't even try to win such small disputes. There is a business center, but when I asked about printing a boarding pass, I was told that the printer was down. A week later, the printer was still down. On the plus side, you get a huge suite for $109 per night and they'll park your car for about $35. Incidently, the "free" breakfast is pretty good. So, if you need to stay downtown and can endure some odd service and Eisenhower era decor, this might be just the ticket for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed (but you need to know what you're signed up for)”
Reviews.Author: JenIttels
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate in November. Loved having a kitchen to store milk, leftover pizza and a coffee maker. Staff were nice enough. Room was very clean and housekeeping even called us when they were unable to get into the room (we'd come back early to hang out and didn't want to be disturbed) to see if we needed anything. Sure there was a typical amount of hotel shabbiness (marks on the carpet here and there but not very noticeable - I'm just pedantic) and the decor may not be to your taste if you're all about the modern look. We just loved it. Clean, great rate, good location with excellent amenities. What's not to like? Will be recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “North Michigan Avenue with big rooms”
Reviews.Author: bhhenry81
Reviews.Content: Located next to the John Hancock the Seneca Hotel offers rooms with kitchenettes. It reveals an earlier period of hotel construction and shows it's age but offers a more economical space in a trendy section of Chicago. You can walk to the lake front or stroll Michigan Avenue. Be sure to request no smoking rooms if you are sensitive to rooms that waif of smokey aromas. If you are bringing the family this hotel offers spaciousness once you get to the room. The elevators are splendid but they are small in size. The hotel offers good value.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Susan3181959
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to shop the magnificent mile. We wanted a suite and this is an extremely well priced option. The room is actually a converted 1 bedroom apartment complete with kitchen. this would be a great option if you were staying for a week or more. It is an older hotel however and thus the bathroom is small and it doesn't have the modern conveniences like pay per view etc. but you can't beat the location and price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: fauljo
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for one night in upgraded suite.........senior discount with full breakfast was quite a deal for $99. Huge suite..........hotel is a little outdated but somehow homey. Just 1-2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile....close to the Drake. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tlynn63
Reviews.Content: I think the the Seneca must have been a beauty in its day. It is only a bit worn (and the jacuzzi didn't work) but still has a nice atmosphere. The room had folding doors that opened up to a closet kitchen. The included breakfast was a full freshly cooked one to order and very good. It was nice to relax in their downstairs dining room with the fresh coffee to start the day. For a walker, the location is convenient to the sights downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: travelingus1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca for 3 weeks due to a long business trip. The location was excellent; right by Michigan and Chicago Avenues. The mall is literally across the street. However, the location doesnt make up for the hotel itself. The room I was put in was small, outdated and to be kind- well worn. The heat didn't work, and while I was there every light bulb in the room went out and had to be replaced. The gas for the stove had to be turned off over night because of the fumes. That said, most of the staff was quite friendly and wanting to help. However; I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mag Mile spot, great value, older but pretty.”
Reviews.Author: bjbOhio
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights to do some holiday shopping. Located right behind Water Tower Place, close to Macy's, American Girl, and everything this end of N. Michigan. 3 restaurants in bldg.: a cafe, a steak house, and an Italian place. Room had a small kitchen, utensils, plenty of closet space, hair dryer, tub with jacuzzi, safe, etc. I was on the 2nd floor so it was a little noisy at times, being so close to the activity on the street. I didn't spend much time just hanging out at the hotel, there are too many other things to see, but I had an enjoyable stay and would have no trouble recommending the Seneca.

Reviews.Title: “Good business option”
Reviews.Author: lacontessa1
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I shared a large one bedroom suite when attending a conference mid October at nearby Northwestern University. The bedroom part was smallish, but, the living/dining area and the kitchen area were surprisingly large (we remarked to each other that it would have been good to take some of that space and enlarge the bedroom). The kitchen came with a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, 4 burner stove, microwave, coffeepot, toaster as well as some pots and pans, plates, glasses, cups and utensils--more than adequate for our 4 night stay. The dining table was set for six, and the living area had two sofas, chair, end tables, TV etc. One walk in closet in the bedroom with safe. At least two closets in the living area. So, plenty of room for the work we had to do to prepare for three meetings during the conference (e.g., putting together attendee packets). The staff were very helpful, including bringing up a very large/heavy box of materials, and running out in the cold/rain to nab a cab for us to the airport. Breakfast was not included in our $149 conference rate, though it is included in some of the other special rates from what we could understand so worth checking. Going downstairs from the lobby is a small cafe that is not part of the hotel, but, the cheese omelet, juice, tea and home fries that we had were just fine. Instead of toast, they offered to bring me extra fruit as a gluten-free option. The room was quiet, plenty of hot water, and generally clean. The reason why am not giving this hotel a 5 star is that the sheets were threadbare (though clean) and the decor wasn't that exciting. Location was great for those interested in the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay was as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: kdfrench
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senca Hotel 2 years ago when my husband attended a conference in Chicago and I was thrilled that we were abe to return to the Seneca again this year. The location is terrific - just a short walk to Michigan Ave. and nestled right behind the John Hancock Center. There is really no need to have a car when staying here if you plan to spend all of your time in the city. The walk to the subway is about 5 minutes and several bus lines run along Michigan Avenue. Parking is at an off-site garage and since we did not have a car, I do not know the rates. We had a slight problem at check-in, but the staff handled the problem quickly and was very friendly. The rooms are spacious and CLEAN. Some may complain that the furniture/decor is dated, but my theory is I'd rather spend less on my hotel and have that extra money to truly enjoy the city. The building is old and on a central heating and cooling system. While we were there (late Oct.), the system was still set to AC. The only problem was it was cool enough outside that the air was not running and our room was quite warm (75). We opened our window a bit and it cooled nicely (68-70). We were happy that despite the fact that the window was open overnight, we did not hear traffic outside. One last bonus - many rooms in this hotel are suites or at least have kitchenettes. During our prior stay, we had a full kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom & bath. This time, we had a queen delux room which included the kitchenette, but no living room or dining area. I enjoyed having the option to reheat leftovers from prior dinners rather than having lunch out, alone, while my husband was at the conference. The Seneca's website states it best: "Not the Hyatt. Or the Sheraton. Nor the Marriott. Thank goodness. The Seneca Hotel & Suites is a distinctive boutique hotel featuring spacious suites in downtown Chicagoâ€¦a relaxing escape just a block off Michigan Avenueâ€¦Chicagoâ€™s Magnificent Mile."

Reviews.Title: “Seneca - Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Justine069
Reviews.Content: My sister, dad & I recently stayed at the seneca for 2 nights on a 3 weeks states trip. The location is perfect as in it's a 1 min walk to the Mag Mile & 1 min in the other direction to walk along the water (very pretty).. It's probably about 15-20 mins to walk to Navy Pier. It is a 1 min walk to the amazing restaurant, the Cheesecake Factory, too! So the hotel is really pretty, service was great, bell boys were great, room was massive with a little kitchenette with 3 walk in cupboards for our luggage, clothes. My only problem with the room was that you could tell it hadn't been usedin quite a while so it was dusty.. BUT it wasn't visible dust.. Just the dust feel that you get from a locked up house.. In saying that though - my dad & sister didnt even notice & I only did because I have a bad, sensitive throat and strong aromas such as perfumes, cigarettes clog me up.. So if you're sensitive like I am - check this before you un-pack all your stuff as you may want to change rooms. We could have but I coudnt be bothered as our stuff was already everywhere! Breakfast was included and was decent.. A standard egg, sausage, hash brown and bacon option or something of the like or yummy pancakes. Tea, coffee too etc. They have a bigger menu you can pay for too. It's decorated very old fashioned and is really nice looking. I'd stay there again & definitely recommend it. If you dont want to pay top dollar but still want something nice then stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Venue off the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: KansasBob
Reviews.Content: I stayed several months at the Seneca this past summer when my wife had medical procedures performed at Northwestern Memorial. I thought that the extended stay rates were reasonable and the staff accommodating. The hotel is pretty old, my suite was pretty tired and sported a dreary view of the back alley. Even so, if you have to spend mega-days in the area of town called Streeterville I suggest that you consider the Seneca. It is adjacent to the Hancock Tower, close to Water Tower Place (for shopping and dining) and just a block off the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: fifi090
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at the Seneca. I had booked on recommendation and it was fantastic. Amazing location just off Michigan Avenue, right next to the John Hancock building. Great location for exploring beautiful Chicago. Staff at check in were very professional. Rooms are fantastic.....two double beds, large seating area with huge TV and well equipped kitchen area. Also loads of storage, a safe and free wi fi. All beautifully clean. We got a great price for the room which also included breakfast. This was served in the downstairs restaurant and was a proper cooked breakfast which set us up for the day. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Muzzle
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, huge room (suite) with separate kitchen, living room, bedroom, etc. 12th floor, but fast elevators. Wireless internet, sometimes a little spotty. Down side might be old-style TVs...ha, that's about all I can come up with. And if you're staying in Chicago to watch TV, well, there's nothing more to say. It was too hot in our room, and we couldn't get the AC to work, but they may have that shut down for the season. We just opened windows and all was fine. Small bathroom (says wife). LOVE the location, just off Mich Ave. We would definitely stay here again. Room rates vary, but probably avg $120/night.

Reviews.Title: “The Seneca Hotel was Awesome! My husband and I could live there!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anapalacios1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago last month on two different nights. We got a super fabulous deal for the first night ($99) and a little more for the second ($149). Early check-in was available on the second night we were there. They appear to be rooms that were converted into apartments. The decor and everything inside the rooms was very, very nice and the rooms were very clean. The bedroom, living room and closet spaces were a really nice size. One room had a jacuzzi tub in it, the second room we had was just a regular tub, but they were both very clean. The kitchen was a nice surprise (if you're looking to eat in). Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful, especialy Eric, at the front desk. My husband and I stayed at a different place the last time we were in Chicago 2 years ago and we thought that was great, but the Seneca was definitely way better. We can't say enough about it except that we will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It'll do”
Reviews.Author: kmarajh
Reviews.Content: Because we didn't spend too much time in the room, I think it didnt bother me as much. Older furnishings, clean enough. Scary bathroom floor tiles that were very slippery when dry. Nice to know we had a kitchen to use if we needed to. Early check in was not available but they did keep our bags so we had more time to see the city. Beds were comfy, A/C was a bit loud

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: RuthIMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently enjoyed a girls' weekend at The Seneca. It's a beautiful place in a great location with very reasonable rates. Courteous and helpful staff too. You can't go wrong! There were amenities we didn't use, but you might want to.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLaurena
Reviews.Content: Was part of a group tour of 24 women and this location was chosen due to its close proximity to shopping, theater and good price. What a great find. I would definitely stay here again. Yes, the furniture and carpeting are a little tired, but the bed was extremely comfortable, having a separate bedroom and seating area was great and the full kitchen was just an added bonus. Kitchen was extremely clean also. Biggest negative I could say was the water pressure was a little whimpy but I was located on the top floor (1722). Bathroom counter space was lacking so I had to set my toiletries on the toilet seat. Wireless internet was free but quite slow, but again, may have been the room location. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Doorman was great! Chestnut Street Cafe on the lower level was a good value for breakfast with fast service and good food. Francesca's on the main floor was good, although I'm not a big pasta lover. They did offer a gluten free menu. Others in our group rated it as excellent. Not only was I happy this hotel was selected, I overheard a lot of favorable comments from the other ladies in the group and this tells me a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Not lavish, but a decent value”
Reviews.Author: SNoon4056
Reviews.Content: Look. The place is old. It desperately needs a facelift. The sheets are your basic 250 thread-count 1985 hotel sheets. The bath is very small and basic. But I got a large room with a kitchenette and a functional desk, with a big closet. It's an old apartment building turned hotel so the space is far more generous than any Michigan Avenue hotel. And the fact that I was 1 block from Water Tower Place for $150 a night is not to be overlooked. I can't rave. But I sure don't think it should be panned, either. The check-in process was slow and the ladies certainly didn't exert themselves to rush. The place isn't ADA friendly, so go elsewhere if you're in a wheelchair. It won't be my first choice to book again-- but I won't avoid it either.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: carol t
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Chicago every September and have stayed at many Downtown Hotels.Upon arriving at the Seneca we both felt very comfortable.From the Front Desk to the Bellman.Our Suite was well appointed...clean and tidy...Comfortable nights sleep although the pillows have a lot to be desired.. Wonderful restaurants...GREAT breakfast choices and delicious.. Great Location.. Had a wonderful time..

Reviews.Title: “Great location very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and friendly. Rooms are either an apartment or a decent one size room. Even the room only, has a fridge, microwave, glasses etc. TV is very good, a flat screen. Wifi is complementary, and breakfast was included. Bed was extremely comfortable, bath was nice with a jacuzzi bath tub. Breakfast was ok, you get a voucher which has a value of $6.00. The set breakfast is eggs, breakfast meat, hash browns, toast and coffee. The first day arrived at breakfast at 830 and the food was just warm. Then I found out that you could order anything off the menu with the voucher of $6.00 and pay the difference. Service was very slow, and could certainly use more serve persons. There is a bus stop 1/2 block from the hotel and Michigan Ave is 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Slucie
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, it is definitely a little gem. The hotel staff gave us a super warm welcome and upgraded us to a fantastic suite and as we were travelling with my elderly parents, they ensured that they had a suite with a walk in shower and that the rooms were as close as possible to each other. Our suite was large and comfortable, with a great kitchen equipped with everything we could possibly need. We even had a spa bath and lots of nice toiletries. The beds were really comfortable and it was surprisingly quiet considering that we were in a busy city. The Seneca is situated across the road from The Water Tower and is in easy walking distance of lots of good shops and restaurants, including Macy's, Best Buys (great for photographic equipment) The Cheesecake Factory, and lots of other tourist attractions and is also close to the stops for the tour buses; we went online and booked our tickets for these in advance and paid a lot less than if we'd have brought them in situ. As far as location is concerned, we couldn't have chosen better. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.They were able to recommend a great pizza takeout, which was ideal after all that sight-seeing, and as the suite had a dining table you could sit and eat in comfort. We had a complimentary breakfast included in our booking and this was quite simple but freshly cooked and tasty; you could even have your breakfast up to 2:30pm. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rontastic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seneca in August found it good quality, safe and convenient to everything downtown. No great views but we didn't expect that, our room had a kitchenette we we didn't require, bed was up against one wall so one of us had to climb over the other to get out. We had a rate that included breakfast, however we felt like poor relations at breakfast our coupon for breakfast got us one egg, one piece of bacon etc.. and no refil on our coffee, wish we'd gone out and found our own.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jim A
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Seneca for a week from the 13th September. It isn't a 5 star hotel, but you don't pay a 5 star tariff either. It is in a fabulous location for Magnificent Mile and other tourist attractions, the breakfast is excellent, and the room/suite I stayed in had everything I needed. I was happy to do my own laundry, and pleased to find that the machine and dryer were easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: knights1997
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent value for money. Rooms are big and comfy and staff were very helpful. Walls could be a little thicker. Breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dothecharleston
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal on hotels.com a few months back. Rooms were stately and huge (living room area with chairs and couch and separate dining room table). Kitchenette with amenities. Big bedroom with full bath and a half-bath between living room and bedroom. Complimentary breakfast was tasty and filling. Only $20 per night for a roll-away. Elevators are quite slow, the only drawback. Located near the lake and close to the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ActonStuart
Reviews.Content: The rooms/apartments here are very spacious if a little dated. the building is quite atmospheric and for chicago it offers good value for money. The breakfast is perfectly adequate and you are allowed to have it any time up until 4pm which is a bonus if you are on a tight budget. The location is excellent and I would definitely consider using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Conlet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca for three nights this week. I had booked a King suite, and it was enormous! We had a bedroom with a very comfortable king bed, a separate sitting area with a pull-out sofa, 2 chairs, a desk and chair, and a dining room table with 4 chairs. An alcove held a complete kitchen - frig, microwave, stove, and was well equipped with dishes, pans, etc. I chose the Seneca mainly for the option of having a suite and for the location which worked out perfectly for us. We are in our seventies and sadly cannot do the amount of walking we would like to do! However, being right next to the Hancock Building gave us two access points to the hop on/off bus route within a few blocks, and was close enough to walk to the restaurants we had chosen - Gibson's and Emilio's, as well as having two restaurants right in the hotel. Free wi-fi and a full breakfast were an additional bonus. True it is not as plush as some others, but it was extremely clean, had very helpful and cheerful desk clerks and bell staff. We will certainly stay there for any future Chicago trips.

Reviews.Title: “More like a club than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: badEXPEDIA
Reviews.Content: This place is my hands down favorite place to stay in Chicago. They have: a kitchenette in every room, a staff that is beyond gracious to warm and friendly almost family, great location (behind Water Tower Place and the Hancock Building) and a lovely little restaurant that produces real taste treats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Darlene43
Reviews.Content: Small, European style hotel. Nice to have a small kitchen available. Service can be off at times and only a coffee shop for breakfast. Small, nicer restaurant in the building for lunch/dinner. We had a family gathering and it worked well because of the location across from Water Tower Place, next to John Hancock, close to Michigan Avenue. Because of its size, doesn't have the amenities of the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Italia42
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Seneca during the past year. Once was with friends, once with my husband and once with my 10 year old grandson. It is comfortable, a great location, reasonably priced. I don't think I would stay any place else in Chicago. It is not fancy, but it is home when I am there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for my 1st trip”
Reviews.Author: mmtdat
Reviews.Content: My son moved to the area in April and this location was within walking distance. I was pleased with the early check-in, the full breakfast, and the smoker friendly option!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location, plus some additional information”
Reviews.Author: Adam A
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which appears to have been a rehabbed condo building, was two rooms in one. While I was inspecting the king bed for bedbugs, I didn't find any. What I did find was a wooden board placed between the mattress and boxspring. The room had 4 closets and a kitchette equipped with a gas stove, refrigerator and a full size sink. The hotel placed a full set of dishes and utensils for two people. The hotel staff was awesome. The free continental breakfast didn't start until 9 AM, which was later than I personally would have liked. All in all... a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Old, Dirty Apartment”
Reviews.Author: meggie520_CP
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room had a view of a fat man sitting in his apartment aross the street. The hotel was just an old apartment with 10,000 closets and dirt and dust on everything. It was the 11th floor. They make the outside look real fancy but once you get inside you're in for a surprise, the kitchen not cleaned, dirt streaked corners and when i lost a piece of my pandora bracelet, I bent down to look under the couch and found dirt, dead flies and nasty unidentible objects. :( It is on main street but not with an amzing view. The Chestnut cafe is alright and the other restaurant has terrible food. I would not recommend this to anyone because its not cheap. Please do not stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We made advance reservations for four nights at the Seneca Hotel in August, 2011. After waiting 12 1/2 hours (including multiple misinformation from Amtrak) on a train platform in Minnesota for Amtrak to arrive, we gave up--no train ever arrived. Long story short: We cancelled our whole vacation trip to Chicago. Given the circumstances of our cancellations, EVERY ONE OF OUR OTHER RESERVATIONS PROVIDED US A FULL REFUND, even though some had a strict "no refund"" policy. Except the Seneca Hotel. The Seneca Hotel was the ONLY organization who insisted that we forfeit a one night deposit of $140. Everyone else cited "customer relations", "given your circumstances", etc. Not the Seneca Hotel. Very rigid. Not good PR. We will never reserve there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jeff351
Reviews.Content: I was looking to find a place to spend a a few nights away and celebrate our wedding anniversary. Mission accomplished, situated behintween Michigan Ave and the lakefront right behind the Hancock center is the Seneca. So location is perfect, all of the conveinence being steps away from North Michigan Ave shopping but a block off Michigan so not nearly as noisy. Older property but well maintained, small kitchenette in room for whatever and a very well appointed bathroom. Comfy beds, clean linens and air conditioning that worked flawlessly in 99 degree temps. Great little breakfast downstairs which was included in room package (highly recommended) and a fantastic italian restaurant (Francesca's) at street level on property. The rooms are very quite, after all they were constructed decades ago and the walls are probably a foot thick. On top of this the price left us lots of room for enjoying all that Chicago has to offer. Give the Seneca a try if you want a break from the cookie cutter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: around_the_world_nj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to everything in the Magnificent Mile, but off to the side away from the crowds. The room I had was amazing, about the size of a small apartment, with a kitchen and dining/living room. Walking into the hotel, you can see that it's very charming and very nicely kept up. The front desk staff is extremely nice and professional. I do have two complaints though 1) they ran out of large towels. I've never been in a hotel that provided a single towel. 2) I left something in the room and have left 2 messages but have not received a call back. So I am not impressed with their post-stay treatment. Overall, I might stay there again and would recommend to friends, though with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: ec198260763
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca for four weeks. Two weeks after checking out I was fraudulantly charged for another guests stay and came to find out that the Seneca had been infested with bed bugs and had contaminated my clothes and luggage that I then brought into my home. Upon calling the Seneca 6 times one day and 4 the next and leaving messages with multiple managers... no one returned my call. It wasn't until I got the bank involved that my money was returned. As for the bed bugs... it was like pulling teeth to get reimbursement for part of my stay in order to pay for all of my belongings to be professionally steam cleaned. STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right next door to the Hancock building, and right against the lakefront. Staff are friendly, hotel serves a complimentary breakfast in the Chestnut Street Cafe below, rooms are spacious (ours had a full kitchenette), there's a gym and a pleasant rooftop terrace. Slightly dated feel to the rooms, but nothing to be concerned about.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: andycat2b
Reviews.Content: The girlfriends and I get together once a year to Chicago for fun and shopping. The Seneca was our choice this year for hotels. What a great place. We arrived in Chicago @ 9 am...checked our luggage so we could start our shopping excersion. Kat Burr at the front desk was fab-u-lous. Our room wasn't ready, needless to say, but she set us up for when we returned from our day. What a great and comfortable room. Next we went to the pub next door for Margarittas..our bartender Brandon knew exactly how to make them right. Yummy!!!! The hotel is located within blocks of Mag Mile shopping..between Water Tower and the Hancock. Next year we'll stay here again!!!! Thank you Kat for making our stay extremely enjoyable..and to Brandon for making killer Margarittas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great rate”
Reviews.Author: andirose
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago to accompany my daughter to a week-long dance camp. The organizers arranged a discount rate at the Seneca so I don't know what rates others might be quoted. We had a good-sized room w/ two queen beds (very nice mattresses) and a KITCHEN (almost full-sized fridge, dishwasher, stove and oven) for $100! What a steal! You are ONE BLOCK from Michigan Ave, right behind the Hancock Center and in the thick of the Mag Mile. Subway (redline) is the "Chicago" stop and is just a few blocks away. AWESOME location. Short subway ride down to Millenium Park (and walkable as well) or up to Lincoln Park OR to the loop to tranfer to other lines. We didn't need valet thank god as it is expensive ($50 a day) The gym is just a tiny room and nothing to write home about but I soon discovered the underpass to the running/biking trail along the lake is just 3 blocks away. Sun deck was not open. Lobby is nothing too fancy but the staff were very helpful. The doormen and bellmen were super pleasant the the clientele was a nice mix of famlies, older couples, etc. On site is one of the popular and quite tasty Francesca's Italian restaurants (we actually ate at the one in Wrigleyville our first night!) The hallway and other common areas are not fancy, but are clean and well lit. There is actually some good artwork in the hallways. The Contemporary Art Museum is a block away as well and they have a summer farmer's market out front (wed's?)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good things to say!”
Reviews.Author: SaraEOakland
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance and got a rate of $124 for a deluxe queen with kitchenette. Spacious comfortable room - everything worked, especially the air conditioner. Because I'd registered on their website, we got a nice bottle of wine as a birthday promo, and a possible upgrade, which we declined because we liked our original room assignment. Had breakfast in every morning then took off to explore Chicago each day. Good toiletries, firm mattress, desk, chest of drawers. Only thing missing was a little table on the other side of the bed and a reading lamp - but we created a bedside table out of the luggage rack and a tray. Location was fabulous, right off Michigan Ave near the Water Tower; lots of shopping, metro, good places to eat (Pizzeria Due was fun), great people watching and many sights within easy walking distance. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room....”
Reviews.Author: HikerLady02
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you like lots of room and especially if you had an extended stay. I think all their rooms are suites, so we had a large living room, a small, but fully-equipped kitchen, large bedroom with a king bed, nice bathroom and tons of closet space. Very convenient location and friendly staff. You can choose valet parking at $50 with in/out priviledges, or park in attached garage for $28. (I think you can pay an additional $5 for in/out.)

Reviews.Title: “Great room, breakfast so so”
Reviews.Author: nieb20475
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seneca for one night on July 20th. I booked a deluxe queen room and when I got to my room I was impressed for sure. Somehow I think they upgraded my room to a suite cause to me this room looked more like a suite and a deluxe room. There was a living room with a seperate dining table, a small kitchen with appliances, a restroom, a bedroom with two queen beds and an ensuite bathroom with nice ammenities. The room was very clean ( room 208 ) and located on the 2nd floor. As well as in the living room as in the bedroom was a widescreen tv. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpfull and there were people at the front door that would open the door for you. The hotel has a very central location and is right next to the Hancock building. It is an easy walk to Navy Pier and right next to Michigan avenue aka the Magnificent Mile. Willis tower ( formerly known as Sears tower ) is further away. Breakfast was included in the price, but was of poor quality. The hash browns tasted like rotten potatoes and the toast tasted burned. And I am not picky were food is concerned. I am easily pleased, but this was even worse than what I was given on my international flight to the States. The stay itself was more than good. And I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMrenee
Reviews.Content: The Seneca was wonderful we booked 1 queen with breakfast . Our room was 1705 nice firm bed, 2 closets, bath with spa tub, full kicthen. The location was great easy to walk many places, we also used the buses and the stops were very close. The staff was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the Seneca”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousMom63
Reviews.Content: This was not in my AAA guidebook but popped up as a "special deal" on TravelZoo.com and since I was booking 4 rooms for my extended family to meet up there, budget was key! Also the kitchenettes were a rare find. We knew it was an older hotel so we weren't expecting modern amazements...and it suited us just fine. Really nice room layouts, including the MOST and BIGGEST closets I've ever seen in a hotel. We could have made the kids each sleep in one (in fact my nephew did sleep in one to avoid his parents snoring). Everything worked fine. We got breakfast coupons for free basic breakfast in little cafe downstairs, it was fine. Location was AWESOME right next to John Hancock Tower and the trolley came and went from/to Navy Pier regularly. Parking was the only pain, as we arrived late in day and lot was full so we had to use valet for $49/day. Place was easy to find and staff was fine. OH, my whole family commented on how nice it was to have such SOLID WALLS so that you didn't hear people in the room next to you (as is usually the case in newer hotels).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprize in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: msmcd
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about the Seneca Hotel in Chicago is that we didn't get to stay longer. It is a first class hotel with a great location at a great price for downtown in a major city. It is an old building but has been beautifully restored and maintained. We booked a queen but were placed in a King suite and "sweet" is was indeed. Beautifully appointed, the size of small apartment, we really felt pampered. Our rooms came with breakfast in their dining room and was very good. Parking is extra but we didn't have a car so did not fret over the high price of parking downtown. The Seneca Hotel is a great hotel for your next visit to Chi Town.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Anita4790
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have found a better place to stay. The Seneca Hotel staff was very friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location...right off Michigan Avenue, next to the John Hancock building. It was very quiet and secure. We could get a taxi right in front of the hotel or take a bus. We could easily walk to the beach and the Navy Pier is just a few blocks away. Our suite was very large. In fact, it looked like an apartment. We had a dining room table, full kitchen, living area, and separate bedroom. If we go back to Chicago, we will definitely stay at the Seneca again!

Reviews.Title: “a week in june 2011”
Reviews.Author: bluemaxie
Reviews.Content: from our arrival to our departure we enjoyed every minute of our stay,polite and helpful staff in every department .the irish boy in the FREE breakfast room was a gem,our room on the ninth floor was kept spotless ,for a relaxing break we would spend a quiet twenty minutes on the roof,the hotels location is spot on,chicago was a real eye opener very diverse easy to get about, and everybody was polite and helpful,would stay again if returning to the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: hehldq
Reviews.Content: Four family members had the pleasure of staying at the Seneca Hotel located just east of the Hancock building. This small but elegant hotel offered a generous sized suite including full kitchen, dining area, family area and king-sized bedroom. The room was spotless and well appointed. If there is a small downside, it would be that there is no room service offered, but given the countless restaurants nearby, it was not an issue. They offer a exercise room and a spacious rooftop deck. I look forward to my next stay at the Seneca.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiATrenton_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2-bed room with family on a recent weekend trip, the location is great, it is right by the Water Tower area, so it is super-accessable to shopping on Michigan Ave. Our room had tons of closet space, the staff were very helpful and kind, and the compliamentary breakfast was really good (not your average cold pastries and corn flakes)! Only complaint- the beds weren't very comfortable, definately on the firm side.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in town!”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsTucsonAZ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Seneca in years past, but not recently, as we haven't been to Chicago in several years. Returned this past week and had an incredible stay at the Seneca. It is, without doubt, the only place to stay in Chicago! Check-in was friendly, welcoming and quick. Our request for a quiet room on a high floor got us to floor 11 and a very quiet, private room. The furnishings in our deluxe king suite were lovely. A full kitchen (albeit a bit aged on the appliances), living room with comfortable couch and love seat, large bedroom and bath and two TV's were all that we could have hoped for. Bedding was lush and comfortable; bed itself nice and firm, like we like it. Internet access was free and wireless and worked very well. For this trip, we decided to rely on public transportation, and got 7-day CTA passes. The Seneca was perfectly placed for everything -- there were buses that literally left us off right at the corner of the hotel. At most, we had to walk a block to catch a bus on Michigan Avenue. We will probably never use a car in Chicago again, especially because of the incredibly high cost of parking -- not just at the Seneca, but anywhere in town! Everyone at the Seneca made us feel welcome and part of their family. We will never stay anywhere else in Chicago; we feel like we returned to our Chicago home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels2011
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel situation right in the heart of Chicago city. Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. Booked it online with expedia and got very good rate I thought. I was even more impressed at the price when we booked into the hotel. The room was actually one of their suites. It was basically a 1 bed apartment. Large living area with sofa bed, coffee table, tv, dining room table and chairs, two closets. Off of this was a fully equipped kitchenette with every appliance you would want and floor to ceiling cupboards. Coffee maker. The bedroom had a large king bed with tv, walk-in closet and ensuite bathroom. Although bathroom was smallish, it was adequate. Electronic Safe. Airconditioning might not be the best in the bedroom as it is controlled from the living area but it did not cos restless nights and the heat had not hit major highs yet. Decor was what would probably be considered a bit old style but everything was extremely clean. Housekeeping came every day. On top of this there was breakfast included in the cafe in the basement of hotel. So surprised at this as it was not stated when I was booking either so thrilled. Location is perfect, just off Magnificent Mile, behind John Hancock Tower and right next door to the Water Tower Shopping Centre. Small walk in opposite direction and you are on Lake Shore Drive. About 15-20 stroll to Navy Pier - which I love. Also able to get the bus to the Museums for $2 from Magnificent Mile. Only negative is bad lumpy pillows but this was a problem for all of US hotels with stayed in during our trip During our 10 day trip to US this was best value for money hotel and right in city centre. Will definitely stay again if back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: accordionpotter
Reviews.Content: This older hotel is a great value. A full breakfast is included and the rooms are large and clean. The location is great - you can walk just about anywhere. Also, I enjoyed the sun deck on the roof - a great place to relax in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LazyDogsPeople
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Seneca. The location is excellent just next to the John Hancock center and steps away from Michigan Avenue and the Oak Street beach. Our room had some wear, but it was clean and enormous! We had a king suite with a separate bedroom with a walk in closet. The living area was divided into an entry, a seating area, and a dining area with a table. A small galley kitchen with everything you need (including a dishwasher and full size refrigerator) was also included. The value we got from this hotel could not be beat. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Chicago. Note that the hotel now offers self-parking for about half the price of the valet parking. We didn't need our car, so we saved a considerable amount of money with this option.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Romeo6
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried because this was the ONLY hotel I could get at a decent price for a weekend in June. There were some good and some bad reviews. I give it a GREAT review. We arrived early at 2pm and were lucky to get the room early. And...we were upgraded from a standard room to a coporate suite. Huge room, living room area, full kitchen, 2 closets. And a washer and dryer which of course we left un-used. The room was very clean and the staff very polite. Two lights were not working and they came to fix it right away. I would stay here again and it would be my 1st choice. The location was perfect and we could walk, cab or bike anywhere. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Still great after our fifth stay”
Reviews.Author: bluebell88888888
Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel is right behind the John Hancock building - a great location. Every room we have had has been a suite. Comfortable to stay in, conveniently located. The breakfast restaurant provide a good breakfast with lots of choice. You can walk the miracle mile or to Rush Street, take a $5 taxi ride to the loop, even walk to Lincoln Park. Several museums are within walking distance. It is our hotel in Chicago. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “More good than bad”
Reviews.Author: getawaysRus29
Reviews.Content: First the good. Great location, one block from the michigan ave. and one block from the shoreline and walking distance to navy pier(20 min.) Friendly and accomodating staff. Large bedroom and living area to spread out. Warning the bathroom is very tiny, but very clean. The comfortable bed made for a great sleep. Our package came with a free breakfast each morning which was very good. Now the not so good. The furniture was very worn and the carpet had several stains which was unappealing. All and all, we would have no problem staying here again. The price was good and the staff more than made up for any of the shortcoming of this older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Vintage, Botique Hotel Near Watertower Place”
Reviews.Author: AnneInPeoria
Reviews.Content: We spent the evening at the Seneca Hotel after a medical procedure at a nearby Dr. office. The room was a suite; very large and roomy. The bedroom had a full bath and 2 Queen Size (more like full size) beds. There was also a 1/2 bath in the main area. This suite also had a full kitchen with full size refrigerator, and a dining table, loveseat and full size couch. There was a flat scree TV in the bedroom as well as in the main area. The Seneca also offers free Wifi to their guests. One sore spot was the cost of overnight parking at the hotel was $50.00!

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NYADDICT
Reviews.Content: This getaway was for our anniversary. The service received at the Seneca was over our expectations. Firstly I booked with Expedia and got a very good deal (under $100/night) with breakfast included. When we arrived we had a complimentary upgrade to a complete suite (it was like a real appartment (full kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom with 2 beds, 2 TV (one in living room and 1 in the room and 2 bathrooms!!) The person at the desk was very helpful (after upgrading our room, he help us for booking Architectural cruise for us and explain where to find good restaurant in the neighborhood. He also printed our boarding pass because the printer at the office space did'nt work. The Seneca is located just in front of the John Hancock Center, so we went up twice (day and night) to see the City and just 1 block of the Magnificent mile and wakable distance from Millenium Park, Oak Beach, Gold Coast Neighboorhood and Old Town. My WOW was for sure the complimentary upgrade! If I return to Chicago, for sure I will stay at the Seneca again!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST LOCATION IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: yankeerome
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come to Chicago (I know live in Italy) - I make it a point to stay in this hotel. The rooms are HUGE - the breakfast good and the location is perfect. The staff is nice and helpful - so what else do you want???? Also, if you book online you find some real bargains as far as price is concerned....

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, room a little small...”
Reviews.Author: Gary_from_Bristol_UK
Reviews.Content: We hadn't ever been to Chicago before so choosing this hotel was a stab in the dark. First impressions were very good, the entrance is smart, clean and tidy. It seemed "up market". The room was initially a disappointment. It was very small and there was some kind of odour. The bathroom and toilet was very cramped, nevertheless OK for a couple of days. There was a similar sized room (to the bathroom) containing a safe and ironing board. We thought that we had booked (web bokking) a room with a kitchen, but we only a fridge (nevertheless useful). I'm not sure who to blame. The room was clean and tidy and the fittings and bed linen were modern, The TV was a modern flatscreen (not sure if HD type). The stopper in the sink was broken and the light in the bathroom ceiling initially was working OK, then on the second day did not work. We reported this to reception and both problems were fixed ASAP. The great thing about this hotel is the location. It is perfectly placed just off (1 minutes walk) "the magnificent mile". The John Hancock building and observation deck is immediately next door. There is a very convenient indoor shopping mall just a minutes walk away. Breakfast was very good. We had vouchers. It was not a buffet, but served by a waitress. Choice was good, with bacon strips, egg, hash brown and toast. One of the better breakfasts we had in any hotel during our stay in the US. Would I return if going back to Chicago -> yes.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: goyandjew
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms with walk-in closets and a kitchenette. Friendly, helpful staff. Cooked to order breakfast each morning. Location, location, location! Reasonable rates

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Sinppu
Reviews.Content: We did not spend a long time in this hotel so we only have a few quick points. Bathroom floor was VERY slippery, so be careful. Friendly service, great location. Very old-fashioned, so for modern-minded guests it might not be a plus. Bargain price, free internet. Some road work outside the hotel which started 8.30, so not good for light or late sleepers. All in all , ok hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sannagran
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Somewhat old fashioned but it made up for that in having great service, excellent mirrors, fantastic free wifi, superb location & overall very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Old-World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Jackie555
Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel is a lovely property that exudes a charm and grace absent from today's major chain hotels. Everything about it (except, perhaps, the bed) is comfortable and welcoming. Of course, its location, just a block off of Michigan Ave., is unbeatable. Chicago is a great walking city, and the Seneca is within easy walking distance to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Old Town, and much more. I loved the fact the our room had a small kitchen. It's nice not to have to eat every meal out, and there are a couple of excellent small grocery stores nearby where we were able to purchase gourmet cheese, baguettes, wine, and great salads. Every staff member was pleasant and accommodating, and they all made us feel welcome. My only complaint is a minor one. The beds are quite hard, as are the pillows, and I prefer a softer version. But I fully accept that you can't please everyone, and this would never be enough to make me avoid the Seneca in the future. Kudos to everyone at the Seneca for help making my stay such a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place - and got an insane deal”
Reviews.Author: GoHere
Reviews.Content: I have walked by this property many times on stays in Chicago. I must state first off that I got such an awesome deal by pre-booking this hotel - $69 a night! Yes that is just $69 a night for a great hotel one block off Michigan Ave - right behind the John Hancock building. The Seneca is an older property with full service professional Valet and Bellhops. I like this feature. The gentleman who checked us in on Thursday evening lacked personality but not everyone is a chatter box at 9pm in the evening. The Bellman brought up our bags in a separate elevator as the guest elevators are the wonderful (in my opinion) small type you get in older buildings. Our keys were not working in our door - he promptly opened the door with his passkey - unloaded our bags - and went to get us new keys that worked. He was back in a flash and was friendly and courteous the entire time. The rooms was clean and nice as one would expect in an old hotel - very European feel. Our room had two queen beds, two really great closets - one with nice shelves. A cute little kitchen hidden behind its own door off the main room. It had an apartment size stove and fridge, along with mini microwave, coffee maker and the kitchen tools you would expect. The bathroom again is the size you would expect in an older hotel but ample and clean. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. Nice vent and heat in the ceiling made the bathroom cozy and you got ready. And I like that the window opened to the outside and let in fresh air in the morning. This was true of the windows in the main room as well which we got to open as the wether was mild. The beds are comfortable and the pillows to my liking - softer. The beds could be a bit more comfortable (and I mean a bit softer for my taste). But we still slept well - really no complaints. This hotel is not for those who like the newest, most modern in their hotels. It is a very nice, clean property with European charm. The rooms are ample, love the kitchenette, and in an excellent location. The staff was wonderful and the on-site dining is wonderful. We had drinks "next" door and the downstairs lounge is a must see. The brushetta, wine and chocolate dessert were tops. I will stay again even without the incredible deal - but the hotel offers discounts on a regular basis for those booking early so keep an eye on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!! And a kitchen? Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1980
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after a long flight and was really tired and the girls at the reception were so lovely and made me feel totally welcome here. When I came into my room on the 14th floor I caught myself grinning because it was huge with two comfy beds and a beautiful bathroom (with individual heating! awesome for after your shower! and the bathtub had a whirlpool function!) and a real kitchen! I was thrilled! And the room came with breakfast in the cafe downstairs! I slept very good in the bed and I really liked coming back here after a long day of sightseeing. The location was THE BEST! Next to John Hancock? What else could you desire? A minute away from Michigan Ave? Heaven! Sometimes I came back in between to drop some shopping bags or have a bite and then head out again. The only thing that keeps me from giving full points here is that I found the cleaning lady had a very creative approach to what I would get ;) The day I arrived I had two large towels only, the next day I had the full range incl. the extra small ones, the day after no small ones and the day after half of the small ones. Also, I only had a dishtowel for one day and then it disappeared... I am sure the frontdesk would have sorted me out but it would have just been nice to have it right in the first place. However, I will recommend this hotel to everybody and for sure come back!!

Reviews.Title: “The Seneca is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Familiaturner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Seneca Hotel. First, we met Patrick at the front desk. He was kind enough to let us check in at 10:30 AM. Thanks so much for that! Second, I noticed immediately that all the people at the front desk seemed HAPPY to be there! They were helpful and friendly and gave us assistance - directions to different parts of the city- on a couple of occasions. The room on the 9th floor was beautiful, quiet and large. There was a full kitchen, which we did not use, but that could be great for some folks. The room was immaculate. The beds were comfortable. The closet was large. And, as many other reviewers have noted, the Seneca Hotel is in an unbeatable location. The American Girl Doll store is across the street, as is the Water Tower. Francesca's Restaurant is right next door. We ate there and enjoyed excellent Italian food at reasonable prices. We attended a play "Working" at the theater right across Chestnut Street. The play got excellent reviews and we loved it. Also, the Hancock Building is two doors up. Did I mention free wi-fi? Watch for deals - the Seneca sometimes has special rates. I have no reservations recommending the Seneca. It was fabulous and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutchmanBangkok
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to top staying at the Seneca. The room was spacious, clean, and had everything a business traveler needs. The hotel is conveniently located near the lake for running or near Michigan Ave for public transportation. The hotel staff was very willing to help give information or assistance. Easy to get to from OHare using the Blue Line and then the Red Line to Chicago station with a short walk to the hotel. Overall the reviews on this site were positive and all I can say is you will not be disappointed here. Great value for the money using Easy Click as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: gfcm2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king bed suite April 4-7 and really enjoyed the hotel. Very roomy suite and a nice location right across from the John Hancock Center and the Michigan Ave bus stops. Next time I am in Chicago, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old dame showing her age?”
Reviews.Author: geeper
Reviews.Content: The place is nice enough. Stayed in a queen suite. Very large apartment pretty much. Actually seems that this used to be an apartment building actually. The place is old though metal cabinets in the kitchen, plumbing that sings, old sofas. Can't complain about e price though. Small grocery around the corner is very expensive but convenient

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bongoletti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the perfect location for exploring. It is right next to the Hancock Centre, which is great for a few cocktails on the 96th floor at sunset along with some spectacular views. The rooms are a good size with plenty of closet space, kitchen if you require, a little run down but hey it's Chicago why would you need to cook. I have to say the staff were really friendly and the breakfast vouchers were a nice touch. THe bed was a great size and the rest of the furniture was nice, and a little antique. Well worth a visit and for the price you cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for extended stay.”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this place a better rating because the staff was so nice and smilely. Here is the thing, I hate when my room smells like what ever the last guests cooked in the kitchenette. I spent five days in the room and this smell did not disipate. Other than that the location is amazing, the rooms are very spacious. The design of the room is very classic American early last century. Intertnet is highspeed and free. I would stay here again if I was going spend a long time in the city and wanted to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ClaytonGirl41
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night so I could explore Chicago while passing through Illinois. For $99 I got a queen size bed, a kitchen (with full size refrigerator, microwave, and a small oven), and a bathroom containing a tub with jets (Jets were dirty). The room, and overall hotel, were a little on the older side, however, I didn't stay in my room much because of all the attractions nearby. Next door to the hotel is the John Hancock Observatory and across the street is the Drury Theater. Walk 100 feet from the hotel and you can hop on one of Chicago's famous double decker buses for a tour of downtown. Some of the rooms at the Seneca, like the one I stayed in, is meant for extended stays; that is why I got a good rate on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel on North Michigan avenue”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year's weekend and it was great. The rooms are very large and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small but considering very thing else, that could be overlooked. Every room has a kitchenette as well and in our room all the appliances were brand new. Given that the building is from the 1920's, it does show some wear and tear but, overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Streeterville area.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem In a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: rickyred
Reviews.Content: As we do every December, my daughter and I travel with 2 other family members to Chicago for a fun snowy weekend. We usually stay at the State Street Embassy Suites, but this year, the prices were unbelievable. Then we got this notice from Travelzoo about the Seneca Hotel. The four of us could get 2 suites for less than staying at the Embassy and the difference in price could buy our breakfast at a local restaurant. We paid $99 for a king suite. It was like coming home. First of all, the hotel itself is more like a Europen style hotel. The lobby is warm and comfy. There was a fireplace and every afternoon the Merry Janes came to sing carols while we sipped hot cider and ate cookies. Most of the staff was fairly helpful, others extremely helpful. The service was excellent. We called for an extra pillow and it was there before I put the phone down. The room itself was cozy. We had a king bed, a full living room, dining room and kitchen. My cousin had a jacuzzi bathtub. We had wi-fi and the beds were great. None of us had the backache that comes with staying in a hotel. The absolute best part is the location. You just cannot beat it. The Seneca is directly across from the Water Tower. It is next door to the John Hancock Building and just down the street from the Playhouse where we saw Traces. We were due to return on Sunday, however, due to weather, our flight was cancelled and rebooked for the following day. It was no worries for us as even in the snow, we could walk to the Water Tower and shop all day w/o even getting wet. We will definitely be staying at the Seneca Hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room in the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: RamakrishnaPai
Reviews.Content: I availed a Travelzoo offer & booked a suite for $109 (plus taxes) per day, for 3 days. It was a fabulous suite, real value for money, with a king size bed plus kitchenette, safe deposit locker, etc. Complimentary wi-fi, too. The location, right next to John Hancock Centre & Water Tower Place made it a short walk to the fashionable areas of Chicago. Subway, bus and sightseeing bus pick-up was within easy reach, too. I made friends with the front office staff who helped out in many ways. Late night return, after viewing the city from atop its skyscrapers, was a breeze. I'm happy I grabbed the hotel deal.

Reviews.Title: “For the smart traveler”
Reviews.Author: boilerdawes
Reviews.Content: Why would you spend alot of money for a 4 star hotel when you could stay at this gem? Perfect location,huge suites,great staff. Only negative was the somewhat fuzzy screen on the TV....but who cares. Will most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mprther35
Reviews.Content: After reading through some reviews I decided to try this hotel myself. I was not disappointed. Having booked this room at an incredible price, 53.00 for a single room. I thought how bad can it be?? Upon arrival we were upgraded to a king suite at no additional charge to accommodate my disabled husband! While the hotel might be a little older & the bed a little to firm for me, everything else was great! Staff was very friendly & helpful. The room was very large with a full kitchen & separate living room.The hotel is 1 block from the Miracle Mile & 1 block from Lake Michigan. I even found parking on the street for FREE, thank you very much! Arrived after 8pm & we left before 8am. Parking on the street is free at that time! I will stay there again. Planning a trip back with grandchildren. We will try to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously do not understand the bad reviews...jewel of a hotel, great price, great location, clean and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jrt55857
Reviews.Content: After a two day blur of desperately trying to find a hotel NEAR Michigan Avenue and realizing the Red Roof Inn was the only available hotel (the reviews say the rooms are like a crack house..um, no thanks!) , I printed out an area map and started calling hotels. The online reservation system for this hotel stated there were no available rooms but when I CALLED there WAS an available room. That would be my only negative review of this place. The location is amazing...just around the corner from Michigan Avenue, a 1 minute walk from the Hancock Tower. The outside decor is true to the hotel: solid, sturdy, historic hotel in Chicago. The lobby is nicely decorated and a fire was going in the fireplace. True, the receptionist was not friendly and he was all business but hey, I'm not really looking to make new friends at the front desk. We were upgraded to a Presidential Suite, the room was amazing with a nice sized living room, flat screen tv, dining room and kitchenette, two bathrooms (one with washer and dryer) and a full-sized bedroom with two queen beds. The room was very clean, the noise was non-existant (and we were right near an elevator and our room opened out onto the street). Breakfast came with our room plan and we had a hot breakfast each morning with bacon, pancakes and hash browns. The doormen WERE very friendly and hailed a taxi each morning with a traditional whistle, helped load the luggage and bags, etc. This room charge was just a few dollars more than what we would've been charged at the Red Roof Inn AND it didn't even remotely resemble a crack house! I guess it wasn't total crazy luxury, so if that is what you are craving then you need to look elsewhere AND spend more. I/we are normal every day people who work a regular job and enjoy a little luxury on vaction...so this is right what we expected. But for a really nice room in a great location with nice amenities then you totally need to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy123
Reviews.Content: This was the first time for me in Chicago and I wanted to stay within walking distance of the city, in a place that was quiet but not withdrawn from down-town. The hotel is in an up-market district one block from North Michigan Avenue, half a block from the John Hancock and Water Tower buildings and one block from Oprah's house! At the end of the road in each direction there are restaurants and shops to spend some dollars - especially if you're travelling in from the UK where the currency exchange is great right now. After an early start and long flight to Chicago, check-in was awkward to say the least - the spectacled receptionist barely looked up from the desk to acknowledge us and perhaps grunted when handing me my keys and wireless Internet information. No point in asking this chap for tourist information I thought and not a good start to our visit. We had decided to use the Airport train and 'L' to get to the hotel and after a few wrong stops and one taxi ride later I wasn't exactly in the mood for a receptionist with an attitude problem. On to the room. We booked a double queen which was surprising and much larger than I was expecting and very spacious for the price. The room consisted of two walk-in wardrobes, a large bathroom with jacuzzi tub and a separate kitchenette in addition to a safe, TV, air con and free wireless throughout the hotel. After a long day walking around town it was pleasant to find double-towels in the bathroom - most hotels insist you re-use the towel provided :( but with no radiator this wouldn't be an option. The bed was comfy and there was almost no street noise from our John Hancock-facing room. Sometimes at night though, we could hear the people next door knocking around in the kitchen which was a little annoying. On our first morning down to breakfast we went to avail of the free Continental menu but our travel agent hadn't sent the request through properly and we were suddenly given a bill. After requesting some assistance from the reception desk, a very helpful woman by the name of Kathryn got us back on track. The breakfast menu was extensive and the food was nice and filling - service staff were friendly and welcoming also. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, but there was a small restaurant adjoining the front of the hotel albeit the menu was small and specialised consisting of pasta/spaghetti dishes - alternative options where within walking distance from the hotel. As we had planned for an early departure to our next destination, reception were kind enough to book us a town car to take us to the airport, as I didn't fancy the long train ride with switches so early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dowdy, and noisy”
Reviews.Author: erster
Reviews.Content: There are two good things about the Seneca. The location, as many have noted, can't be beat. And I found the staff quite helpful and obliging on the whole. Other than that, however, I'd give the place a big thumbs-down. I stayed in three rooms over the course of my visit. In all of them, the furniture was old and run down, as were most of the other items -- even the TVs were ancient, not a flat screen among them. The appliances in the kitchenettes were also pretty ancient, and the grout in the bathrooms the worse for wear. It wasn't dirty, but everything looked worn out and run down. The most horrible thing about the first two rooms, though, was the fact that they faced west, looking out over the rear of the Hancock Building. From a very early hour each morning, I was rudely awakened by a steady parade of trucks -- garbage, beer, linen delivery and so on -- that parked on the street below, left their engines running (loudly), and proceeded to thump, bang, crash, and rumble, for minutes on end, and no sooner had one left than another arrived to make the same racket. And if they didn't pull up below, they drove down into the nether regions of the Hancock Building, their motors growling and grinding all the way down -- and back up. The Seneca stands in imperative need of better sound insulation. That goes for the interior, too -- my first room had a connecting door (always a bad sign), through which I could hear the TV of my inconsiderate neighbor (loud but not quite bad enough to complain about) -- plus, in the middle of the night I was disturbed by distinctly audible loud conversation that went on for some time. Finally, on my third try, I got a room that faced Chestnut Street -- and was blessedly peaceful, if equally dowdy. Everywhere, though, wireless "service" was really, really, hopelessly bad. Eventually, I just gave up trying to get connected, since I couldn't get even the ghost of a signal. I'd rather pay for wireless and get better service than receive it free, only to find that it was completely useless. Oh yes, and the fitness center was about as minimal as it could possibly be -- one cross-trainer (with someone on it when I went up there so I had to hit the streets), one treadmill, and some basic weight lifting stuff. Disappointing. If you stay here, bring some earplugs, unless you can beg the front desk to put you on the Chestnut Street side! And don't expect high style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vonnyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seneca for 1 week 23rd - 30th October. We had a wonderful time there. Our room was a lovely surprise it was so big. We had 2 queen beds a seating area to watch T.V. and a kitchen which was a bonus. The bed was very comfortable as was the room in general. The only fault I had were the pillows they definately need to be updated to something more comfortable for slumber. The Seneca is so central to the main shopping area, across the street from Water Tower Place and just behind the Hancock Building could not have asked for a better located hotel The staff were extreamly friendly and helpful especially the doorman. The hotel has two restaurants associated with it Francescas (italian) and the Steakhouse both of which we ate in and thoroughly enjoyed. The Chestnut Cafe was great for breakfast very fast service and everything cooked to perfection. I really don't know what some people were talking about on some of the reviews I read on trip advisor before we left for our trip. We had a wonderful time in Chicago in a fabulous hotel and without a doubt would stay there again. I would definately recommend this hotel. So thank you Seneca for a truly relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with room and value.”
Reviews.Author: DepereItalian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the hotel with daughters aged 14 and 12. We could not believe how large the suite was for the money. There were more closets than we could fill with twice as many people. The bed was very comfortable and we did not hear too much noise from the streets. The hotel itself was very quiet. The kitchen was much more than we expected in terms of size and cookware. Our only complaints were that they kept giving us three items instead of four(plates, towels etc.) and the room was quite hot. Housekeeping was good about giving us requested items, but the heat was never fixed. We had to leave the windows opened. The desk staff was friendly and accomodating. The hotel is in a very convenient spot for shopping and one block from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just off Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: chuckwagon1
