Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel is an older property in a great area of town. It sits adjacent to the John Hancock Tower (on its east side), about a block from Lakeshore Drive. The John Hancock Tower is on the north end of Michigan Ave (the main shopping street in Chicago). The hotel is relatively small, which makes check in and out and breakfast very easy. I am not sure if everyone gets it, but we got free breakfast for staying there. The breakfast is a choice of 4 or five full breakfasts -- very good. I got a traditional American eggs, sausage, hash browns, juice, while my wife had a bowl of fruit and a bowl of oatmeal. The rooms are very small (Euro style) but have a kitchenette (fridge, microwave, and sink). Flatscreen TV (smallish) and a bathroom -- nothing special, but clean. Our room was surprising quiet. I think the hotel has 17 floors, but we were on the 3rd. Hotel is nothing real special, but a good deal for the price. I recommend if you are staying in Chicago central for your whole trip, don't rent a car. Parking can exceed $50/day, depending on where you are at. Take the blue line on the train from the airport to the city and switch onto the red line going north. Get off at Chicago and walk 3 blocks to the hotel. We stayed three days in the city and used public transit and walked just fine. The traffic in and around Chicago is a nightmare if you drive. The hotel is 100 yards from the American Girl Store and the Museum of Modern Art. Don't miss the Art Institute of Chicago -- truly a phenomenal museum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MR4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, we really really enjoyed it & we were sad to leave. The hotel has a very old school charm about it from the doorman to the reception area. We had booked a suite as it wasnt that much more expensive than a normal room & it was huuuugggee!! The rooms are very old fashioned but clean & the bed was super comfy, our room looked out onto the John Hancock building. The doorman was very helpful, advising us of buses to take to the Chicago Bulls game & how to get to Chinatown. The location is fantastic, just a block away from the magnificent mile (not far to stagger with all your shopping bags!!) with lots of bars & restaurants dotted about around it. All in all a fantastic hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place pleasant and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: elainedixon
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews, as we found them extremely helpful for tips on nearby attractions, parking, dining, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 1060WestAddison
Reviews.Content: I booked six rooms at the Seneca for friends and family who joined me in Chicago for a weekend-long birthday celebration. Five of the rooms were booked at an unbelievalbe $99 per night! The sixth room was a late addition, booked the day we checked in ~ the rate was over $200, but the staff offered me a discounted rate because I had several other rooms. The rooms were clean and ridiculously spacious. The hotel it older, however, and the rooms don't have much in the way of frills or extras. That was fine for my group, as we spent very little time in the hotel during our stay. We ate in the hotel restaurant for Sunday breakfast. The food was diner-style and good. We enjoyed it, but I wouldn't recommend it if you are in a big hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca Hotel: Great Location - Beautiful Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EBJ11
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. I had always heard wonderful things about this city so I couldn't wait to go. The Seneca is elegant and in a perfect location - close enough to the action but on a lovely, tree-lined street. The hotel has been here since 1924 and there is definitely an old-world feel. When you enter, you are greeted by a beautiful lobby featuring big puffy chairs and dark wood. After an easy check-in, we went up to our room on the 10th floor. To access the rooms- you need to pass through a secure door that requires your room key for entry, I always find that comforting. Our room was massive....a full kitchen, dining room, living room, 2 walk -in closets, one has a safe (love that !) as well as a coat closet by the front door and a good sized Master but ....what's with the DINKY bathrooms ??! I have been to New York and stayed in a small room/dinky bathroom combo but I have never seen a HUGE suite with such a tiny bathroom. It had the amenities you want and need, it was clean, it had storage ( a floor to ceiling pantry off to the side as well as a medicine cabinet and under-sink storage)- it was just so small ! Given the size of the suite and the obvious care they take of the place...I just found it hard to believe there hasn't been an update for the bathrooms BUT I am willing to forgive and forget when I stay in beautiful, historic hotels like this one The beds were really hard (some people love that- not us !) and as we booked rather last minute- we unfortunately had to take 2 queens instead of 1 king. The only other thing that may interrupt your sleep is the sound of sirens at night- you are 1 block away from a hospital. The Seneca also has Free Internet ( it's a little slow sometimes) and a desk for working as well as a business center downstairs. There is also a nail salon and a dry cleaners. TV is Direct TV so you get a decent amount of cable stations. I must say that I did really love this hotel, a few things weren't perfectly to my liking but I loved the location- just a block from Michigan Ave (Shopping Heaven! ) and across the street from The John Hancock Building ( don't miss seeing the city from the 94th Floor). The staff is friendly and helpful. There are 3 restaurants on site- although we only ate at The Chestnut Street Cafe for breakfast. The other 2 looked great but unfortunately, we had other plans due to business. The decor is elegant and the place is clean.If you require a longer than normal stay, they do offer extended stay options. I just loved Chicago and if you are looking for a quiet, classic hotel that feels more like a home- check out The Seneca- you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: Thunderchief
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca for 2 nights and was very happy with the room. I had a suite with kitchen, refrigerator and loads of wardrobe space, plenty of tv channels, good shower/bath and an iron and ironing board (some people underrate the importance of ironed clothes to make you feel good). It also had a good a/c system. The bed was comfortable and I had no noise issues with traffic/staff/guests. The staff were helpful and friendly (I asked for an extra hour and a half late checkout due to a late flight and it wasn't a problem - no charge either). I was just one block from a shopping centre, a couple of places for dinner and the tourist info centre. A great place to be based at in Chicago (first time visitor to the city).

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hyatt, or the Sheraton, nor the Marriott. Thank Goodness!”
Reviews.Author: Oriolesfan
Reviews.Content: Right on the Website it says â€œNot the Hyatt, or the Sheraton, nor the Marriott. Thank Goodness!â€� and I could not agree more. Thanks to http://www.tripadvisor.com/ and some research I found this gem of a hotel. I stayed here from October 7th â€“the 12th so I could attempt to run the Chicago Marathon. I had never been to Chicago before so trying to find the hotel was a breeze from Midway. I took the Orange line to the Red line at Roosevelt. I got off at the Chicago stop on the Red line and made my way up to the street. From there you take Chicago East until you hit Michigan. Take a left onto Michigan and two blocks up you run into Chestnut and, there you are, in the middle of everything yet hidden away. From the moment I walked up to the front door the Door man held the door for me smiled and told me to have a wonderful day. The ladies at the front desk were nice and without me saying anything asked me if I was running the marathon that Sunday and they struck up a whole conversation with me. I also arrived a good 2 hours before check-in but my suite was ready and I was allowed to go up to my room (901). I had reserved the King Suite since there was a special when I booked the hotel in January. I took the elevator up to the 9th floor and walked to my room. I was impressed with how clean and how nice everything seemed in the hotel. Then I opened my door to my room, AMAZING!!! I was expecting a little suite with a King sized bed and a tiny little kitchen. I was so shocked with all of the room I had in the suite. The Kitchen is a full kitchen with a coffee maker, full size fridge/ freezer, 4 top oven, dish washer and dishes/ silverware. There was a dining table with 4 chairs and a large sitting area that was as big as the room I was expecting. I opened my bedroom door and the bedroom was just as big as the living area plus there was a very nice bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub. I had done my homework and thought that I had found a nice cheap place that would be ok for my wife and me to stay for 5 days, but I had come to find a gem. From the ladies at the front desk, the door men, maids, to the maintenance men every person we met or ran into was incredibly warm and nice to both my wife and I. The restaurant in the basement of the hotel was perfect with a large breakfast and kind servers. The room and the entire hotel were clean and it always seemed like someone was cleaning. The roof top deck was nice to go sit on and look out on the city or to stare at the John Hancock building; you can also see the lake from 2 different areas. The location is amazing! You are right off the magnificent mile/ shopping area, you are within 4 or 5 blocks of the L train (red line). There is a Restaurant also attached in the front of the building which always seemed to have nice cars parked outside of it and was packed nightly. When you are in Chicago you need to have a Deep Dish Pizza and the Seneca has a nice perk that allows you to jump to the front of the line at Giordanos which had a 60-90 minute wait when my wife and I arrived. After the week I had in Chicago it wonâ€™t be if I ever come back it is now When, I come back to Chicago the only place I will stay is at the Seneca Hotel. Clean Great Location and Service, Awesome Bed, Huge incredible bedrooms, great value and without a doubt the only place I would ever stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: MauiLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - can walk everywhere. Helpful doorman. No hotel parking, but lot close across the street no problem. Older hotel, but fits with seeing Chicago and feeling the history of it all. Great apartment feeling and amenities. Italian restaurant on site super also. Book a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a short stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: hayleyhayleyhayley
Reviews.Content: The Seneca hotel had helpful employees, a clean room that included a small kitchen (with fridge freezer, cooker, ample storage room and coffee maker etc) an on suite toilet with a jacuzzi bath, and a good television - and most importantly for me a secure personal safe. The best aspect of The Seneca hotel was its location - we found that we could get to all the major tourist locations in Chicago from the Seneca without the need of a car or public transport (except Chicago O'Hare Airport, which was a short bus and train journey away - but this was easy to pick up from the Seneca). Located on the same crossroads as the Joh Hancock Observatory, its always easy to find if you get lost and it isn't even on a main road to make it noisy for those with a room on the street. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends who are looking for a clean, tidy and pleasant place to stay in Chicago for a tourist's holiday.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Ellinroc
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate ($115) for a suite from Travelzoo. The room's AC wasn't working so we asked to find another room. They switched us to a bigger suite with a separate kitchen, sleeping room and living/dining room that included the Hancock Bldg and Chestnut St. view. -Nice BUT very noisy overnight with loud sirens, traffic, etc. The staff was friendly but hotel is understaffed at front desk. Staff is covering several jobs (checkin/out, consierge, etc.) Tiny restaurant on lower level for breakfast - "OK" (There is a Cheesecake Factory restauruant at the base of the Hancock which was very pleasant - indoor/outdoor seating.) The hotel's Italian restaurant, Francesca's on Chestnut, was crowded and noisy so we went elsewhere for dinner. The hotel is "tired and old" Spotted old carpets with ragged edges need replacing. Also old worn sofas, chairs. The hotel seemed clean - bathroom is small but clean, updated with good lighting there Other rooms were dimly lit. Our favorite amenity was a roof deck with wood furniture - very pleasant to relax with a nice city/Hancock view. The location of The Seneca Hotel is it's main attraction. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Great room, Unbelievable price.”
Reviews.Author: meng101
Reviews.Content: While the Seneca Hotel could not be better located in downtown Chicago it was a truly great experience. Unlike others who have written reviews, I found the staff to all be very friendly, professional and eager to help in any way possible. None of the negative concerns expressed by other reviews did I find to be our experience. Flat panel TVs, WiFi, spa tub, all upgrades from the big chains costing at least twice as much. Our room was clean, neat, well appointed, quiet and very spacious. The bed was as comfortable as any hotel I've visited outside of Hong Kong. Having access and/or the use of a refrig/micro/sink made our stay seem much more relaxing then a standard non-appointed room where running to the ice machine is the norm. Based on our last stay, this is our new hotel of choice when visiting Chicago. My only hesistation in not writing this review earlier is that I wanted to keep this new found "best value for the money" find a secret. Give it a try, and if you find something you want changed, just ask, and I'm sure that the accomodating staff will do their best to resolve your concern.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: drysGeelong
Reviews.Content: The Seneca is in a brilliant location close to both Michigan Ave. and the Lake-front. We found the staff very welcoming and even though we arrived quite late we were upgraded to a suite with a separate bedroom, kitchen etc. The decor is a bit dated and the telephone didn't work but this was quickly fixed. Francesca's Restaurant off the lobby serves great Italian food and they are most accomodating. This hotel is really quiet at night and we had no trouble sleeping. It's not super luxurious but vey comfortable and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected!! A great value!”
Reviews.Author: CharlottesMommy
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a fun extended weekend. We did not know the location of the hotel in relation to places we might like to see but we certainly lucked out. The location is just 2 short blocks off of Michigan near Macy's. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Our suite was huge with a large separate living room and two TVs. The mini-fully equipped kitchen was a nice unexpected pleasure. It offers a 4 burner stove, full size fridge and MW + sink. Very handy. The area was very quiet and like a neighborhood. A quick walk to Michigan Avenue and you are at the Trolley stop (HOP ON-HOP OFF Tour, really informative) for tours or fabulous shopping and restaurants. The bed was comfy and the bathroom adequate but not updated. We're not picky about that sort of thing considering the great price for 4 nights. In the rear of the Macy's building, just across the street from the Seneca is a little convenience shop with chips and drinks. Also a newstand and another little cafe for tea, coffee,salads and pastries and chocolate. In the food court upstairs in this same building you can have a hot breakfast at a buffet before you start your day. While in Chicago we attended the Taste Of Chicago event at Millenium Park- Fabulous! Also went to Wrigley Field and Cubs game-a blast.. People of Chicgo are very friendly and made us feel at home (North Carolina). I cannot say enough about the great time we had in Chicago and the really great place we were lucky enough to stay in. We will likely return very soon and will stay no where else but the Seneca. It is not fancy but quaint and friendly and very spacious. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: ATLParrotthead
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at Hotel Seneca on vacation with a friend. We LOVED our room, it was like a one bedroom apartment. Never heard a peep from anyone in the hall or in the other rooms. The staff was very accomodating. Location couldn't be better. Only negative was that there was a bit of a stale smell in our room, probably nothing a little Fabreeze coulnd't get rid of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgezgin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located next to Water Tower. Excellent mag mile location. We stayed in a double bed suite. The room was huge with living room and full size kitchen. It felt like home. We did not have a car, but I know that parking is very expensive there. If you have a car and want to save money on parking, park somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: larsondl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Seneca on September 9th. When checking in we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom which was a very nice extra. I agree that the hotel is a little old and needs some updating, but it seemed to be clean and very pleasant staff. We wanted to leave our bags there while we shopped the next day and they were very accommodating. The location was very good. Not the closest you can get to the train station, but all the shopping you want is right there. All in all I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: jme2628
Reviews.Content: We had a small "family reunion" at the Seneca Hotel over Labor Day weekend. The room was good size and had two closets, a small jaccuzi tub in the bathroom and a kitchenette. I really appreciated (as a near sighted contact lens wearer) how well lighted the bathroom was and the multiple mirrors in each room. Our relatives shared the presidential suite which was just fabulous. Full size kitchen, 2 large bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, washer and dryer, and large common area. It was bigger than some apartments I've lived in!! The best was the location. Half a block to the John Handcock building and around the corner from Water Tower Place. We could walk almost everywhere. Two small caveats. One valet parking is $50 per night which is pricey even by Chicago standards. We found parking a block away for $29 a night. Second, the breakfast included left much to be desired. I understand the Seneca contracts with a cafe in their building for a free breakfast. Service was surly and ANY substitution from the standard breakfast was charged. We ended up paying $14 for 3 glasses of juice. We ate there once and never again. The experience at the Seneca was lovely, except for that one factor.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected....”
Reviews.Author: Music66
Reviews.Content: We flew in on Thursday and left on Sunday. From the moment we stepped into the lobby, my husband and I were trated courteously and with respect. We got into our suite immediately (even 3 hours earlier than was scheduled) and our room was very nice - very clean and we could have stayed indefinitely because of the full galley kitchen which included a dishwasher, full range, refrigerator, microwave, dishes & cookware. Although we didn't use anything in the kitchen but the coffeepot and refrigerator. "Shirley" from the front desk reception helped us with one small issue in the room and it was resolved IMMEDIATELY! A real hidden gem in this hotel in the "Chestnut Cafe" in the lower level - it was fabulous - only serves breakfast or lunch - clean - priced right and great service. We only found out about it on our 3rd day of the stay - wish we knew about it when we arrived. We would stay at the Seneca next time- when we Chicago again. Finally, the bellhops at the front door (all of them) were gracious, courteous, polite and always helpful if we had any questions about other places to visit. We also had the front desk set up outside tours for us - and that went very smoothly, as well. A GREAT STAY !! To all the staff at the Seneca Hotel - thanks for making our trip a memorable and plesant memory we will have for a very, very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, and parking nearby”
Reviews.Author: Livelikethelocals
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel with friendly service, convenient to Michigan. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon just as an air show was going on over the lake just blocks away. Our room faced the Hancock tower. My greatest issue with staying downtown is the parking. I was able to park onstreet overnight for free, and there was a garage about two buildings east on Chestnut with (relatively) cheap parking for the day. I usually paid to park on the street (but had to return every two hours to pay the meter). To go farther south into the city, I drove and paid parking there for the day. Parking can increase your spending significantly if you don't research your options. I would not valet as it costs about fifty dollars a day. Also, I waited until right before the trip to book this room and got it at a fifty percent off sale and we got a suite! The rooms are worn but for the price and friendliness of the staff, we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn0004
Reviews.Content: Every year my daughter and I go with friends to Chicago. We have stayed here the past four times. We have always had great front desk service and the room has always been clean. We love the location, although we have no problem walking. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Travelmama13
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the service before we arrived! My husband always has many questions, and the staff was patient and answered his questions before we booked. We made a confirmation call just prior to our trip and the person at the desk was helpful and friendly and advised him to ask for her when we arrived (which he did). Our room was one which had just been renovated. We were traveling with a 5 and 6 year-old and really appreciated the kitchenette. The bathroom was small, but had everything we needed, and was CLEAN. We had no view, but were aware that that was a possibility from other reviews. Because we were prepared, we were not disappointed. We did not try any restaurant associatied with the hotel. The location is great for shopping --especially if yoiu have little girls interested in American Girl dolls. Public transportation was a cinch from the hotel too. We called the desk twice for extra linens and towels. They were delivered in minutes. For the location and the convenience of having a kitchenette when traveling with kids, this hotel was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: twinkly
Reviews.Content: Great location - I found we could walk almost everywhere we wanted to go (although we do walk a lot generally), and also very close to the transit system for when we were feeling lazy. I loved the fact we had a full kitchenette in our room - a shame we didn't stay for longer as we didn't get much use out of it. The only downside was that the front desk staff were a bit abrupt/indifferent as though they couldn't be bothered to talk to us - not the great customer service I'm used to in the US. The rest of the staff - doormen, bellhop, etc. were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended despite its good location”
Reviews.Author: alwall
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for two nights and was glad that was all. On arrival the receptionist was not the most welcoming, I even had to ask where the lifts were and where my room was. The room was in dire need of refurbishment, I accept that I got the room at a very good price but it did feel that the room had not been used for quite awhile and one closet smelt very damp. Fortunately the other, larger closet, was OK else my clothese would have stayed in the suitcase. The kitchen was worn, apart from the fridge/freezer which was the cleanest thing in the room. I would not put anything in the cupboards though but as we were only here for two nights it did not matter. The bathroom was very small, the jacuzzi bath was not expected but did not work anyway. On arrival at reception I handed my reservation papers to the receptionist and the following morning I asked where Breakfast was and was told that I had not booked breakfast. Of course, I could not prove this as they had taken the papers off me. I argued this and was then told that I could get a free breakfast but my ten year old daughter would have to pay! I should have argued further but I just accepted this and took the breakfast offered. The staff in the Cafe were polite and a good breakfast was served. The location of the hotel is the saving grace of this review as its location is excellent, right next door to the John Hancock Observatory. I would like to add that the valets at this hotel are very helpful. If I had booked any longer at this hotel I would have checked out but I would not recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anaturegirl
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation through 1800Hotels.com and got a confirmation number but when we arrived at the hotel they had no record of our reservation. They took the time to find out what was the situation and discovered that 1800Hotels.com had gone into bankruptcy. The hotel had been notified but they were not given our contact information so they could not let us know. 1800Hotels.com did not bother to notify us so we did not know of the situation until we tried to check in to the hotel. I want to say that the hotel did everything possible to get us a room at such late notice and were understanding and helpful. The room was very nice, clean and quiet. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very close to transportation and the hotel staff helped us with understanding the bus and train routes. The restaurants in the building were very good, too. I appreciate the help that the staff provided us in this unpleasant situation. I will certainly stay with them again when in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ramona78
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location, room was very clean, great houskeeping, my only complaint would be a service at the front desk, when checking me in, the African American lady said something looking straight at me, I haven't understood her so I asked "excuse me?" and she replied: "I am not talking to you, am I talking to hetr" (pointing at her co-worker. I find it very rude because of the tone of her voice. The rest of the staff were very helpfull. Other than this little episode our stay there was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dated with bad service”
Reviews.Author: CUTrip
Reviews.Content: Not a good place to stay. The front desk staff, while not outright unfriendly, obviously have other things they would rather be doing. Both the decor and the furnishings are tired and need to be replaced. The wallsan d the wodden furniture in my room were scuffed up. The miniblinds(!) to the window in the bedroom were missing a control and could not be adjusted. Carpet was ragged at the door to the bathroom. Wireless was slow to the point of being useless, I could surf faster using my phone. Finally, and worst of all, I have some mysterious bites on my legs. I don't know for sure that they are from bed bugs, but I do know for sure they are not mosquito bites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bathroom too small”
Reviews.Author: chuckster_dude
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel 5 stars but I had the smallest bathroom known to man. My room was at the end of the hallway so maybe that had something to do with it but the toilet was wedged into a corner with the wall jutting out in front of it -- you couldn't sit on it straight. The sink was too small to put anything much on it. But on the other side of the wall where the tub is located was a HUGE walk in closet. I couldn't stand in front of the sink and open up the door. A poorly planned out room. The rest of the room was spacious and really nice. The galley kitchen had all the amenities and the sitting area was spacious (although pillows on the couch would have been a nice touch). The bed was big and there is plenty of storage. The free wireless Internet is a nice bonus, the free breakfast was a good touch (I didn't partake) and the location is just 1 block from some of the best shopping in the world. But please......do something about the bathroom size and design in your basic room. If it was better, I would have given a 5 star review,

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Seneca!!”
Reviews.Author: lobrown
Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel will ALWAYS be my choice hotel when I'm visiting Chicago. It's only two blocks off Lake Shore Drive, 1/2 block from the Hancock Observatory, and 11/2 blocks off Michigan Avenue (The Magnificent Mile). It was only three blocks from the Red Line subway, and a short taxi ride from the Loop! LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! The hotel staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful with directions. My room was very inexpensive, quiet, and contained a FULL kitchenette (Stove, Microwave, Fridge and Sink). Plenty of closet space; nice bathroom; WIFI; and satellite T.V. I HIT THE JACKPOT WITH THIS SELECTION!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem just of Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: dsjohuang
Reviews.Content: Located next to the John Hancock Building, it's right off Michigan Avenue. It's walking distance to all the great shopping place on Michigan, plus close enough to the el if you needed it. I was on a "girlfriend's weekend" trip. The room I shared with my girlfriends had a tiny kitchenette that was enough for us to heat up food and have our midnight meals. The rooms are quiet and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Clean bathrooms. The decor is elegant, staff are friendly. There's a small restaurant for breakfast on one end and an fancy Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel on the other end. I love the fact that you need your room key to get into the elevator area. Made me feel safe and that they take guest security very seriously. For the price I paid, Seneca went beyond my expectation. I'll be staying here again when I'm coming to Chicago. It's truly a hidden gem 1/2 block off Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, charming”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBlf
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the Seneca Hotel is the large rooms with old-fashioned character. They're not cookie-cutter rooms like at a big chain hotel, so it's hard to describe them in general because the one in which we stayed might be a lot different than the one you end up in. We had two rooms in our party, and each had a large bedroom and a big sitting area. Each room had its own TV, and the sitting room had a sleeper sofa. Each room also contained a kitchen area with a fridge and small stove. It's hard to imagine doing any real cooking there (and given Chicago's great restaurant options, you probably wouldn't want to anyway), but it's a good place to store and reheat leftovers or fix a quick breakfast. True to the hotel's nature, the kitchen in one of our rooms was quite a bit bigger than the one in the other room. The bedroom in one of the rooms had a walk-in closet, and the amount of closet space in general was remarkable - way beyond what just about anyone would need. The bathroom was nothing special, but the shower was hot and the water pressure strong enough. In our room, the air conditioning wasn't working so well - the sitting room was much cooler than the bedroom. That's kind of a problem in the summertime. We had the thermostat set at 65, and the temperature in the room never got below 75 - tolerable, but a little uncomfortable. The hotel has a very nice rooftop sundeck, which you access by taking the elevator as far up as you can and then walking up one flight of stairs. There are tables and cushioned chairs and lounges on the roof where you can gaze up at the Hancock Building or out to the lake. It's a nice spot for a drink or relaxing, and it's cooler there than it is at street level. The exercise room is also on the top floor. It looked a little small and stuffy. Valet parking at the hotel is $50 a night, which is expensive but pretty standard for hotels in that area, unfortunately. It's worth noting, though, that there's a self-park right next door that's $32 for 24 hours and one a little further down the street (east) that was $29 and an easy walk to the hotel. So unless money isn't an issue or you want your car brought directly to you, you don't have to pay $50 to park. There are a couple restaurants in the hotel (my brother, who lives nearby, has been to the steakhouse and loved it), and the Water Tower shopping center nearby has a food court where you can grab some quick eats that are a lot better than fast-food quality. The hotel staff seemed nice enough, but when we discovered late at night that there was no bedding for the sofa bed, we had to go down to the front desk to get it ourselves because housekeeping was closed and the person downstairs couldn't leave the desk. The folks at the desk said they could also make tour reservations for you so you don't go for a tour and find it sold out. Location-wise, you're just a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue, but it's a fairly quiet and safe area. It's about a 25-minute walk down Michigan to the river, if that helps orient you. There are many more expensive hotels close by with more features, but the Seneca is worth a shot if you like places with character and rooms where you can really spread out, or if you need kitchen space. I chose it specifically because of its location, but even if I didn't need to stay in that exact area again, I wouldn't be disappointed to get the Seneca on a Priceline or Hotwire booking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel within walking distance of lake.”
Reviews.Author: sgyorkos
Reviews.Content: When we arrived and checked in, the man at the front desk was very nice. He gave us a map of the area and answered all our questions. We were given free breakfast voucher for the restuarant downstairs. We reserved a 2 bedroom suite and it was very roomy. It had 2 1/2 bathrooms, washer/dryer, kitchen, dining room, living room area with pull out couch. The hotel is located in an area that seemed pretty safe. There was usually 2 doormen outside when we came back. You had to have your key to get to the elevators so no strangers roaming the halls. There is a rooftop lounge area that gives you a great view of the John Hancock building right next door. The American Doll store is across the street and other stores and malls are within 2 blocks. We walked down to the lake and then on down to the Navy Pier(which was a pretty good hike). From the navy pier, we got a water taxi ride over to the Shedd Aquarium. We had a very nice stay in Chicago and would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel off Michigan Avenue. Great Rate!!”
Reviews.Author: LuxTravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to get such a great deal off Michigan Avenue! We booked the Seneca Hotel on Tickfolio.com for $129 per night! Coming from NY this was a great deal, not too mention June is the busiest month in Chicago for conventions! The Hotel is located directly next to the John Handcock building (which is a great place for dinner or a cocktail-bar/lounge is located on the 95th floor which is also an observation deck. Kinda pricey but well worth the view!). We arrived Friday and departed Sunday. The Seneca is and older historic hotel. Very well maintained. Staff was friendly. Housekeeping did a good job. Hotel had a great steakhouse!!! Overall, we were happy (except for our Cab driver that accidently took us down a one-way street!! Yikes!). We will be back to Chicago around the November and will look for another hotel deal on Tickfolio and/or book the Seneca direct.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: K-teacherEM
Reviews.Content: My sisters and i just returned from Chicago where we stayed at the Seneca Hotel. Two of my sisters are 5 star hotel kind of girls. I booked the Seneca for us and was a little nervous about their approval. When we arrived we were greeted outside and the car was parked in valet parking. Check in went smoothly. The lobby was charming and inviting. We went to the fifth floor where we found our room. We stayed in one of the queen suites. Upon entering the room my sisters were quite impressed with the charm and space the suite had to offer. The room was clean and very spacious for the four of us. It displayed all the character and flavor of an European hotel. We spent one afternoon relaxing and having a picnic on the sun deck. The hotel was centrally located. We were able to walk wherever we needed to go or could catch the L a couple of blocks away. Our one complaint was the service at the front desk later in the evening. We called and asked for extra towels. The lady who answered the phone was very distracted and laughing and talking with someone else while at the same time trying to address our phone conversation. She finally said that she would send someone up with some towels. After about an hour wait we called again. When we called she said she would send someone again and that she had sent them to the wrong room. Our towels arrived shortly thereafter. We said something about going to the wrong room to the person who brought us the towels and he said this was his first request for more towels. Probably if the front desk would have been concentrating on our phone call the first time that would not have happened. All in all we were pleased with the place and due to the convenient location and the size of the rooms (although since there were 4 women we could have used 2 bathrooms) we will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “poor renovation”
Reviews.Author: ChristaW1
Reviews.Content: this hotel should do a complete renovation and try to find new solutions for their rooms. some bathrooms are extremely small (too small)

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hotel in a great location at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: BrianBinCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific and affordable hotel just two blocks east of Chicago's Magnificent Mile (i.e., Michigan Avenue). The rooms are nice and quiet and the staff is great. The room I stayed in had a stove, microwave, sink, and large refrigerator so you could prepare your meals. (However, there are so many great restaurants near by I didn't use them much.) I could even see a tiny bit of Lake Michigan from my room. :) I also want to mention how great the staff is. When I finally got to my room very late at night I noticed the bulbs in both lamps were burned out. I called the front desk assuming they would fix it in the morning. However, they came up in a few minutes and fixed the problem immediately. My only complaint is that the WiFi ranged from very good on most nights to almost useless on two. (I had to change the network several times to maintain a connection.) However, both nights it got better as the night wore on. By the way, when you stay there make sure you go to the Signature Room in the John Hancock Building, which is right by the hotel. You get a great view that's cheaper then the observatory. Brian

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Room, Hated the Service”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I have a love-hate relationship with this hotel. When we checked in, we loved seeing the nice room with a kitchen, fridge, microwave and cooktop, etc. And the bathroom looked clean and remodeled, and the bedroom had two queen beds. So, to find such a place in a prime tourist location like this (right behind John Hancock building, next to Water Tower Place Mall) at the $100 price point (a bit more or less depending upon where you buy it), is unusual. So, we were initially very happy and I would have given this place five stars. But then, as my time went on, I began to notice how really bad the service is here. Doormen who stand there and let you walk in with a bunch of stuff and don't do anything. People at the front desk who just chat with each other and neglect to notice you are standing there. And then, even worse, people who masquerade as knowledgeable about their terrible Internet service who are "trying to help." I told them from the moment I walked in the door that they needed to reboot their wireless access point near my room because it was going on-again, off-again, and the guy said he would do it. He gave me some kind of goofy wireless-to-ethernet box and told me it would improve things, and an 800# for support. Two hours later, I find out from another front desk person that this fellow "doesn't know anything about the Internet . . . we don't use those boxes any longer." Let's face it TripAdvisors . . . This is a nice room, but hey, if you can't do a lick of business because you have to invest hours in getting setup, it's not much of a hotel. Finally, on the last day, I asked for the manager. He needed to wait until an "internet operations person" came in hours later, but at least he got someone to reboot the access point. Sure enough, the last two hours of my four day stay worked great. In short, great hotel for tourists who don't need the Internet, a good buy, but NOT a business hotel in any stretch of the imagination. I lost money by staying here, something that wouldn't have happened if I had stayed in a place with a solid net connection.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca Presidential Suite: Value and location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippervoyageur
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 took a 3-night trip to Chicago during spring break and stayed in the spacious 1-bedroom Presidential Suite at the Seneca. Our rate was a "stay 2 get the third night free" rate booked online, and included breakfast for two daily. Wi-fi Internet access was included with the room rate, a nice perk that not every Chicago hotel includes without an additional daily fee. The suite was like having our own apartment in Chicago, an enjoyable home away from home, and very reasonably priced given the size, features, and location near the northern end of the Magnificent Mile. Our suite overlooked Chestnut Street and the Seneca's entrance. Occasional traffic noise carried up to our room and the garbage trucks sometimes were out fairly early in the morning making the rounds, but we didn't intend to sleep in anyway when there was so much to see and do in Chicago. The suite was clean and had a traditional decor with Queen Anne style furniture. The bedroom had 2 beds, supposedly queen size but they seemed smaller than queens, more on a par with full size beds. The bedroom also had 3 closets, safe, wing back chair, dresser, and flat screen TV. The master bath was small but not claustrophobic (unlike the suite's half bath - more on that in a moment), with a jetted tub/shower combo, marble tile, granite counter, linen closet and under sink storage cabinet. There also was a tiny half bath with pedestal sink and commode off the hall between the bedroom and living room. The half bath was a hoot in terms of maneuvering in and out without catching the door on the commode. The trick was to either leave the lid and seat up if you wanted to fully swing open the door, lol, or to maneuver oneself around the partially open door for clearance. The living room had a sofa (not a sofabed), love seat, and coordinating wingback chair, coffee table, and entertainment center with a second flat screen TV. The dining area opposite the living room area had a floor to ceiling mirrored wall and dining table with seating for 6. A galley style kitchen was equipped with top freezer style fridge, dishwasher under the sink, toaster, coffee maker, electric stove with bottom oven, basic pots and pans, dishes, glasses, and silverware. A desk and office chair and walk-in closet were immediately adjacent to the suite's entry door, and there even was a china display cabinet with blue and white porcelain along one wall to add to the suite's formal yet home away from home feeling. The Seneca's location was perfectly situated for our shopping and sightseeing intentions, just across a side street from the John Hancock building, kitty corner across the street from Water Tower Place and the American Girl Place (a big hit with our two daughters), and a block from North Michigan Avenue shopping. Public transit bus stops were also an easy walk from the Seneca, and included routes to the Museum campus among other bus routes. Taxis were readily available as well just steps from the Seneca's front door and easily flagged down by the doorman. The Seneca's front desk staff were friendly and courteous, and the same was true of the doormen at our every coming and going. We will definitely keep the Seneca at the top of our list for future trips to Chicago. Its winning combination of location, spacious suite, and value would be very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca Hotel treats you like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: JananaBanana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca for a girls getaway weekend in April 2010. I booked thru Travelzoo & got an incredibility crazy-low rate for our Presidential Suite. The huge, quiet, comfortable suite was elegantly decorated & had kitchen, dining room, living room & separate bedroom, & bath & a half, & everything was very clean & fresh,,,impressive! We loved having a spacious suite! The staff was genuinely friendly & sincerely caring & concerned that our every need was met to our satisfaction. The cafe downstairs serves delicious breakfast & lunch. An excellent Steak house & an Italian restaurant are on the first floor of the Seneca & a small, but pleasant work out room on the top floor. We loved the Seneca & would stay there again! Convenient location, great for shopping, about a block east of Michigan Ave., on the northern end of the Magnificent Mile, the Water Tower Plaza & Hancock Bldg are across the street, also close to art museum. We also recommend taking the Trolley tour, which is a block south, by the visitors center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Comfortable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: irish2171
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the less impressive reviews on this hotel, I was beginning to be fearful of staying here. However, upon arrival, the valet and bellhops were very attentive to our needs. They were so friendly and didn't rush us and were more than helpful with our questions. The front desk staff was pretty nice but after the valet and bellhop service, their attitudes paled in comparison. However, I also work at a service area of a business so I can easily forgive some shortcomings. The room and all areas of the hotel that we walked through were very clean. Our 2 Queen Suite was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. With a full-apartment sized kitchen, we had everything we needed for snacks and bottled water. Kitchen came with microwave, stove and cook top, apartment sized refrigerator & freezer, toaster, dishwasher, coffee maker & serviceware. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room but with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: Iowan4
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the king size suite --- full kitchen, bedroom separate from living room. Kitchen has a dishwasher but hotel doesn't supply dishwasher detergent. Couch had no legs. You sit way down almost on the floor when on the couch. Outstanding location - a block from Magnificent Mile with Water Tower Place, Bloomingdales,Cheesecake Factory Restaurant, Best Buy, Bistro 110 (to-die-for French restaurant!!). Walgreens has many grocery items- only 3 blocks away. Staff friendly and helpful. Secure. Key needed to get to guest elevator. Washers and dryers for guests. I had no trouble with Internet on 8th floor on any of 5 days there. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bradbel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca last November and thought it was a real find. This time however, I stayed in one of their renovated suites. Holy moley, the suites are very tastefully done, with large kitchens and whirlpool tubs. This, all about 1 1/2 blocks from Michigan Ave. This is a real treat especially for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Large Rooms with kitchens”
Reviews.Author: debbill72
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the last 7 yrs or so, great price for the location right off of N Michigan Av, able to walk to resterants,art museums and galleries, lots of shopping nearby.Able to cook in the room if you want, and a full breakfast was included with our rate.Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scrappinmad2005
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at this hotel during our vacation in Chicago. It was just a short walk to Michigan Ave and all the wonderful shops, sites, and museums. Great value for such a wonderful location. We were put in a spacious room when we checked in, complete with a full kitchen, however the bed was terribly firm, so after one night of trying to just deal with it, the next morning I asked if we could be moved to a room with a softer bed. The staff was so very friendly and actually upgraded our room to a suite which had 2 very soft queen sized beds, making the rest of our stay all the more wonderful. The suite was stunning! We felt very spoiled. Also, there is a darling little restaurant downstairs that serves terrific food!

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate accommodation in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ollip1307
Reviews.Content: near all important sights, friendly staff, clean, we were upgraded to a kind of honeymoon suite without paying more

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Chicago's Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Th3HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca for 3 nights in Jan., 2010 after booking directly with the hotel's website in Oct. A few months later, the room rate dropped for the same travel dates & we asked about an adjustment. The hotel refused to give us a credit or free breakfast but did offer us a newly renovated room. Since there were 4 adults in our group, this was attractive to us since a larger room/suite would give us more space. We arrived early since we had an AM flight & were delighted to be checked in immediately. After reading several reviews of late/delayed check-ins at the Seneca, this was a pleasant surprise! However, when I saw our room I was quite disappointed. This was definitely not a newly updated room--old, small bath & kitchenette, no table or chairs so you had to sit on bed to watch tv or eat. It was relatively clean although hot water was in short supply. Overall, the hotel lobby & common areas (hallways, elevators & dining) are charming and remind you of a hotel from the turn of the century. Call me old-fashioned but customer service is still #1 with me and having to call multiple times for towels (they brought pillows instead) and not receiving the room upgrade we were promised (or at least a rate adjustment) implies that the hotel management does not value its customers. There are many hotel choices in Chicago so attention to the 'fine points' means return business and customer loyalty. We might try the Seneca again because of the price & location but wish the service was more like Hotel Monaco or The Drake (where we've stayed in the past).

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly spacious rooms with kitchen, fantastic downtown location - what's with lousy customer service!?”
Reviews.Author: Hamachi17
Reviews.Content: I was beyond impressed by how huge the suites were - our 2-twin-bed room had a suite with 2 sofas and tv, a dinner table, and a full-blown kitchen! I've stayed in Chicago in many hotels, and none of them offered anything like it, especially in this prime spot! On the downside, parking is a robbery in broad daylight, and customer service is non-existent. I'd forgotten my glasses on the bedside table, and called the desk several times to ask if they found them. No response. I ended up stopping by the hotel on the next trip to Chicago a week later, and spent an excruciating half-hour with an arrogant concierge who could not care less about anything. Only after the next shift arrived did the new concierge pop into the next room, which was lost-and-found, and sure enough, there they were, with the room number and date of my stay. Despite prime location and dirt-cheap pricing ($99 a night, on Travelzoo special), I don't plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! but do not make any phone calls ;(”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel155
Reviews.Content: My impression of the Seneca hotel was very good: staff was highly helpful, friendly and efficient, room was really big, with little kitchen, living room, 2 TVs, etc. the location, I don't think it can get any better! For shopping addicts, its in front of the Water Tower mall and seconds away from michigan avenue and all the other shops! Its also right next to the John Hancock observatory and close to many restaurants, such as the Cheesecake factory. One major black point in my trip was that i had the bad idea to make 2 long distance phone calls of 11 and 14 minutes each. Bill was unpleasant: $195 ! i mean, come on! it was just 2 calls, how can it possibly be so expensive! therefore, if you don't make any calls, you will be fine

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: southcoastpete
Reviews.Content: I had a great time as the Seneca. My room was more or less a suite, bedroom, bathroom and seperate lounge with a kitchen. Kitchen came with fridge, coffee maker, microwave, hob and dishwasher. Only made use of the first three, but it made the place feel like home being able to make myself a coffee. If you don't want to cook, theres a cafe in the basement which I used for breakfast (like the pancakes). Theres also a very good steak restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Oskar
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms and paid in advance at really good rates. We asked for refurbished rooms and they were great____clean, spacious (smallish bathrooms), kitchen etc. The staff were all very good including Corey who helped with email advice prior to our arrival and the location can't be beat. I have stayed at several hotels in Chicago over the years but I would be quite happy to use the Seneca again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fun In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodHowie
Reviews.Content: Classy, clean, quiet, comfy bed and near everything. Yup, it was a block away from Michigan Avenue and across the street from the John Hancock Center. If you want to see the great view on top of the Hancock without spending any money, go to the bar and walk around the window. My room was 401 in the corner (bad view) far away from the elevator. It was a one room suite complete with a full freakin;' kitchen. I paid $139 plus about $20 in taxes per night in mid Oct. 09 but I was part of a wedding party. I think the regular rate for this room was higher. When I checked out, I left my bags with the concierge to be picked up later in the day. No charge. I remember in NY they charged me for this service and I complained about it. All in all this place is a winner. Hollywood Howie

Reviews.Title: “The best place to spend a couple of days in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mccambridge77
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms at the Seneca to relax for a couple of days after a family wedding. The service from the moment we arrived was fantastic and 3 of us were incredibly lucky to be upgraded. The 4th room did have a problem after the first night, in which the heating didn't work! (it was colder than normal for chicago) We complained at reception and by 3pm that afternoon we had a new upgraded room. Everyone in the hotel couldn't do enough to help us and everyone in chicago is the same. The hotel in close to Macy's, John handcock tower and one block away from Michigan Ave (Golden Mile) We would recommend a 3 or 7 day pass on the CTA (buses, subway and elevated lines) The visitor information centre can be found the otherside of the water tower and you can pick up all the info you need and buy the passes. All 7 of us enjoyed our time at the hotel and Chicago and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price for the location”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: My initial impressons of the hotel weren't that great. When I pulled up in the cab, no bellmen came to help me with my bags, or even to open the door for me. Once at the front desk I was met by a disinterested and dour-faced front desk attendant. Luckily the hotel turned out to be better than those encounters would have led me to believe. It's right near the Magnificent Mile so it's in a great location for shopping and doing tourist stuff. The room itself was clean, but the furniture was older and a bit mismatched (which was fine with me). The point I'm trying to make is that while it's not slick and modern, it is perfectly comfortable. One guidebook I read described it as feeling like staying with your grandma (in a good way), and that's pretty spot-on. The one thing that I really didn't like is that there was no chain lock or deadbolt on the door. This made me feel less than secure. The thing that really bowled me over was the price - I couldn't believe what a bargain it was! I paid just over $100 with tax (booked through expedia) and this even included a decent breakfast at the downstairs restaurant. For the location and price, I think you'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: maryedge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 7 college friends - 3 in a suite, and 2 each in 2 double rooms. It was perfect! The doubles were comfortable, with kitchenettes, and the suite was spacious and well-appointed with a small but complete kitchen, dining table, desk, comfortable chairs and plenty of room to relax. Location was just off Michigan Ave. by Hancock Tower and Water Tower Place. Breakfast in the cafe downstairs was included. Couldn't have asked for a better place. Not luxe, but lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: nwr
Reviews.Content: This is an old apartment building converted to a suite style hotel. Some of the rooms have been updated, some are a bit antiquated, but the suites are huge and have a full kitchen and, best of all, down a quieter side street directly behind the John Hancock Building. It's a perfect location and usually much more affordable than the big chains or boutique hotels. I've been many times and consider it a hidden jewel.

Reviews.Title: “The Seneca Hotel is a first rate bargain!”
Reviews.Author: TriassicJoe
Reviews.Content: The 2 double bed room we stayed in was described by the desk clerk, as one of the recently renovated rooms. I can't speak for the non-recently renovated rooms, so ask for one of the new ones. Our room included a tiny kitchen with stove, microwave, fridge, sink, dishwasher and basic dishes/utensils. Note that there are a couple of groceries with take out food, within walking distance. The bathroom was very clean and relatively new, and included a whirlpool tub that we didn't try out. Beds were very good. The (14th floor) room was quiet, and the hotel has a nice rooftop lounge area (in good weather). The location is totally excellent. It is only a 1/2 block walk to the free 96th floor lounge near the top of the John Hancock building. Another half block and you are on Michigan Av. The Museum of Contemporary Art is a block away, as are lots of shopping attractions. Almost forgot: rate includes a very decent eggs, hashbrowns, toast or pancakes, bacon/sausage breakfast, which will be boring after 4-5 days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Space with Dry Staff : (”
Reviews.Author: susankennedy
Reviews.Content: I was really unsure about staying at this hotel because I wasn't use to stayin in a hotel that didn't have a new modern day comtemporay style to it. But my suite was so spacious and equipped with everything I was very satisfied with my choice. The only thing I wish I would have been better was the staff.. there really were dry and so disinterested that I almost thought about walking out. And I also notice that alot of older people stay at this hotel...But I am glad that I stayed, but this hotel would be fantastic if they could get some upbeat and courteous people to work for them. First time Traveler to The Seneca, Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot close to town”
Reviews.Author: heliumion
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a very good deal through a discount website (can't remember which!). It cost about Â£60 per night, which is excellent value for this city location. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a suite - both the bedroom and the lounge/dining room were huge. We had a kitchen complete with oven, microwave, full-size fridge-freezer, dishwasher, toaster and coffee percolator. It even had an electric tin-opener! The suite was traditionally furnished, with a lovely dark wood polished dining table. The bath had a spa capability, although I didn't try this out, and we had two TVs, both with cable. There were lots of luxury touches. The staff were very helpful, and let us know on the first night that there were fireworks happening downtown. The room was cleaned well every day. On the downside, the whole hotel had the air of being a little shabby, as if it had seen better days, perhaps in the 80s. But with Wi-fi. Also, be aware that you have to pay for parking - about $35 per 24 hours - there are some other parking stations near by that are slightly cheaper, but not by much. It's not worth bringing a car if you can help it. Location-wise, it's close to Michigan Avenue, and about a 20-30 minute walk into the Loop district, or a very quick bus or train ride. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, disinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: e_e_mel
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with a great location and great size rooms (massive!), the only disappointment was that the staff were the most disinterested I have ever come accross. The staff member who did our check-in barely looked at us and later in our stay this same person took a phonecall while answering a question I had asked. We had an amazing rate from Travelzoo that couldnt have been beaten ($79 per night!). I would stay again for the room, but not the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff for incredible value!”
Reviews.Author: bkauffma
Reviews.Content: I don't normally leave reviews, but the staff was so great to me last weekend, that I really must. I was starving and running late on Saturday morning, a day after check-in, and they randomly knocked on my door and brought me two breakfast passes for a nice sit-down meal. They said I forgot to get them upon check-in. I didn't ask for them or call to the front desk, it was completely unaided, so I was amazed and quite thankful. They were patient with me on checkout times too. It's those little things that matter. The King Suite was huge, much bigger than the website shows. It's right on Michigan by the Hancock Tower. What a great deal and great stay.... thanks guys! Brad

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quaint...”
Reviews.Author: kttravelingirl
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for the Chicago Human Rhythm Project and am part of a group that made reservations to stay the Seneca. It isn't directly in the middle of the city which was nice, and seems very upscale when you first walk into the lobby. It is a large hotel (17 floors) and has a very nice sunroof you can see the city from. From what I remember, it was not that expensive to stay at the Seneca. However, I would not recommend the restaurant they have there. My friends and I went for breakfast there one morning, and the staff was rude and didn't help us when we spilled our water. It takes a long time to get checked in here... they must have dinosaur computers. However, if I had to return to Chicago, I would have this as my first pick because of its cleanliness and elegance in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelsal0t
Reviews.Content: Wow....was I suprised after reading some of the "not so good" reviews on this site. I had booked a non refundable (great rate by the way) and was worried after I saw some of these reviews. I stayed at the Seneca for four days and what a treat it was. The front desk staff were friendly, accommodating and always smiling. The room we had was perfect size for the two of us and I found out later (I asked) was not a recently remodeled unit (which a manager gladly showed me a presidential suite...wow...beautiful) but we found it clean, comfortable and perfect for our getaway. Everyone we encountered from the housekeepers to the doormen, were friendly and helpful. We've already planned to include the Seneca when we return to Chicago next year (and we usually stay at the Drake).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location, but needs many facelifts on some things”
Reviews.Author: Janabelle3
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend with my mom on a mother daughter getaway and stayed at the Seneca. First let me say, this hotel is in a great location! The rooftop deck is very nice and what a wonderful part of the hotel to sit and relax at a table or a comfy lounge chair. A lot of pretty flowers too are a nice touch. We got a great value on this room becaue I booked it in advance back in February with an internet rate for $105!! So we were not expecting obviously a fancy room by any means. Our room was roomy and the beds were comfortable. Not sure though if there were other rooms that were more renovated but ours could use a lot of updating. The light switches in the bathroom were pretty dirty and we had to wipe them off, the bathroom door was even grimy as well. Two days in a row we left our room by 10 a.m. and put our "Please clean our room" sign on the doorknob and when arriving back to our room at 4 p.m. (being gone the whole day sightseeing as most people do) our room was still not cleaned. I mean- why still be cleaning rooms til 5 at night when that is when you come back to your room to get ready for dinner? They really need to improve upon that. Our chair in the room was a bit torn, the paint could be updated, and they need to really put a comfy sofa chair in the double bed rooms when there are two people staying in there. There is just one uncomfortable office chair. One more small issue was, when we requested more towels one day, it took an hour for those to be sent up to the room. Not sure why that would take so long? All in all, we would maybe stay here again... it was clean enough, a good value, comfy beds.. but I really hope if we do , we can request possibly a more updated room if they are available, or even just a bit cleaner and a new paint job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great location will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: turkey2009
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better hotels I have stayed in while being on vacation. This was our first time in Chicago and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. It was close to alot of places. We got free breakfast every morning at the Cafe downstairs. The breakfast was good. We had a king size bedroom. The room had a full size kitchen along with a dining area. We also had what seemed like a mini living room. The room was very comfortable for 4 people. I cant think of anything about the room that we didnt like. If we ever come back to Chicago for a vacation we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pie4all
Reviews.Content: Staff was attentive, room was clean, had a great view from the 12th floor. Easy walk to food, shopping, etc. Be sure to try the flourless chocolate cake in the bar! Only complaint is the moody elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price...Great Location..Great Service.. Going back Again.”
Reviews.Author: clemson99
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Seneca for 3 days. The hotel location is great. It's in quick walking distance to a playground which was perfect for my kid (2yrs old). You go one direction and your in the mix of the city, go the other direction and within 10 minutes you are on the water. Great location for the Summer fireworks and you can walk to the Pier and Millenium Park via by taking a quick walk on the lake walking/bike path. Only issue was there isn't much of a window view. That was a little disappointing but I rarely in my room so I didn't miss it much. Also the room is a modern as other hotels, but it's comfortable and big with plenty of room for luggage and kid gear. Also the kitchen came in handy since I didn't have time to always go out to get food. It was like having your own little apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay would highly recommend !”
Reviews.Author: ksrOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal. I went online to the hotel site and booked it for an amazing rate. I paid 76 an eve via travel zoo on the hotel site ! We stayed on the 4th floor. It was a nice room 2 double beds - but it was restored clean with marble and grantie,wonderful kitchenette with fridge sink and microwave with dishes. It had plenty of space for luggage for 4. My husband did complain he could not find a donut shop around for breakfast. In fact no dinners around to speak of ! He went to Starbucks in the Hancock building and paid 10 for 3 danishes which were ok. We did find a nice breakfast place in Bloomies mall which is less than 5 min away before leaving- looked good. We took a bus right in front of the Hancock building - (Seneca entry side) which leaves every 15- 20 min going to the Institue of Science and Industry. I think it was the number 8 - it says Insitute of Science Industry on it ? We were prepared to get a cab when I spoted the bus - what luck ! I bet a cab would of been 30 ea way ! The number 10 goes back every 20 min as well from ithe museum. It was long ride 40 min ea way - but way worth just paying 6.50 for the 4 of us! The CTA buses are great and airconditioned. The hotel is also directrly across the street from Watertower with the American Girl Store which my 7 year old loved. Oh - Giodannos pizza is very close. It is the BEST Chicago Pizza- very busy after 5 though. I would order the pizza ahead of time and them walk over. We ordered when we got there and waited 20 minutes to be seated and 5 more to eat. Michagan Ave is right there as is the Hershey Store and carriage rides with the old Watertower. I could go on and about what a great city and hotel. We parked next to the hotel in a parking garage. It was 34 for 24 hours instead of the valet fee of 48 for 24 hours !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JuliannaKansas
Reviews.Content: I called three times days before our arrival to request an updated room, which they confirmed we were booked on the second floor with an updated standard room. Upon our arrival they had given our room to someone else. However, they upgraded our room to a suite that had not been updated. I was very disappointed until I saw the room. It was perfect, maybe not updated but very clean and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful, our only problem was the internet service. They claimed we were right around the corner from the server, but the internet was not consist and we kept losing a signal. The upper sundeck was relaxing and very well kept. The best was "No Smoking". The location was outstanding, just one block from Michigan Ave and two blocks from Lake Shore Drive. I would definitely book another room at the Seneca

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for travelers on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: gwoodruff
Reviews.Content: My two kids and I stayed at the Seneca Hotel and could not have asked for more for the money. At $99/night it may have been the best deal in Chi-town. The location was perfect and close to shopping, public transportation, and attractions. The hotel is old and a bit dated, but very clean and charming. The staff was courteous and knowledgable. The room itself was GIANT, and included a full kitchen with stove, refrigerator and microwave, and came stocked with dishes and cookware. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Location and Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bjspa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seneca as he had a 3 day conference at the Merchandise Mart. I wanted a hotel that was close to attractions so I had something to do while he was working and was easy for him to get to and from the conference (it was a convenient $6 taxi ride). LOVED: The king size bed, it was so comfortable. The room was a great size. Basically a bedroom and sitting room. The room was clean and quiet. The location is phenomenal, a block away from the Magnificent Mile and main attractions. Across from John Hancock Observatory and Water Tower shopping plaza. What could have been improved: There was only one towel set when we arrived which I thought was odd especially as we booked a King size bed. They organized more towels so that wasn't a big deal. What I found 'interesting' was the electrics. I set the bedside alarm clock and then noticed it was flashing like it hadn't been set. I soon discovered that when I used the light switch I was also turning off the TV, clock and lights... I spoke to Front Desk and they said it was the same issue in all rooms. I'm not sure if our room (806) was renovated or not - it was definitely clean and tidy, but dated. The kitchen was convenient for reheating leftovers. Would I stay there again?? Maybe, but I may see if I can find a deal for a more upmarket / modern hotel in the future - but that's just my taste, the Seneca is still a great hotel in a perfect position.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: catwomanIowa
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here and it was the best. The staff were very helpful and knowledgable. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in so they upgraded us to a king suite that had a living room, dining room, full kitchen and bath, king bed and 2 walk-in closets. It was fabulous! It was a great location. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: NeednSun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with wonderful furniture and only paid $119. The Seneca staff was incredibly kind and helpful and the location was great (close to everything, yet quiet). The kitchen and bathroom weren't anything fancy, but they were clean and efficient. This is a great place for kids that need more room than the average hotel has to offer. Be sure to check out their rooftop deck too, it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ky_tax_man
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Seneca Hotel I have determined that the seemingly inconsistent reviews on this site are accurate. It appears to me that the traveler's perception of this hotel entirely depends upon whether they receive a "recently renovated" room versus an "un-renovated" room. Despite requesting a "renovated room" my wife and I as well as another couple stayed in a room that has been "renovated a couple of years ago" according the front desk. The room as it turned out must have been renovated a decade ago due to the fact that it had many flaws including: an ill-fitting front door (which like one of the pictures uploaded on this site had a gap at the top), plaster missing on the walls, a very musty smell, beds that must have been filled with cinder blocks, bed sheets that must have been filled with dust mites or some other infectious substance that made my wife's eye infected and a bathroom a bit larger than that found on an airliner. On the positive side, the location of the hotel is outstanding, in that, it is in the shadow of the Hancock Building, across the street from Water Tower Place and a block away from the Museum of Contemporary Art. Also positive: the room was a suite with a full kitchen and dining area which was roomy for the four of us; the room had two walk-in closets which was more than enough space for four people's luggage; once I reminded housekeeping that we had four guests in our room they made sure that we had additional towels in our bathroom; the valet service (while very expensive at $48 per night) always had the vehicle sitting out front in a very timely manner; and the Wi-Fi was free and worked beautifully the entire time. Some tips: make sure that you request (or insist on) a "recently renovated" room, check out the rooftop deck on the 18th floor and go to Ditka's restaurant which is two blocks west on Chestnut St.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly The Right Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: two6seven
Reviews.Content: Has a bit of character - not much, but some - but after my wife and I checked in, we went to our room, I lay down to catch a nap after a two and half hour flight, early morning, and there's NOISE. They're -renovating- above us. What? Is that normal? I've never stayed at a hotel like this - I called the front desk. What they told me: "it'll be done at 4" - I don't recommend the Seneca. Bottom line, I was astonished when I set down to rest and there's a jackhammer upstairs...is this the NYC in the 90's? Since I've never heard of this kind of thing - renovating while guests are staying and intruding on their paid-for right to reasonable peace and quiet (if that's debatable, I don't care to discuss it) I had to say "no" to the Seneca. There's a first for everything. The service was fine, although one our faucets broke while we were there - they fixed it within minutes - and the maid service was unobtrusive, consistent, and timely. But the renovation situation. It'll be done at 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: northpaw12
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for the Seneca online and found the lowest rate on their website--$111/night for 3 nights (5/14-17). I was a little hesitant after reading some of the negative reviews but I figured for the price and given the great location, any hiccups would be worth it. We arrived right around 3 p.m. (checkin time) on Thursday and were greeted by very friendly/helpful front desk staff. When we got to our room we were blown away. It was basically a small one bedroom apartment. There was a living room with a small desk, sofa, coffee table, and chair. Then there was a seperate dining room with a dining table and 4 chairs. The most surprising part was the full sized kitchen with a fullsize refrigerator, sink, stove, microwave, and dishwasher. The only thing that was on the small side was the bathroom but it was no biggie because everything was new and really nice. The location is definitely the best part about the hotel and I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Verycentral,clean,comfortable,friendly staff- great value!”
Reviews.Author: Brandy152
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Seneca, was apprehensive after reading other reviews but really rate this hotel.
