Staff very helpful & friendly- located near the John Hancock,michigan ave- near all the main attractions.....i did contact the hotel & got a newly renovated room. The bed was very comfortable and the room a decent size. We did eat in the steakhouse- a steak cost $30 dollars - no veg etc all side dishes are extra... expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed at Seneca over the new year / And I booked a work trip - Business trip bad”
Reviews.Author: djckmc66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older. I had booked a group for work here in October. For our New Year's trip i did get a good deal - $89 so I should not complain too much. The room my husband and I shared was quite dated. Peeling paint, the bathroom fixtures we old - and it seemed to need of repair. The location is great! For this reason, I liked this hote. When I stayed in October (work group) and also over new years, there was an issue with the heat. Too much of it. There were signs posted in the elevator about opening of the windows in your room, and not to do it. In Ocotber, while alone, I DID open my windows - and there are NO SCREENS. But it was SO HOT. Crazy hot. It was also warm over New Years and we also opened the windows. It was so hot.. to the point of sweating. If I got a deal again, I would stay here. I would not spend over $100 a night. When I booked the work group - I believe it was $149-$169 I don't remember.... but what I do remember is that upon check in of the work group - they charged the credit cards for the full trip at the time of check in. I thought that was odd. There was about 2 or 3 that checked out early - and although I let them know in advance - it took 2-3 weeks after me contacting them to get the credit. ALSO, the business facilities are BAD. I had to use their "business center" to print some documents out of my email - I had to print 10 copies of about 4 or 5 email attachments. Nightmare. They charge per page to print. The printer quit working. No phone in the business center. I had to use my cell phone to call hotel front desk. The front desk person came - to no avail. I had to then forward MY emails to the PERSONAL email of the front desk person - she then printed them out. I was not comfortable in forwarding - but at this point had no choice. I then had to wait about 30 minutes for them to be printed. It cost me about $50 to use their "business center"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Polie76
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I decided on a last minute trip to Chicago to celebrate her stag. I've booked Seneca through Cheaptickets.com at 129/night USD. It was very cheap price, since there were 5 of us. When we got to the Hotel the room I booked could only sleep 4 people, but then I only booked for 4 (one of the girls came with us last minute). I've asked at the front desk (Matias, very nice Polish gentleman) if we could change the room and get an extra bed. They gave us a Deluxe Room with kitchen at no charge. I thought it was very nice of them, since it's all last minute. There were some women complaining at the front desk, they ordered a Deluxe Room over the phone for 5 and got a very small room. I figure there is no point in flipping out at the reception staff, since they are in no control of what the reservations are doing. Ok, so here it is. The rooms are small, since the Hotel is older and was build in the 20's. Also, the rooms are not Trump Tower rooms, since the price you pay for it is not over $300. The washroom is small, but it is somewhat clean. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely come back with my husband and kids in the summer. Ohh btw, Chicago is called the windy city for a reason. It's cold and windy, the time of the year we chouse totally wasn't the best. If I come back it will be in the summer..lol Hotel location is perfect, if you are not in Chicago to shop for bargains. There is lots of Resto's around, lots of Starbucks places and a grocery store down the street. Be very careful of the taxi drivers, they try to take you on a scenic route.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Seneca!”
Reviews.Author: Donald R
Reviews.Content: I read all of the negative Seneca reviews and almost backed out, but the great internet deal I received was too good to pass up. The majority of the reviews were positive so I thought the odds of a good stay here were in my favor---they were. Everything about my stay was first-rate. I stayed in an updated room on the eleventh floor, which was nice, clean, quiet, spacious and very comfortable. No problems at all with the hot water. The staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous. The location is ideal. I'll definitely stay at the Seneca again!

Reviews.Title: “Forget Hot Shower”
Reviews.Author: forallofyou
Reviews.Content: Just 1 block off Michigan Ave, perfect location. I had a very spacious 1 bedroom suite. Hot water in the shower is a problem, you have to let the water run for 45 minutes ( I timed it) before you will get hot water. I ran the water as soon as I got up, by the time I was done with breakfast, the shower was ready. Parking next to the hotel cost $32 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “If you like haunted houses you should stay here”
Reviews.Author: jbulth39
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here over the weekend as part of a birthday/romantic weekend trip we were taking away from home. We got a good deal with a gift certificate she won a couple of months before so we didn't pay that much and we figured that the location was so perfect (one block from all the Mag Mile stuff) how bad could it be? In a word, bad. This place was probably the most run down hotel I have ever seen. I found out when we were checking out that the hotel is an old shabby apartment that they are fixing up a little bit at a time. We got the part that hadn't been fixed up yet. The best way I could describe it would be; if you remember the first apartment you moved into after you left college, this place is just like that but with all your grandmother's furniture in it. The fixtures are cheap and ancient, The cabnets and dressers were low quality, didn't work and were falling apart, all the doors and windows looked like they were on their 100th coat of paint and were ill fit. Basically a dump that got cleaned up a little bit more than usual. The worst part was you could see where they made repairs and the work that they did was HORRIBLE. If you combine the overall state of the room with the decor it was like you were the person who moved into the Adams Family mansion just after the realtor cleaned up all the cobwebs. Needless to say there wasn't any romance about the place and when my fiancee refused to take a shower in the morning because she was too creeped out we decided to check out instead of staying the extra night. The gentleman at the front desk explained that about half the rooms have been completely rehabbed and are nice but when those are taken they give out the old rooms. We got an old one. Good thing we got a deal.

Reviews.Title: “don't count on sleep...”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinchicago
Reviews.Content: I don't know if its because I paid a cheap price on orbitz or what but this hotel is HORRIBLE. I state IS because I'm currently on my first night here. I had to call down because I could hear the entertainment from the bar at 11 on a Thursday night, THEN i discovered I didn't have noisy neighbors, but my room is next to the laundry/BREAKROOM!. I called (@ 2 in the morning - I'm currently awake) to see if I could change rooms and the front desk person stated, "I'll make a note of it and see." OH, and the sheets are so cheap, I have to lay one of my tee-shirts over my pillow because they are so rough on my face. DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Senseless to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: KentRenshaw
Reviews.Content: Considering the proximity of the Seneca with Water Tower Place, the Hancock building (and Cheesecake Factory) and 900 shops (all within a block and a half on Michigan) there is nowhere else that is closer. If you just have to have THE finest, then don't stay here, go to the Omni or the Sheraton and pay out the wazoo. But if you are looking for a bargain look no further. Some will complain about this place no matter what. Either they went into the deal wanting to complain and didn't even ask for anything to be corrected OR they always pay top dollar for the very best, even though they could have gotten it for half the cost at a discount store. (but wouldn't be caught dead in a Walmart) The Seneca is in a state of renovation. An older 17 story apartment building that the owners are overhauling a few rooms at a time. If you aren't happy with the room you get just ask for a different one. I asked some questions and they gave me keys to five rooms to pick the one I liked best. As this building is not one of the standard cookie cutter hotels, the differences in rooms are tremendous, so don't give up until you are HAPPY! That's the way they want you. So if you aren't happy, it will be your own fault unless, of course, you are one of those mentioned above who basically enjoys complaining. Bedrooms in the suites either come in a single King or double Queens. I found that most Queen suites were nicely renovated, but some Kings not quite as nice so far in the renovations. A group of us go to Chicago for a business/shopping trip every December for 4 nights. In staying at several differing hotels over the past 8-10 years, this was the first time my wife didn't mind laying around in the room. She didn't leave the room at all one day. Hugh bedroom, full living room with dining area and full kitchen complete with microwave, full sized stove, dishes, silverware, glassware and cooking stuff. (It even had a dishwasher) I'm not telling all the little secrets here because you will know where the plums are and may be there before me next December. Clean, somewhat dated, but in a charming way. Wonderful staff and we get a hugh suite (about 900 sq ft) at less than half the cost of a single room at the next best place we've found. If I had any beef at all, it would be about the quality of the furniture and TVs. And I am sure they will upgrade in time. But needless to say, we will look no further from here on out. It will only get better with time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Coastal-Confessions
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding in the family. The family chose the Seneca. Instead of booking through the hotel, we found a rate on Travel Zoo for $99 a night. After reading the reviews, I was dreading the possibility that we had made a bad decision. As long as you are not expecting a world class hotel, The Seneca provides a great value. CHECK-IN---We had an early flight and arrived 4 hours prior to check-in. The front desk staff was a bit distant, but not rude. Surprisingly, we were given keys to our room and allowed to check in early. ROOM- The King Suite was huge (it was formerly an apartment as the hotel was built in the 1920's--Layout included a full-size, but narrow kitchen with a built in dinette, dining room with table for 4, living room with TV, seperate large bedroom with king bed and TV, coat closet, walk-in closet in living room, large walk-in closet with safe, small bathroom with small tub/shower. FLAWS--Don't expect the Hyatt Regency, the room did have cracks in the bottom of the sink, some chipped paint on the mirror on the medicine cabinet, missing molding under the sink, etc. However, I am a big stickler for a CLEAN ROOM and the shower, carpet, bedding, etc were all clean. For the value, I can overlook wear and tear if the room is kept up. Our keys did have to be reset after normal check-in hours the first day. The water temperature did change in the shower, but not too a scalding hot or freezing cold level. LOCATION--Especially for shopping, you are not going to get a better location for the value. The hotel is directly behind the Hancock Tower (new Best Buy flagship store in the works, Cheascake Factory as well), It is adjacent to the Water Tower Place which includes Macy's, American Girl, and an indoor mall. It is less than a block down Michigan to the 900 shops which include a mall and Bloomingdale's. The rest of Michigan Ave. is a short walk away. There is also a market for food purchases in the basement of a building one block away. The Museum of Contemporary Art and a small park are two blocks away and Lakeshore Drive and Lake Michigan are 4 blocks away. SAFETY--We never felt unsafe in the hotel. The area outside is friendly (There's a Ritz Carlton in the Water Tower Place and a Four Seasons on the other side of the Hancock Tower. There is a key card access required to access the elevators from the lobby area. Additionally, the in-room safe is a plus. OTHER--There is a small fitness center on the 18th floor with cardio machines, dumbbells and a universal machine. The rooftop patio was closed for the season. I enjoyed previous stays at the Hyatt Regency, Marriott, Hilton, and Hampton Inn in Chicago. However, if you are looking for a value, consider The Seneca.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: oztourist42
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a good location, room was huge and for chicago hotels it was reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: flynndodgers
Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel was a good choice for a downtown Chicago hotel. The room was clean, and the kitchen in the room was good for bringing food back to the hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent, just across the street from the John Hancock center and located right downtown. Overall, pretty good hotel, and excellent locatio and value for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and shows it”
Reviews.Author: beachexpertise
Reviews.Content: First, the positive--The Seneca is in a great location,we had a very large, clean suite with bedroom, living room, dining table and full kitchen (which we didn't use). Negatives--Thin, skimpy towels and not enough for 2 people. Bathroom was tiny, plastic sink had multiple cracks and water pressure was very low in shower. AC had already been turned off for the entire hotel and the weather was warm. As a result, the room was hot and we had to open windows --which didn't help much. Street noise because of open windows. The bed was hard as a board, which made sense as there was a board built into the box spring! Pillows flat and worn. No black out drapes and some blinds were ripped and broken. Worst of all, the room and overheated hallways reeked of sweet -smelling sachet/air freshener/ cleaning fluids which was cloying and very unpleasant. There is no excuse for any of this, regardless of price. Management should get their act together and spend some money on amenities instead of the doorman's spiffy uniform.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Seneca”
Reviews.Author: 5KSTravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago and had a wonderful three-night stay at the Seneca. I have to admit that even though I got a great deal on a king suite ($109/night) and queen suite ($129/night) through a TravelZoo offer, I was a little hesitant about booking at this hotel after reading mixed reviews. Much to our delight, our fears were unfounded when we arrived. Although we had requested rooms on high floors, when we arrived the only space available with the two rooms we booked was on the second floor. However, we quickly got over that disappointmet when we saw the rooms. Both looked as if they had been fairly recently updated. The huge open living room/dining room space, with full kitchen and a bath and a half was perfect for our three girls who shared a queen suite with their grandmother. The king suite we had was superb! I think we may have received an upgraded room, since we requested both rooms on the same floor. Ours was a corner suite that in addition to the above listed amenities also had its own washer and dryer. Not that we really used the kitchen or laundry, but it was nice to have both. The one feature that prevented me from giving this hotel five stars was the fact that our room was directly over the bar/lounge area. And while live entertainment is probably appreciated by the bar patrons, it was a little noisy when trying to sleep at 1 a.m. However, we forgave that distraction quickly because we really did want to be part of the active Chicago scene :) Our location also afforded that feature, being steps away from the Hancock Center and Michigan Avenue. Our girls especially loved being just across the street from the American Girl Store, too! Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family and we will stay here again if/and when we return to Chicago. My advice to anyone who isn't satisfied with their room - request a different room. We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and willing to accomodate our wishes when possible. For the price and location, this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: lapil40
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the Seneca hotel and the staff my husband and I were expecting the worst. Thankfully that was not the case for us. Upon our arrival we were greeted by the Doorman and Valet. Both of them were very courteous. We used the hotel valet parking for the convenience. Driving in downtown Chicago is quite an experience. The Bellman helped unload our luggage and waited for us to check-in. There was no line to check-in. We were assigned a double suite on the 9th floor. Our suite was very spacious and clean. We knew the Seneca is an older hotel so we didn't expect to find brand new furnishings, etc. (If we were wanting/expecting brand new fancy accommodations we would have chosen a more expensive hotel to stay at.) The living/dining room was very spacious. The kitchen was clean and had everything we needed. The bedroom was huge and the suite had 3 closets with plenty of hangers. The bathroom was small but we didn't come to Chicago to spend alot of time in our hotel bathroom. The rooftop deck had great views. We asked the front desk for the visitors kit but were told they were no longer available. She did give us other brochures/magazines that had plenty of tourist info, including the ever important map of downtown. We did have dinner at the Saloon Steakhouse and lunch at the Cheesecake Factory. Great food. Great Service. Be prepared to do alot of walking so wear good shoes. Overall, our trip to Chicago was great and I would stay at the Seneca Hotel on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice European feel....in the beginning...”
Reviews.Author: lucas1216
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for two nights. The proximity to Michigan Avenue was paramount in chosing this location. We found the hotel to be charming, reminding us of ones in Europe. Small lobby with helpful staff. Our room was a suite with a kitchen and two full size beds. Clean, well appointed. Breakfast in the Chestnut Street Cafe was very good although the staff seemed to be overwhelmed. It took a long time to have our order taken and even longer for the food to be brought out. We traveled to Michigan from there for a wedding. Upon returning to Chicago and the hotel, we were crammed into the sorriest excuse I've ever seen for a room, or should I say storage closet. Tenth floor, no kitchen (which wasn't an issue), just a dorm size refrigerator, a microwave, and a coffee maker. The carpet was worn through in several places. The worst part was the bathroom! It must have been a closet in a previous life as you had to almost back in to reach the toilet in the corner....and then sit sideways! It was wedged in between the sink and a closet. There was no light over the sink, and the light in the bath/shower consisted of a bare bulb. Not the safest thing to see over your head as you are washing your hair! It seems the Seneca has lots of business travelers and was quite busy while we were there. I don't know why a situation like this would not be addressed. I can honestly say that I would think twice before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Another superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Magmomsal
Reviews.Content: We were in town on business, and couldn't resist the pleasure of Chicago as well, and stayed in a two queen suite. The full kitchen, stove with oven and dishwasher included, was terrific, the dining area and living space comfy, the bedroom and bath more than adequate. There were three ladies with PLENTY of room to share. The location to the Miracle Mile, Water Tower, Oak St. beach and transit couldn't be beat. The staff was friendly and quick to assist. We are already making plans for a long weekend and bringing more friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price near Water Tower Place”
Reviews.Author: blairb366
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Seneca in September 2008. We had paid attention to the deals on the internet and booked signicantly in advance for a $109 per night room rate for a king room. We arrived a little early for check in and our room was not ready so we checked our bags with the bellhop and went about our day. When we finally arrived back, the desk staff was friendly and got our room quickly. Check out was equally quick, with the bellhop holding our luggage for the afternoon until we left in the early evening. Our room was actually a large suite, with separate sitting area, little dining room table, full kitchen area complete with stove, refrigerator, dishwasher and dishware. However, the hotel is a little older and it shows. The furniture and carpeting were a littlle dated as was the bathroom and kitchen, but everything was clean and functional. A 19 inch TV in the huge sitting room seemed a little small, but we weren't really there to watch TV. Please note that not all rooms were of this nature. Our traveling companions paid the same rate and had two double beds. The room half the size of ours and was a bit cramped for more than 2, but it also had a kitchenette set up. It would have been 3 star rating if we would have had that room. We only had drinks at the hotel bar, so we can't really comment on the restaurant facilities, but the service was not particularly speedy. Overall for the $109 price, the Seneca was a bargain for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Charming!”
Reviews.Author: travlinmel101
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved The Seneca! We arrived around 8:00am at Union Station and took a taxi to our hotel (10 mins max and $13 taxi with 2 people, $1 gas surcharge & tip). We arrived at the beautiful hotel and had them hold our luggage while we went out for the day â€“ very friendly and courteous staff! When we arrived back at the hotel they brought our luggage directly to our room. We also had them hold our luggage the day we were leaving (at 8:00pm), and when we came back to claim our luggage, they brought it directly to the taxi. LOCATION - Location is superb! It is literally located across the street from the John Hancock building. This was extremely convenient for several reasons: we had purchased the multi-day trolley/double decker bus pass, which one of the stops is at the John Hancock. We walked just 3 minutes to the bus stop and hopped on. Also, the morning we visited the John Hancock, we only had a short walk, got their at time of opening, and had absolutely no wait at all. (It was also cool to be able to see our actual hotel ROOM from the John Hancock Observatory.) The John Hancock also has the Cheesecake Factory, which didnâ€™t close until 11:30pm - great cheesecake to close out your night. The Seneca is also within walking distance to Navy Pier (about 1 mile). Itâ€™s a nice walk down Lake Shore Drive , you cross under the street with an underground walk-way (well lit, not scary or creepy). On the other side, you walk along the beach of Lake Michigan where plenty of people are swimming, biking, jogging, and having a good time. Itâ€™s one block east from Michigan Ave. , you can walk right down the Magnificent Mile (and there are other bus stops on Michigan Ave. , too, which was convenient for us). HOTEL â€“ In the lobby, I saw an award the hotel had won for something like - Best renovations for a hotel built before 1920. So, apparently, the hotel is older, but the only way you can tell is in the classical design and details of the lobby and halls which gives this hotel a lot of charm! I thought the â€œletterboxâ€� was very cool! Donâ€™t miss the Sundeck on the â€œ18thâ€� floor. Depending on which elevator you get on, you take the elevator to floor 17 or 17(a, I think it was), then walk up the stairs to the 18th floor. There is a small workout room and then a door to the sundeck. The sun deck was very clean with great buildings/architecture to the south and a view of the John Hancock to the west. There was also a soda machine on this floor. ROOM â€“ Our room was incredible! I booked a â€œOne Bedroom Suiteâ€� (for SUPER CHEAP) on Orbitz.com. You walked into a living room with large windows, couch, TV, coffee table, chair, and desk with chair. There was a full kitchen with full refrigerator/freezer (with ice cube trays), stove/oven, microwave, table/2 chairs, dishes/silverware, all very clean. There was a doorway that separated the living room from bedroom. The bedroom was very spacious with King size bed and plenty of room on both sides of bed, chair, armoire w/ another TV, dresser and walk-in closet with plenty of shelving, hanging space, safe, and additional pillows/blanket. The bathroom was pretty typical, clean, very hot water, and plenty of towels and toiletries. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I expected...great night stay”
Reviews.Author: JaymesinAZ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here just one night Sept. 2. Wished so much our time and budget allowed us a 2-3 night stay in Chicago, because this was a great room to come "home" to for the night and a great price from Travelocity. I booked the room, which was a basic 2-bed deluxe, the night before we left Indianapolis. It came to only $125.00 the night with taxes. The room was very adequete having gotten the top floor and although we didn't need it for only one night, I was amazed at the general size of the room, the huge 3 closets, and the mini-kitchen which came in handy in the morning for coffee and our left-over pizza from Pizzaria Due! The location is awesome as out last stop that night after a LOT of walking that day was the Hancock Observatory that night. Then I relaxed in the jacuzzi tub to heal my worn feet. It was such a great deal and room that I only wished we had another day or two. Only one night, I can't think of any cons except that maybe the afternoon front staff and front bellmen either had no welcome or fairly dull in enthusiasm, but this was very minor. But that room, location, and that price from Travelocity made for a great night stay! Check out the rooftop patio!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain/But there are issues”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I booked a huge 1 Bdrm suite through Travelzoo for $110/night, which included free wifi. Reviews had me "concerned" mainly about the condition of the rooms. But I must say the room was in great condition and HUGE! There was some wear and tear, but nothing that was worth noting. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: Price - nothing in that area comes close to a huge 1 Bdrm suite for this price. Huge bedroom, living area with desk, big dining area with true dining room table, and a niced size kitchen. lots of closets, bathroom IS small, but plenty of counterspace all the same, also a jacuzzi tub. Location - Can't be beat for the price. Maid service was A-1 and really polite and cheerful. Cons - STAY AWAY from any of the staff in the lobby. If you need any help whatsoever, you will be in deep [--]. They are at best inept and they simply do not care about your stay. That is a fact. From the front desk to the front door, the staff are all about their issues and not yours. So if you can manage the trip without them, you'll do fine. Also, there are issues with getting hot water. Front desk told me to let the faucet run for 15 minutes. WTF???? I told them maybe they would like to explain this to the board of health. They called an engineer, but nothing ever happened. I was way too busy for my trip to stop and complain. So, I let the faucets run for 15 minutes. Another plus is the cafe in the basement, not much on ambiance, but they serve a really good breakfast menu all day long (I like to sleep late, so this was a MAJOR plus) and reasonable prices. I had a couple of drinks at the bar in the steakhouse in the lobby, but the place was so dark and depressing that I couldn't stay in there too long. Also was easily able to get from OHare to the hotel on the train during rush hour, even with heavy baggage. So if you don't need a lot of front desk service, this place is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Insensitive Management At The Seneca”
Reviews.Author: newsmax59
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca in June and had an unfortunate experience. My husband had a heart attack. I found this out around 5pm and immediately called the front desk saying I needed to check out immediately. When I went to the front desk to check out, I was informed by the front desk manager, Cory Steinberg that I would be billed for that night's stay. I understand hotels are in the business of making money but it was Mr. Steinberg's attitude I found rude. When I asked him if he would make an exception because of my situation, Mr. Steinberg said he would have to speak to his manager because, "I'm not going to risk my job over this." I never heard back from Mr. Steinberg and I am never going to stay at the Seneca again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: JaneandNye
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the last two reviews - what fussy people!!! We were delighted with the Seneca, incredibly good value for money, excellent location, good service, spacious room with comfortable bed, wonderful restaurant, comfortable sitting room and functional kitchen - the one gripe that I would support is that in the effort to update it the microwave takes up all the surface space in the kitchenette, but we coped. What do these people expect for the price - the Ritz?! We could not have been more comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the location was outstanding - right in the hub of downtown, but quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better”
Reviews.Author: traveltimenc
Reviews.Content: There are lots of hotels like this in Europe.-- shabby yet clean rooms, extremely well located, family run with a caring staff and a fair price. Subract the family run, caring staff and sadly-- you have The Seneca. Here is the good and the bad. Good: Clean sheets, large rooms, great location for a fairly decent price. Bad: Indifferent and unprofessional hotel management. Check others posts about this as well--I wish I had before staying here. You never know how bad a hotel can be until something goes wrong. After my wallet was pick-pocketed in their elevator moments after checking in(caught on video tape and reported to the police) I found this out. The response from the front desk was a card for a free appetizer at a pizza place and the number to call to file a police report. I''ve received a nice follow up call from the Chicago Police since leaving. The response from the manager, Cory Steinburg has been nothing. Robbery can happen to anyone in any city, this was no surprise. But what was surprising was that according to the police, it happens in and near this hotel often. If there ever was a time to comp a room, I would think this would be it. Safety of guests should not be compromised. Room condition: Peeling ceiling paint. Vinyl shower curtain. Blue 80's furniture and carpet and a warped hallway door that took effort to shut each time we left the room. You get the idea. Here's the deal: please do your homework before staying here. You can do much better for the price. Promise.

Reviews.Title: “so much potential, yet fails”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on top of some really great restaurants, and has a fantastic location, yet it just misses the boat. Our room was a double queen suite, the t.v. was ancient and got terrible reception. The rug did not meet the door, the handles were broken off of the kitchen cabinetry, the bathroom was miniscule, wallpaper peeling off the walls, get the picture? It just reminded us of a sleazy no tell motel, that has not been updated since the early 70's. There is no conceirge, and the front desk people seem to know nothing about the city, why?? We ate at both the Saloon restaurant and the 200 East, both fantastic. We ordered room service from the Saloon and it arrived hot and within 15 minutes, awesome! They let us know they were not affiliated with the hotel, too bad. Maybe if who was running these restaurants was running the hotel it would be a great destination. Even with a great rate through travelzoo, we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: will in sf
Reviews.Content: For $138 a night I was pleasantly surprised by the size, cleanliness, and comfort of the room -- actually rooms. We ended up with a kitchen, living room, bedroom and bath. Staff was helpful although we didn't need to bother them much. Location is good: right behind the Hancock, a block off Michigan Avenue at Chestnut. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing!ars o”
Reviews.Author: utamata
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Seneca hotel. We were pretty disappointed in the condition of the room. Although we had a huge room with one bedroom with king bed, living room, dining area, kitchen and two closets it was very outdated. The bathroom was dirty when we checked-in. The toilet seat was dirty from a previous hotel guest. It was nasty. The bath tub was moldy. The bathroom was small and very outdated. The king size bed must have been like 20 years old. It had a big dip in the middle so when you lay on it you tended to roll to the middle. The kitchen was very outdated and stunk! The furniture was ugly and worn. The old fashion blinds did not work well in the bedroom so we had a lot of light coming into the room which made it hard to sleep. The carpeting was ugly (again!) and dirty. The only positive thing I can say is that it was in a good location and a decent price. I suppose you get what you pay for. I probably would not stay here again. I would spend a little bit more and get something in better condition. We would have preferred a little less space for a nicer place. It needs major updating!

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fwtexastraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like your favorite uncle: cranky, but loveable. My wife, daughter and I have been coming to Chicago every year since 2001, and we've finally found the place we want to be when we're here. This hotel is a renovated apartment building (in fact, the top four floors are still conventional rentals) next to the Hancock Center just east of North Michigan and a couple of blocks to the lake. We paid $185 a night for a two-queen suite. For that, you get a small apartment: one bedroom with two queen beds and a TV, one bath, living room with a TV, parlor, dining room, and full kitchen. There's an in-room safe and literally enough closet space to sleep a few kids in. We also each got coupons good for $7.50 apiece every day at the hotel's basement Chestnut Cafe, which feels like the dining room at a British B&B but serves a pretty broad traditional breakfast and lunch menu. The coupons were part of the hotel's Breakfast Getaway package. You also get free WIFI. If you're here with a family, you can save huge dollars on food by shopping for groceries at nearby stores like the White Hen on Chicago Avenue, or by bringing in takeout. The apartment is by no means granite and glitz. The light switches are funky; flip the wrong one, and poof!, the TV goes off. The bathtub drain was a little slow, the electric can opener was broken, the fridge leaked a small bit of condensation, and, although the kitchen has dishes, glassware, stemware, flatware, and pots and pans, it had no bottle opener for the wine we brought in (numerous bottle shops nearby). But the place was clean, and you get to live a bit of an urban living fantasy by staying here. We're definitely going to book this place again for next summer. Fair warning: when you book, they charge the full amount of your stay on your credit card as a deposit. This is highly unusual, and if you're not up to giving them an interest-free loan of several hundred or even a few thousand dollars for several months, you might want to look elsewhere. The hotel has three restaurants. The only one we ate at was the Chestnut Cafe, which serves "breakfast" from 6 a.m.-3 p.m. You can catch buses to everywhere on the nearby Michigan Avenue. The closest CTA train stop is the Red Line at Chicago, five blocks away, a bit of a schlep if you're carrying luggage. So that means if you're connecting from the airports on the Blue or Orange CTA train lines, you have to transfer to the Red Line in the Loop, which is under construction and a bit unwieldy right now. This hotel is very convenient to Magnificent Mile shopping and eating. Got kids? Save tons of money by just walking to the beach for the day, or two days. The cost is zero. Finally, our daughter is 7 and she's a huge American Girl fan. The current store is a couple of blocks away on Chicago; the new one under construction is literally across the street from the Seneca at Water Tower Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: scaim
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the The Seneca. I booked this trip through a Travelzoo promotion ($149/night for deluxe suite) before I read any Trip Advisor reviews. Since it was a non-refundable rate, there was no turning back. The exterior and interior of the hotel are full of charm and the staff is very polite and helpful. Though the elevators are small, they exude the character of the period and were always available when called. We arrived way before check-in and our luggage was safely stored and the hotel staff advised us of the best way to get to our desired locations. Our luggage was promptly delivered to our 15th floor room with a hotel provided baby bed upon check-in. The room was a deluxe suite which included a bedroom, bathroom, two walk-in closets, living room, dining area with table for four and full-size kitchen with everything you need if you want to cook. The space was just right for our family of five with the exception of the bathroom. It was very small. The overall decor was extremely dated but everything was clean. The two closets are a waste; however, one was so large that it served as bedroom for the baby. There were no black-out curtains in either room, so we were up with the sun. Our floor had a very clean, coin operated washer and dryer which ended up coming in handy after a couple of baby accidents. There is a small but efficient gym on the top floor with about 6 machines and free weights. Everyday I was in there, it was being cleaned. There were always fresh towels to use and a full water cooler as well as a flat screen TV. Also on the top floor is a beautiful and underused roof deck. I don't know if you can see the Navy Pier fireworks from there but it is worth trying. If I were to travel to Chicago again with my family, I would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect, the price was right and we had plenty of space in our room. If I were to go with just my husband, I would probably stay somewhere a little more luxurious. All in all, this was a budget and family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the Deal”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: So, after an anxiety filled month reading reviews here, wondering if we made a mistake by reserving a room at the Seneca, here is the deal: We arrived early from O'Hare, and the room wasn't ready. Suzanne at the front desk could not have been nicer, storing our bags and sugesting that we check back in a while. After a couple of hours exploring, and a quick lunch, we came back and were told it would only be a little while longer. We had purchased some groceries, and Suzanne offered to store the perishables in the office fridge. Just a short time later we were checked in and on our way upstairs, and told that our bags would be right up. The room was on the third floor (lower than I prefer) but it was a recently renovated corner room and really, really nice. Good size bedroom with king bed, full bath off the bedroom, and a half bath across the corridor. Further inside the room was a huge living room area with a couch and wing back chair. To the left of that was a dining area, with the kitchen off of that. Full size fridge and everything we needed to cook with. The room was clean, but not new, so if you are looking for perfection, stay elsewhere. This is an older building, and it looks great for its age. The location is teriffic, the staff more than pleasant (I bet the people who complained about the rude staff may want to think about how they interacted with the staff.....) The good: Room size, minimal noise from the corridors. Location was good, housekeeping did a great job. Staff pleasant. The bad: Some slight blemishes on the door frame. Noise from outside loud at times (because of the lower floor). We could also hear a party one night, maybe in a ballroom or something on 2nd floor?? Overall, you can't beat the value. The ability to spread out and be comfortable was wayyyyy better than crowding into a tiny hotel room at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seneca”
Reviews.Author: Nanamary
Reviews.Content: While the Seneca is an older hotel, IMO it reprepresents all that is appealing about Chicago. if you prefer brand spanking new over character, there are plenty of sterile hotel rooms in the suburbs. The location couldn't be better. Water Tower Place is only steps away as are train and bus stops. Our daughter booked two rooms, one for her family of 5 and one for us and two other older grandchildren. She had a suite with two double or queen beds, not sure, plus fully equipped kitchen, two walk in closets and a bathroom with a whirlpool tub which made it fun and easy to get 3 kids from 18 months to 6 years into a bubble bath, especially after spending time at the Lake Michigan Beach 2 blocks away. She had plenty of room to set up a pack and play for the 18 month old to sleep in. The free cable and movies kept her other two entertained so she could get organized for our busy days. Our room had a small bathroom which really wasn't a problem since there was also a huge walk-in closet (equipped with iron, ironing board, safe and lots of close hangers) which we used as a dressing room and a large foyer with a wall of mirrors that made getting ready outside the bathroom easy. We had a fridge, microwave and coffee pot. Ice machines were great after spending time in Europe where ice is a scarce commodity. If I have any complaints at all it would be the aloof (and slow) desk staff. However, they were efficient as were the door man and the housekeeping staff, neither of which were as slow. I love this hotel and can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but”
Reviews.Author: BOLTGUY
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the long 4th of July weekend. Great location and friendly staff, but that is where it ends. Rooms need a great deal of updating, from carpet to furniture. Our room was quite worn, with "waves" in the carpeting as well as broken drawers on the dressers. The bathroom was VERY small and things were loose on the walls. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Hilton Inn and Suites just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: lisatrade
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at the Seneca that included a huge living room/dining area, bedroom with two queens and kitchenette for under $150.00 a night and was very pleased. Like others, I was worried because of some bad feedback, but also like others...I was happy and impressed with the value and location. The kitchen helped save even more money by doing breakfast and packing lunches there. The valet at the hotel advised us of a cheaper parking garage down the street and that ran us $28 dollar a day. Didn't really need our car since there was all kinds of transportation and sight-seeing at our feet, including a free trolley system. If you enjoy an older home, quirks and all, you will get along well with the Seneca and its charms. I went back and re-read the negative feedback and if there were cracks and drips to be seen and heard--I might not have even noticed--I see big rooms...high ceilings and fancy molding. The stuff I fell for in my old home.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly with great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: gwest9
Reviews.Content: I recently surprised my husband with a two night stay in Chicago for his 30th birthday. We stayed at the Seneca. We were on a budget and cared more about the location than the actual hotel. I was nervous because some of the reviews were really bad, but I have to say we were happy with our room and blown away by the location!! If you are looking for a decent hotel in an awesome location and you are on a budget... this is the place for you. We were a block or two from the more expensive hotels. The only negetives we could find were our room needed TLC, showers were not very hot, and parking was very expensive. We would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased, great location”
Reviews.Author: acool57
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. It was built in 1924 and you can see the history in the architecture and construction, but it has of course been remodeled and we were delighted with our large room (more like suite) and kitchenette. The location is terrific, walking distance to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, and several restaurants, and right off Bus and train lines. Made it easy to get around town and not have to worry about parking. Staff was very pleasant and helpful, room was clean, bed was nice, just a great place to stay, particularly for a building that is 84 years old!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jrboct24
Reviews.Content: We were a bit hesitant to follow through with this reservation after reviewing some of the more negative reviews. Especially since the surrounding hotels in that area rate anywhere from $300-$600 per night. So we were a bit relunctant since our internet fee was under $150 per night. However, once we arrived we were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and roominess of the room. We booked a single room/ queen bed/ separate bathroom/ efficiency kitchen. The view was nice and the service wonderful. We had a full sized refrigerator, stove, cooktop, microwave and cabinets full of necessary cooking / dining equipment. The location is directly behind the John Hancock Building and approximately 3 blocks to the water. We were one block over from Magnificent Mile and the area was superb. We opted not to have room service since we were only there for a few days but the front desk took the time to place a call each day letting us know they were aware that we had posted a "do not disturb" sign on the door and if we needed anything to just call housekeeping and they would bring any supplies needed. This hotel is a definite plus and I would absolutely recommend it to all travelers. If we travel to Chicago ever again we will stick with the hotel we now know as being clean, well maintained and efficient. The only down side is the decor of the rooms need to be updated. The bath we had consisted of old leaky faucets and the toilet had a long handle flush from years ago. The bathroom could definitely use some updating. The kitchen was sufficient but also was very drab and needed some spicing up. I hesitate of say anything negative about this hotel because all-in-all we were very satisfied with the rates and location.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: nantookit
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm a hotel snob. Like anyone, I love a good deal for the $$. THIS IS IT...you are steps to the Magnif. Mile, the price was LESS than $200 a night for a KING SUITE>>>>FULL size living room, dining area, FULL KITCHEN....DEEP bathtub with JETS....More closet space and storage than you'd ever need, better than your apt. in college and grad. school put together......Good service, friendly, helpful people...STAY HERE The only negative was the carpeting...it was old, stained, and needed to be replaced....I really couldn't believe the state of the carpeting, but for the price, could over look it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, even with it's quirks.”
Reviews.Author: rhondalo
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I was nervous to see where I would be spending my three nights in Chicago after reading some of the reviews. I am pleased to report we were VERY happy with our room (1523) at the Seneca. Our total for a three night stay including taxes was $481. All throughout our stay, the doorman / valet were friendly and helpful. Check in was easy enough, the front desk help were neither rude, nor helpful---just doing their job. The front lobby is beautiful and the elevators are small. No room for a wheelchair and don't try to fit more than 4 people in there--forget about it with luggage. There is a service elevator just around the corner. Our room was on the 15th floor, all the way at the end of the hallway. Our wireless reception was good and there was no noise at all. The room certainly had it's quirks, but not anything that couldn't be overlooked considering the value the hotel offers. The doors to the bedroom and bathroom started to stick once they were halfway opened. The bathroom itself it super small (1 person only standing room), but the shower water temperature was perfect every time. We had an iron burn on the rug from a previous occupant and the carpet was not finished when transitioning from the living room to the kitchen. The electrical situation is interesting, one outlet didn't work and it took a bit to figure out what switch turned on what. The kitchen itself had everything we needed plus some things we didn't. I don't know about you, but cooking in the stove was certainly not on my to-do list while out of town. One thing to note, I did mention a burnt out bulb in our closet to the front desk and there was someone up at my room to fix it before I made it back myself. I suppose the service elevator has a short wait time! Overall, I would definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyleader
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently returned from a trip to Chicago where we stayed at the Seneca Hotel. Our accomodations were great! We had a suite with a kitchen, living room, bedroom, bathroom, and even a walk-in closet! It was very spacious, with a big bedroom that had 2 queen beds. The closet was a nice bonus! The Seneca is located on Chestnut St. just 1 block from the Hancock building, and Water Tower Place. I booked and confirmed our reservation from worldres. When we got to the hotel they had no information regarding our room. When I told them that I had confirmed the room the day before, they asked if I got a confirmation number. I didn't. They were very busy when we were trying to check in, so we told them we would go have a drink at the bar and they could get it sorted out when they had time. The bar was in the Steakhouse Saloon in the hotel. The drinks were AWESOME which made up for the rude bartender who insulted my friend before taking our order (some comment about her being too old (she's 46)), and made no effort to hide the fact that he was irritated with me because I took too long to decide what appetizer I wanted. When we got back to the front desk about an hour later, they had our room all ready for us. I don't know if they found the reservation, or if they just gave us a room, I didn't ask, but it WAS just what I had reserved. The hotel staff were all extremely polite, helpful, and professional. The doormen were all very quick, and on the ball. All in all, our stay at the Seneca was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great spot - great rooms - super service”
Reviews.Author: happytrailsMn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a large family event where our parties booked about 15 rooms at the Seneca. This place is a super value - and I concur with the positives: location, service, space, style. It's not turn-key new, but 99% of our rooms were in excellent condition and incredibly spacious (room 802 will likely be updated soon). We also recognized super service from the desk people and valet friends; in time - some literally recognized us by face. I am sure I speak for my entire family - we wouldn't look further when looking to book the next stay in the heart of this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Iluvchcgo
Reviews.Content: My stay was part of a new contract between my plastic surgeon and the hotel. The night before arrival I was canceled! It almost cost me the 20k surgery scheduled. My room was rebooked but obviously to their displeasure. The staff was rude to phone callers and even worse to inquirers at the front desk. All I can say is, "Shame on you Hotel Seneca!"

Reviews.Title: “Just old”
Reviews.Author: Kirin11
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a boutique hotel and is not. I requested an earlier check in which they claim they could not do. The hotel was not fully booked. They were supposed to hang up my garmet bag but the suits were wrinkled. When I was finally able to check in the kitchen had not been cleaned and they was food in the fridge from the previous occupant. The bathroom had an odd angle and was very small. For some reason they put the larger TV in the bedroom clothes unit. Do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nickle99
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I spent the weekend at The Seneca and booked a suite. The suite was huge - two bathrooms, a living room, and a full kitchen. The size was the only good thing about our room. The hotel lobby smelled funny. The elevators were small and we often had to wait to get one. The towels in our room were thin, had holes in them, and also smelled of mildew -- even when we asked for fresh ones, we got mildew-smelling towels. There is hardly ever any hot water. When my friend called down to the front desk to ask about the water, she was told the let the shower run for FIFTEEN minutes!!!! And then there is room service - or the lack thereof. The restaurant in the hotel is run separately from the hotel, so you have to call a different number to get food. It took forever, arrived cold, and it was greasy and disgusting. I couldn't even eat the food ($12 for some eggs and coffee). One of my friends did manage to choke down her eggs and spent most of the morning wishing she hadn't. My advice - just say no.

Reviews.Title: “Location, spaciousness, and minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: califanglophile
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Seneca as tour leader for 20 well-travelled Californians. They--and I--loved it. As others have noted, on close examination, the rooms could use a little touching up. The Seneca is in an old building, and the door frames and base boards have seen a lot of paint over the decades. Some of the furniture could use a light application of scratch coat. But . . . put your magnifying glass away, ignore the tiny defects, and enjoy all of the positives: Location, location, location. I can't imagine a better one. Very attractive and secure public areas. Exceptional space. Admit it you naysayers--the suites are probably larger than your first apartment. There are enough closets (one a walk-in), drawers and shelves to put away an entire wardrobe, let alone what one might pack for a week's visit. Lots of furniture to make one feel at home: sofa, two arm chairs, end tables and lamps, coffee table, desk, TV and telephone in both the living area and bedroom, dining room table with four chairs, comfortable bed, etc. My suite was nicely carpeted and very clean as well. Quiet. In spite of the nearness to Michigan Avenue and Lakeshore Drive, the only noise to be heard is the occasional clop of a carriage horse--and that's only if you leave the window open. A nice bar--with live music and reasonably-priced food--along with a more formal restaurant. A fully-equipped kitchen. With a grocery and several good delis nearby, this proved to be an unexpected pleasure. Bonus: after I put my dirty dishes in the dishwasher; I returned to find that they had been washed and put back in the cabinets while I was out for the day. Free wireless. (Do ask for a room that isn't too far from the access point, though. At the end of the hall, the signal is too weak to use.) It goes without saying: I'd stay again. By the way, Chicago is wonderful. It's like New York, only cleaner and friendlier. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: psmithpet
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central location off "The magnificent mile" and did not want to pay a Kings ransom. The seneca fits the bill on both aspects. Great location just behind the Hancock building and the Water tower. The hotel itself was ideal. The room was apartment style with small kitchenette with all necessary amenities. The decor was fine for the price, not luxurious but more than adequate. We did not dine in any of the hotel eateries but th menus looked good and reasonable. We did avail ourselves of the attached bar which had live music most nights and was very convivial. All in all I would recommend this hotel for anybody wanting to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: MhairiT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca for four nights this week. I thought the location and the value for money were excellent. The front of house staff were very friendly and helpful and I felt safe and welcomed there. The rooms were clean and well equipped. The hotel is right next door to the John Hancock Tower, and only two blocks away from the 'Miracle Mile' shopping district. There isn't a subway station nearby, but there are many buses that go up N Michigan Ave, and taxis in the downtown area were very cheap. Breakfast isn't included, but there is a nice cafe in the 'arcade' level of the hotel. My room also had a little kitchenette and I bought some groceries from Potash Bros grocery store nearby for my breakfasts. There wasn't any public internet access but the receptionist directed me to a nearby Kinkos (or you could try your luck at the Apple Store on N Michigan avenue!). One suggestion I would make if you like to sleep in after daybreak is to bring an eye mask. My room only had very light louvre blinds and so I was woken at 6am every morning by the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: weetrekker
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading some of the reviews, but the reality was not as bad as I feared. The good: we had a rate of $149/night with complimentary valet parking. If we had had to pay for parking, it would have been another $40+ a day. Our room was huge, larger than our first apartment and with many more closets. It was also very clean. The kitchen had a stove, refrigerator, microwave and a dishwasher. The bedspread, draperies and upholstered furniture were very attractive. The location is great, about a block from Michigan Ave., and only a few blocks from the El. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but from what we had, they seemed helpful and polite. The bad: The rug, while clean, needed stretching. The kitchen needed updating. The bathroom, also clean, had some cracked tiles and a vanity that looked as though a litter of Labrador puppies had gnawed on it. It definitely needed updating. The dresser in the bedroom was missing some handles. The reception on the TVs was less than crystal clear. Finally, upon check-out, the desk clerk tried to charge for the complimentary parking, but the manager took care of the situation quickly. I've stayed in several hotels in the north Michigan Ave. area, from the Sheraton Hotel and Towers to boutiques like the Whitehall, and while the Seneca wasn't as nice, I didn't think it was all that bad. I would stay there again for the location and the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Full Size Kitchen, Within walking distance of Miracle Mile”
Reviews.Author: wuzupntx
Reviews.Content: What a great value! Wonderful suite style rooms with full size kitchen and within walking distance of many attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although we had no heat the first night, we were switched to another room the second night and enjoyed our stay. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: estee_raye
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I reluctantly booked this hotel for $109(special rate) a night. Thank god I did! My husband and I could have not asked for a better location, hotel, and price. For about $150 to $300 cheaper then any hotel in that area we got a 1 bedroom suite w/ full kitchen. Yes the inside of the hotel is older but it's nice. I can account that the furniture is brand new in the rooms because while we were out one day we came back to a brand new hotel suite. I would not go by the reviews that are bad; they must be way too picky. This said as long as you donâ€™t expect to be staying at the most posh hotel in Chicago you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a renovation, but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Ryan
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews, I was a little weary about booking this hotel, however I'm glad I did, it's a great hotel. I can understand why some reviewers made the comments they did, as the hotel does need a make over and the rooms do look a little jaded. Some of the furniture is straight out of the seventies and the decor in the room sometimes makes you feel as if you've travelled back in time, but that's about the only bad point. The suite was very spacious and clean with daily maid service. The room came with two double beds in a big bedroom, a lounge with a TV, a dining table and a fully furnished kitchen, with oven, hob, dish washer, microwave, kettle, toaster and all the cutlery and crockery you would need. The best thing about this hotel is the location, it's about a 5 minute walk from Michigan Avenue (The Golden Mile), where all the shops are. It's also close to the lake front and the red line rail station. I recommend the steak house restaurant adjoining the hotel, but be warned book early. While the hotel does need a make over, the suite sizes and the location means that if I return to Chicago, I'd have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Debs4206
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the senaca for three nights with our 16 year old son. The location is fantastic, looking out onto John Hancock, within easy walking distance of Fox and Obel, one block away from Magnificent Mile with its shops, resturants and numerous buses to take you wherever you want to go (unlimited CTA travel card is a must!). the hotel was fine, clean, room spacious, bathroom small - not luxurious - but who goes to Chicago to stay in a hotel! The staff were very helpful and check in was very smooth even though we arrived early. I would reccomend this place to people who are more interested in the city and just needing a place to sleep in comfort, than those that like lots of facilites without going out - we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: fidoLondon
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about staying at the Seneca having read negative reviews but can honestly say it was a very pleasant stay. The suite was spacious, clean and comfortable. We had a bedroom with 2 queen beds, lounge with dining area, fully fitted kitchen, 2 bathrooms and 3 walk in wardrobes. The door closed properly (see previous reviews) and we had a card key not an old fashioned key. There was no unpleasant smell and the furniture and carpets were in good condition. The door staff and reception desk staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The hotel is in a prime location for visiting all the sights. I doubt I will visit Chicago again, it was enjoyable but there is nothing to go back for, but if I did return I would stay at the Seneca.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled that we stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: violinmom
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to find the Seneca because downtown Chicago can be so expensive. We were travelling with 2 adults and 4 kids, so this ruled out the possibility of "naming our own price" and only being guaranteed a room that sleeps 2 people. We needed a suite, and I was thrilled to find a "presedential suite" for $139 at the Seneca. I read the reviews of this being an older hotel, without keycards, and worn down furniture. I tried to expect the worst, so as to not be disappointed. We were pleasantly surprised to find a huge, spacious room, that we unlocked with a keycard...I'm guessing the hotel is being updated and we just happened to be on floors that have already been switched to keycards...so no problem there. We felt like we were staying in an apartment, with a china cabinet full of decorative items, and a living area with space to spread out. The room was very clean, and the only bathroom complaint is just that the hot water took quite a while to kick in...after the 1st day we decided to run the water right when we got up so it would be hot when we wanted to shower. There were 3 big closets in the bedroom, which worked out great so that at least 3 of our kids could each claim a closet to keep all of their belongings organized in....as a mom I loved that feature. The location was amazing...everything was easy to get to. The people working at the hotel were great...we had a slight "hitch" when we got there, because our room had been given away to a guest with almost the same last name as us (Mance instead of Nance). The manager ended up taking $80 off of our bill, and we were in the exact same room, just on a different floor. Obviously they are willing to go out of their way to make their clients happy, because this was realy a minor issue that we weren't really even complaining about...we certainly didn't ask for compensation because it wasn't a big deal...the front desk person just offered because they felt bad. We loved the Seneca, and it is really difficult to find a comfortable place to stay for a family of 6...we will definitely stay there again if we find ourselves in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fear Not: This is VERY nice!”
Reviews.Author: truantWestminster_MD
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely delightful surprise!!! My wife and I are here at The Seneca right now. (of course, how much of a loser am I to be writing a review using the Seneca's free wireless internet service in my room when I should be out on another pub crawl?). We were very worried about our booking, as we just got tickets to the Oprah Winfrey Show which are nearly impossible to come by, and had to make arrangements in less than 10 days. We are usually Marriott/Hyatt kind of people, but Chicago prices are not far from Manhattan, so I took the risk at booking here at Seneca for 4 days. Read lots and lots of Travelocity reviews from past 3 years, and our anxiety was risen dramatically. What a delight when our doorman greeted us outside under the beautiful awning and we walked into a very gorgeous lobby, complete with wingchairs and a roaring fireplace. Desk staff were about the friendliest I have ever encountered, welcoming us to Chicago and answering our stupid tourist questions. We wisked up to our room on nice, quiet, speedy new elevators and bravely opened the door, expecting something from Oliver Twist. Instead, we found a truly nice, clean, tastefully decoraged room with a full kitchen. Bathroom very clean as well, with ample storage and amenities. Good Lord, we knew that this was not a new hotel. This place was built 8 decades ago, so the character combined with the makeover really make it European bistro-like...and it really works. AND.....all of this with its ideal location....next to Hancock Bldg and upscale Water Tower Place across our street. Stayed at the Omni on the Magnificent Mile on last visit, paying over twice and much. Frankly, even if prices had been the same, I think I would prefer The Seneca. So, come on TripAdvisor folks, take a chance with The Seneca and save LOTS of your hard-earned bucks!!! ~Steven

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Getaway”
Reviews.Author: sportsfan007
Reviews.Content: August 2007. Went on a trip with my daughter and son-in-law for 3 days in Chicago. Booked the Senaca on Expedia.ca for a reasonable price for 2 Kingsize Suites. Had a busy 3 days planned so we didn't want to spend much time in the rooms anyways. Took in a Cubs Brewers game at Wrigley. My wife and Daughter took in Wicked at the theater while my son-in-law and I took in the Bears Browns exhibition football game at Soldiers Field. Took some tours and hit the restaurants so our days were filled. While the Senaca is old it certainly has a good location. Staff at check in was very pleasant. Some problems though. Our daughters room was ready but when they went in the bed was bare and hadn't been made up yet. As we were going out anyways it was done when we got back. In our room the TV was disconnected and the plumbing back up also. Both were fixed promptly though. The price of an older hotel I guess. Found out there was a free breakfast with the room though no one told us about it or where it was. We like Einstein Bagels anyways so we went there in the mornings for our coffee. Hotel does have a great location and the bar in the Hancock building does have the greatest view of Chicago at night. Think I would stay here again if the price is right and I wanted to be downtown. Visiting friends I do like staying around Naperville.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Kinezo23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. Negative stuff first. The washrooms were bad. The facets and drains were old and rusty. The tiles were loose and chipped. The range and microwaves must have been made in the 70's. I was afraid to use them in case they caught on fire. They say they have wireless internet. That's if you can get a signal. The only time I got a signal was downstairs in the lobby. The location is awesome. You're steps away from the Magnificent Mile. The rooms are huge. I even had a dining room table. It's good for families on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great homely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: debbieg22
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel before and havent been dissapointed book a king suite for a little bit extra and get a lot extra space for your money. The kitchen is a bonus with a full size cooker and fridge and dishwasher. Trader Joes on ontario street is a great food store to stock up your fridge they also sell really decent wine for $3 abottle which is a bargain in the usa.Friendly staff in a great location makes this hotel a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement!!!”
Reviews.Author: smetm33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca for 3 nights. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised by the lobby...it was very nice. But when we got to our room we were pretty disappointed. We didn't have a kitchen, which I thought we were supposed to. It smelled bad. It wasn't very clean, there were splatter marks all over the walls and the cups in the room didn't even look like they had been washed...there were even lip marks still on them! The beds were uncomfortable...very hard. When we took a shower it took about 10 minutes for the water to actually get hot, at first it was barely luke warm. There was also soap residue and hair in our shower. Overall, it just wasn't what we expected. It is old, run-down and needs alot of work. The two good things about it...the reasonable price and the location (1 block from michigan ave and right next to the john hancock observatory and water tower place). We won't be staying there again and would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review - No one was more scared to stay here than I was”
Reviews.Author: NonBelvr
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of the Seneca here and on other websites and was actually mad when my friend booked it because I was afraid to stay here because I just knew that it would be horrible. We all went in with the attitude that we would expect the worst and that way we would not be disappointed and would probably be pleasantly surprised. We were, indeed, pleasantly surprised. We wanted to post this review to give a detailed, specific review and address issues brought up by previous reviewers. Four of us stayed for 3 nights and had plenty of room to spread out, 2 TVs, places to get away from one another when needed to do our individual things, etc. Stayed in 2 queen bed suite. Got an outstanding price, so my friend that booked it could not resist and jumped on it. The staff was all very friendly, helpful and good humored. Our belief is that a lot of this is in YOUR approach with staff and being polite, friendly and respectful. The lobby is beautiful. Check-in was quick and smooth, front desk staff friendly. The valet, doorman and bellhop were all wonderful and friendly. Security door to access elevators; elevators quick, no problems. ATM in area by elevators, behind security door so felt safer using it. Also have a terminal with info you can access such as weather, local attractions, shopping, etc. Guest room hallways - yucky, baby/sky blue walls; dark carpet; EXTREMELY warm. Odd smell. I had a friend who lived in an apartment complex with a similar hallway smell and she described it as "beefy". Room door - difficult to open. Door knob was very loose, probably because it does not actually turn and many guests have tried to force it to turn. I checked other doorknobs and they were loose as well. To enter room you have to turn the key to unlock door, then turn it the other way to unlatch and push open - a little tricky in the days of card keys and green lights telling you when to turn and push. Door had large gap at top where we could see the light from the room shining out. Another frequent complaint from previous reviews was that the deadbolts didn't work. Ours worked, but you had to grab the door knob and lift the door up a little bit for it to lock. Once we figured out these little tricks, it was fine. Upon entering, room was dingy and old looking with darker old-fashioned patterned furniture, dirty curtains, blah walls. Furniture in pretty good condition - couch had large support bar in center and hurt when I sat on it. Our coffee table had 4 glass inserts on top, 1 was very loose, one had a broken-off corner. Bathroom remodeled and attractive. Kitchen remodeled - beautiful. Room was hot when we arrived, had individual thermostat, able to turn off heat. Additional bonus for us - windows open wide, no limit to how far they open. This may by a concern for families with small children, however, but we loved it and had the windows open almost our entire stay to keep it cool in room (also helped with the weird smell). Very disappointed in jacuzzi tub - these are old apartments and so the tub was put into an existing bathroom and was smaller than traditional tub. We did not use it. Tub jets were also dirty. Beds - OK. Matresses firm, but still had sagging spot in middle, which I did not understand. Blankets and quilts did not work well with two people in bed if they didn't want to snuggle to be adequately covered - seemed small for bed. LOTS of storage, 2 walk-in closets which could actually sleep someone if needed. I used one as my personal changing room. Kitchen - more than adequate supplies for everything we wanted to do in the 3 nights we stayed here. They even had a whistling tea kettle, which I used the entire time. Ordered food from the Saloon Steakhouse - excellent food, a bit pricey due to being a steakhouse, but cheaper than traditional room service. Location is outstanding. Right next to John Hancock Building - our view was actually of the Hancock parking garage and side of the building. Across from Water Tower Place, 1 or 2 blocks from Mag Mile, very convenient. Check-out was smooth, no double-charges on credit card, staff friendly and helpful throughout stay. No concierge, but staff more than willing to answer questions. Overall, we were all pleased with our stay. We are used to staying in very nice hotels when we travel, so the appearance of the halls and rooms was off-putting, but the value, space and service more than made up for it. We will probably use this hotel for any future visits to Chicao when we just want a good room to stay in. If we want luxury, with cosmetic appeal, two-person jacuzzi tub and don't need tons of space, then we will pay A LOT more to stay somewhere else. But this will be our regular hotel from now on. Don't be scared of the Seneca, just go in with a realistic expectation and positive attitude and you will be fine. I can't say what the other rooms look like, and some of them may have bigger problems than ours did, but I wanted to give a detailed, honest account of our stay. I have included a lot of picures of both the good and bad things at the Seneca because I felt like this would have helped me. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: GrahamDog01
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago for our honeymoon and stayed at the Seneca for its location and good priced I recieved. This was our biggest regret of our trip. The hotel was very run-down! Our 'suite' was basically a run-down used efficiency apartment. I would not recomment this hotel! My husband and I also witnessed a male 5 week tenant at the lobby ATM with a questionable woman. We rode the elevator to the same floor and witnessed that they did not know each other and she followed him into his room. We did not feel safe at all due to the old doors and locks and kept a chair under the doorknob each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: canariangirl
Reviews.Content: Loved the location: Next to Michigan Ave. and John Hanckok Center. We travelled with our 2 and 4 year old kids and the suite was big, clean, well located and the kitchen perfect. The only problem was the mand at the front desk who didnÂ´t help at all while trying to make a reservation to get an airport shuttle. He made me call him at 5 a.m. (he said that was the time they opened) and I wake up and then he said to go and look for a telephone out in the street because we couldnÂ´t do it by my phone!?!?!?!? Weird story. Anyway, the location is great and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a queen in some ways...not in others.”
Reviews.Author: AZgirl80
Reviews.Content: My bf and I found out about specials through a friend via Shermans Travel. We called the day that we landed and made a reservation. We did request a jacuzzi tub but ended up getting a handicapped room, therefore not even a regular tub (not the hotel's fault but we were not notified of it at check-in). After going to our room, I returned to the front desk and they said that it was one of the last 2 regular rooms besides the presidential suite(s).
