We were only staying one night so there wasn't a dire need for the kitchen, but it was fully stocked with dishes, utensils etc. You could not adjust the heat of your specific room as it must have been run universally throughout the hotel. The bed (we upraded to a king) was a bit too bouncy and the rugs showed their age. The first front desk clerk was nice checking in but another one was not when I asked EXTREMELY politely about a room with a tub. Another thing...our room was at the end of the hall. If I was handicapped, I would not want to travel all the way down the corridor especially after being outside in the freezing cold. BTW the elevator from the 4th floor would not go down and the concierge did not open the door for us either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family!”
Reviews.Author: amamawhoplans
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the double queen suite with kitchen, dining and living area. Everything was very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was very nice. Lots of storage closets and a great showerhead. It was great to have the space to spread out with the kids, eat breakfast in, and the location was spectacular. Self park is right next door, Water Tower Place is kitty-corner and Michigan Ave, just one block away. Wow! And all for a great price. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat! Our daughter said she felt like a queen. No concierge on site, so make your plans ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Don,t be scared off”
Reviews.Author: BOW54
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Seneca. I got a really good deal from travel zoo. From some of the bad reviews, We was scared to see what we got for the money. If your are of medium income don,t hesitate to book this hotel. The location can,t be beat. While it is an older hotel, It has spacious , clean rooms. The front desk treated us great. And while we didnt expect a free breakfast, that was also included. It was a complete breakfast an the best coffee. Everybody can,t afford the best hotels. Thanks to the Seneca for a great stay. We will go back .

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytrip2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be torn down and good use made of the property. We checked in--the blinds were broken and hanging at half-mast. Bedspreads were fifthy, the bathroom paper falling off--beds uncomfortable and hard pillows. They warn you to use the dead-bolt for security but one room had none and the door looked like someone had tried to get in. Management sent some up and fixed the blinds and the window and moved our children to another floor due to no dead bolt. The only plus was the restaurant (220 East) and the location. We stay in Chicago often and will never go near this place again--no matter how low the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pinter11
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Great location, 2 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile and Water Tower shopping center. Hotel is very clean and rooms are well equipped. Restaurant and bar are very nice with good service. Free breakfast. Free WiFi. Negative points: Check in staff are very rude, dated rooms. Overall this is a great hotel for the money, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hated the beds”
Reviews.Author: justamommy
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel, I thought that I got a great deal on a fancy hotel, but I was very disappointed when I walked into the room. The lobby was nice, no concierge, but the rooms are dated, and the bed was terrible!!! The rooms were very, very clean, however, and the kitchen was great- it was fully stocked with dishes, dishtowel and soap- a nice touch. All in all, I got what I paid for, an ok hotel, great location, but horrible beds. Also, we were supposed to get a free breakfast, and at check in they gave us vouchers for the 2 adults and said the kids didn't need one, but at bbreakfast the next day we were told that we had to pay for the kids, which ended up being almost $20.00! Also. don't park at the hotel, its a ripoff and there is other parking nearby at underground garages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: olarrain
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service, a little outdated. Excellent value!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzwizz82
Reviews.Content: We booked the Seneca because of the good reviews I had read on here. I think our first mistake was booking through an online travel agent instead of directly through the hotel. I believe they treat you differently if you get a discount rate (even though it wasn't that much cheaper!!). When we checked in the woman that served us was unfriendly and rude, basically didnt even acknowledge us.. plus the doormen didn't even open the door for us!! whats with that?? Our room, although big, felt dirty and seriously in need of re-doing! The desk staff in general were rude and not willing to help. very disappointing. Only good thing about this place is the location, close to the magnificent mile. Also, the Seneca cafe was good, served really nice food. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Seneca!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineTC
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of this hotel, we booked with trepidation. It was, however the best $ deal for the time period of our visit - four nights. We were most pleasantly relieved. Yes, it is a historic hotel, which we found ito be very clean with a good daily room cleaning service. The staff, from the various doomen to the front desk to housekeeping, were polite, charming and helpful. The location is terrific for walking, touring, running along the lakeshore and for shopping. Others must also be satisifed with the Seneca because it was booked solid this first week of November.

Reviews.Title: “great area”
Reviews.Author: papercake
Reviews.Content: Very cute older hotel in a fantastic area for a good price. The bathroom is small, but it's cute and reminds me of a small apartment, especially with the hidden kitchen in the room! Park across the street in the parking garage to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauiGirl27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seneca for only one night - 10/18. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite (went with sister) after paying for only a 1 bedroom suite. Maybe we got the upgrade because it was a Thursday and not busy for the weekend yet. No free breakfast coupons as mentioned in other reviews but I was not about to ask since we already got an upgrade. Breakfast in restaurant downstairs was mediocre. Tables are too close together, you can hear every word your neighbiors are saying. The room was beautiful, we were on the 11th floor with views down Chestnut St. next to Hancock Building. Very clean, in fact carpets had just been shampooed and were still a little damp. Suite had 2 1/2 bathrooms, washer/dryer, full living and dining room and small kitchen. Huge closets. We were sorry to only be staying one night. We ate at the steakhouse downstairs. Very nice atmosphere and good food. Cocktails nice and strong! There was smoking in the bar though and that is hard to get used to when you are from California. Location is great, just steps to Michigan Ave. Easy walk to Navy Pier. Hancock Building literally next door. By the way, we enjoyed the skydeck at the Hancock building more than the Sears Tower. The viewing was better, you could get closer to the windows and look straight down, and it was less crowded. I will definetly go back next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: skips1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Thursday 11th Oct till Wednesday 17th Oct. Took cab from O'Hare, came to $36 plus tip. Hotel in great location, 2 mins walk from Magnificent Mile, right next door to Hancock Tower and Water Tower Place. Red line subway approx 5 mins walk. Hotel looks slightly dated but nice and clean, staff and door men excellent. Room nice and clean, no problem with hot water (whirpool in bath was a bonus!). Fridge slightly noisy so unplugged when nothing in, not a major problem though. No external noise so good nights sleep. Receptionist gave free tokens for breakfast in adjacent cafe (for value of $7.50), unexpected bonus. 2 restaurants on site also, didnt use steakhouse but would recommend the 200 E Chestnut for drinks and food, reasonable price and good quality (George the barman is a legend!). Used blue line back to O'Hare, took around an hour but only $2. We bought a 7 day CTA pass for subway/bus which worked out excellent value. Overall, would recommend, and would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fsg
Reviews.Content: The Seneca is an older hotel in a great Chicago location, right off Michigan Ave, and across from Drury Lane Watertower Theatre. My room was upgraded to a small suite, and my third floor room was very clean, but not much of a view. The kitchen was tiny, but had a stove, fridge, sink and microwave, and was separated from the sitting room by swinging doors (actually a full door cut in half vertically I think). Tons of closets (4-5, plus a linen section). World's narrowest bathroom! The only problem I encountered was no hot water for showers, just pretty warm. I was there with a business group, and no one else had that problem. Front desk staff were pleasant and accomodating. I would definitely give it another try; prices were incredibly reasonable for the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: johnnjon
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and personable. The hotel was very tastefully done. Although we were given one of the older rooms it was very clean. The furniture was a bit dated but that didnt affect the stay. The hotel was right next door to the John Hancock Building. On Tuesday there is a farmers market one block away. You are within walking distance of anything you would want. And the bus system is wonderful. Get a pass at the visitors center at the clock tower one block from the hotel. The pass is only 5 a day all you want to ride and transfer. We love the Original Pancake house for breakfast. Ate there at least 4 times. Also love the cheese cake factory for what else the cheese cake. Take the boat tour of the city. It is truly beautiful. We found to be very safe in the area we were staying which is also only a brief couple blocks from lake michigan. I would definitely recommend a stay at the Seneca and will definitely stay there again. Remember though Chicago is very expensive. But ask the locals and they will tell you of some good cheap eats. Try Ronnies in the Theatre district. Buffet style diner but fantastic if not the best steak I have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here Again”
Reviews.Author: nschmidt
Reviews.Content: My mom and I took a mother-daughter trip to Chicago in July 2007. It was the first time for both of us and we truly enjoyed it! We picked the Seneca for the price, location and free breakfast every morning (we booked through the United.com website). the location was close to perfect. Right next door to hancock building, which you have to go to the top of at night and during the day. Great views!! We took the Blue line to downtown and then we got a bit confused and ended up taking a cab to the hotel, but it was Ok, only about $10. One tip, it takes about an hour and a half to take the blue line from o'hare to downtown so plan accordingly. the red line is about 4 blocks away from our hotel and we took this down to State street (for great shopping) and to the theatre. It worked out perfect. Definetly get the $5 all day subway card. The rooms were clean, huge, and have a full kitchen. They are a bit outdated and need new carpet. Has a small bathroom, but for 2 people it was fine. Bed was a bit hard. We had a free full breakfast in the restaurant every day (eggs, pancakes, bacon, etc.) however this came from our package deal through the airline. Staff was very friendly, bellman always opening doors and hailing cabs for people. Overall, would stay again for the price, location and size of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: edmasbetsy
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate of $95 thru a tip on this website. Room was avg, if I had paid $150-200 or more I would have been disappointed. The rm needed an update, carpet, etc. There was one queen bed (ok) but only one chair (which was wobbly). 2 chairs would have been nice, since there was a kitchenette and we made breakfast each am. Peaked into a suite, looked much nicer. Found parking for $26/nite 1 blk east and about 2 blks north. There are several garages located in condo bldgs much cheaper than the $45 valet parking. Overall, it was a great value for $95.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Draculus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late August 2007. Hotel is of a good standard in an excellent location and good value for the Â£52/night we paid. Had a small suite with good sized bedroom, good sized living area (with queen sleeper sofa) and small but fully equipped kitchen. Decor of room was a little tired but by no means terrible. Had dinner 1 night in hotel retaurant - excellent food. Hotel is right next door to the Hancock Tower and two minutes from Water Tower shopping mall and North Michigan Avenue, pleasant 15 minute walk to Wrigley Building or Navy Pier. All- in- all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but not fancy...”
Reviews.Author: nbell8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 days in September and liked the hotel for the value. This was our first time in Chicago and I had seen how expensive the hotels can run. We got King Suite (w/ kitchen) for avg of $200/night for the 7 days. For the price (and relative to what other hotels were charging during same time period) it was a good value. Its in a great location for tourists (right next to Hancock building and Mag Mile) and not far from red line 'Chicago' stop (about 5-10 min walk) to get to rest of city (like loop, Cubs or White Sox games or comedy shows). The area its in a very safe and we had no problems walking around in the evening. To quote my husband, the hotel was 'Functional but not fancy' which sums the place up. The room was clean, kitchen was stocked with plates, glasses, a few pans to cook in. But the hotel is old and furniture looks like its seen better days..Our room had 2 TVs in it (one in the bedroom and one in the living room). The living room one made you think you had glacuoma cause the picture was blurry and obviously the tube was going. Since we had the other TV which was OK, we didn't ask them to replace the other TV.. The bathroom was clean and well-stocked with toiletries but it was a pretty tight room and you couldn't have more than 1 person using it at a time. You did get a good amount of space and closets so if you are staying for a week or more, you would appreciate the room. The kitchen was one of the main reasons we picked it so we could cook breakfast ourselves and save some money (and not gain too much weight!). There is a supermarket 2-3 min walk away which is not bad and a WholeFoods 10 min walk away if you want more higher-end food or premade lunch/dinners to take back to the room. If we come back to Chicago, we would definately consider staying here if the price is good relative to other hotels. If you can get a room for $200/night or less, its worth it..Or if you are staying for a week or more and want to be able to cook some meals yourself or have more room. But I doubt I would pay $300/night for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: upalis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seneca is located next to John Hancock centre. Magnificent mile is one block away. Hotel is very clean and the staff is helpful. It is very busy in the summer months and advanced booking is recommended. Hotel was sold out during our stay there. Breakfast is included in the room rate and we really enjoyed it. Only issue is with the parking. Hotel parking is very expensive and cheaper parking is available nearby. We parked two blocks away and paid $ 50.00 for one and half days. Room rates are reasonably priced compared to the other hotels in the vicinity. We will definitely stay in this hotel when we visit Chicago next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Senaca”
Reviews.Author: cemertins
Reviews.Content: Initially I booked Senaca because of location and price and some fairly good reviews. For myself, it was a great experience and I will return. It is not a glitzy, high end, high tech hotel. You will not be surrounded by the young professional with briefcase and expensive clothes. You will not impress people with the price you paid, or the free hors d'oeuvres in the lobby. If that is what makes your stay, don't stay at the Senaca. It is quiet, and the cliente are casual and many times European. The rooms are neat, clean , spacious and decorated in Colonial. My room had a sitting area and a kitchen. It looked like it was painted and wall papered in the last two years. The free breakfast was bacon (ham or sausage) and eggs, french toast or pancakes. The best part of my experience was that I slept better here than any high end hotel I've been to. The sheets were soft and comfortable, the temperature upon entering was perfect and the "air' quiet. Perhaps it was because this is an old building,I felt that the room was breathing, that is, a small amount of air exchange from the outside. It was not stuffy and did not smell of a cleaning solution. I did not feel trapped in a small, stuffy hotel room in a building with 1,000 other people (or more). I hit the bed and slept soundly. I was a single woman and did not fear for my privacy. Downfalls: The door knob was loose and once or twice I had to fidget with it; the hair dryer did not work, I was given a new one the next day, two pieces of furniture were old and scratched. If you need high tech, contemporary furniture, lots of young people exercising in the health center, and be surrounded by hundreds of career people in business attire and carrying computers, don't stay here. Highlights: Location the best, right behind the Hancock, good breakfast, good service, I had no problem getting a taxi. The two restaurants were excellent, the steak house is Zagut rated. The room was "roomy", it smelt fresh, it was pleasant to sleep in, it was safe, it was not totally out of sight expensive. I will stay there again, happily.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seneca”
Reviews.Author: bps-uk
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Chicago and we stayed at The Seneca. Check-in was smooth and we booked a suite which turned out to be huge. It was also clean and well maintained. It had a bedroom with 2 double beds, a separate living area/extra bed area and a fully fitted kitchen. It was next to the Hancock Tower, a shopping mall with places to eat and drink, just off the mile and within walking distance to Navy Pier. Bus stops are also just at the end of the block. We received breakfast vouchers which we were not expecting - an added bonus. We really enjoyed our night here. Staff were friendly - especially the Spurs fan on the door!

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations - Will stay again if I go to Chicago again.”
Reviews.Author: hagow_boy
Reviews.Content: The TripAdvisor website helped me with my choice when booking through hotels.com so I have to contribute back. First off, my rate was $150 US/night so I am basing my review in relation to what I paid. Also, aside from the fact of its great convenient location, my rating of Neutral/Average is strictly rating the hotel and the price I paid. Room is average, nothing great, but served its purposes easily as I was in town for a convention. I stayed on the 4th floor and only had 1 bed. Was in town for 4 nights. GOOD THINGS : Tons of closet space, 2 closets, 1 having shelves which was great. Electronic safe in unit as well. Full size fridge/freezer which was very handy. Free wireless internet, though very slow connection. They change access codes on Monday, so take note if it stops working, you will need to call down and ask for new code. When searching for the connection, note it is NOT "seneca" as that is their in-house server. Choose the connection that has the strongest signal, I forget the name. Large washroom, wide bathtub, not the ones your bump your arms into the wall. Quiet hotel, even though its full-house, don't hear much noise. Thick light blocking curtain that closes, not the type that is fixed and can't close. Full stove, but never needed to use it. BAD THINGS : Microwave door latch was a bit broken. Light bulb in one light was broken. Old fashion door with key. Tons of kitchen cupboards that take up space. Warm to cold water. There is not hot water in the shower. Very small elevator, holds 5 people. If anyone has a suitcase, maybe holds 2 people and their luggage. Staff was average, not the most friendly and attentive, but not rude either. Bed was a bit old, a little lopsided, old springs I guess. Only 2 pillows, extra were in plastic in the closet. Still have old bed covers which I removed. Room had aircon and it was 85F when I went. Didn't matter which setting I had the fan on, it always seemed to be the same temp and velocity. But it was comfortable for me, maybe not for a couple or family. LOCATION : One of the best. Walked everywhere and it only took 5 to 10 minutes to get where I needed to go. Went to 2 shopping malls, 6 different restaurants, pharmacy, etc. Everything is close by and area is very safe. Never needed a taxi except to get to convention center and airport. Walked to Rush Street restaurants and clubs, 2 shopping malls, Apple Store, Niketown, Adidas, Puma, Giordano's pizza, Sephora, etc. I didn't have high expectations of the hotel. I just wanted it to be safe and clean and the Seneca definitely was good for the price I paid and I will book again if I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Concern”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTraveler1
Reviews.Content: This letter was written to the General Manager Michael Vito Mr. Vito, I am writing regarding a concern about your front desk operations. Generally my stay at your hotel July 29 - 31 was pleasant and relaxing. The front desk staff at check - in was courteous and helpful, the room was spacious and clean and the physical plant was overall decorated well with attention to detail. A scan of on line reviews of your facility before my visit was mixed to positive with the majority of concerns consisting of complaints about the demeanor of staff and the age of the hotel. It was my intention before this morning to add a positive review to the on - line travel sites. I contacted the front desk at 1:30 ish on monday night/tuesday morning to request a 5:30 a.m. wake up call. The staff wished me a good night and I went to sleep. When I turned over the clock read 6:00 am which I thought strange until I noted the same time on my pda. After a quick shower and a call to the valet I checked out at the front desk . I indicated that I did not receive the requested wake up call and requested he check for me. He confirmed that it was on the list but merely shrugged his shoulders as an explanation. I missed my flight to Los Angeles and I am now in the unique hell that is contemporary air travel. Hotel operations are complex organizations and any one piece (housekeeping, front desk, reservations management) can cause a guest to respond negatively to their stay. You can be proud of the performance of your staff. My stay was largely glitch free, positive and I would recommend, with reservations your hotel. However, it is important that the overnight desk staff, which in most circumstances are junior employees, understand that all components of their work is critical to the experience of the guest and of course business operations. I will be sharing this letter with a couple of on line blogs and travel review sites.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: puzzifem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. For $300, the room was tiny, old, musty, and filthy. The desk staff is quite simply and literally, without exaggeration, incompetent. Even worse still, two months after the stay, an unauthorized charge from the hotel (for something seemingly unrelated to our stay) showed up on my credit card! The charge has been traced to them, and is in dispute. Poor accomodations and poor service are bad - but, not being able to trust a merchant with your credit card information is beyond unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seneca Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sharon,Dublin
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for its location, price & friendly service. Great diner downstairs for breakfast & the steak house was fantastic, pricey but worth it. Location 1 block from the John Handcock Tower, beside Cheesecake factory ... great for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: NYCShoppingQueen
Reviews.Content: Charming Old Style Hotel across the street from the John Hancock building. Right in the heart of N. Michigan Avenue district, near all the main attractions. RIght near the Red Line and ALL buses. Hotel lobby recently renovated with lots of wood panels. Old World Charm. Rooms are very spacious. I had a full kitchen stocked with everything. Rooms can use some updating but it was fine. Maid service excellent. Hotel staff top. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DrBus
Reviews.Content: An older, but extremely well-appointed and maintained "maginificent mile" hotel at a bargain price. Appearance of the hotel (inside and out) is that of a traditonal, well-established NYC manhattan hotel; it is kitty-corner to the John Hancock Center, and a city block walk to Michigan Avenue shopping. We booked a "deluxe double" room which included a full kitchenette (4-burner stove.oven; refrigerator; coffee maker; microwave). Breakfast coupons were included based on the number of "adults" in the room that can be used on the on-premises Chesnut Street Grille restaurant--more of a deli-- (one flight down): two eggs, ham or sausage; toast or pancakes, and coffee. The host offered to allow food substitutions if the difference in price was paid (except beverage: coffee is it), that is the coupon os worth $7.50. Most main breakfast items were $7.75-$9.25. Desk staff was efficient and friendly. They have wireless Internet. We used the parking garage directly across the street wich was $25 overnight vs. $43 valet (plus tax) at the hotel; of course you get no "in and out" proivileges with that. The attendants were attentive. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: attygirl
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The first stay was about 4 years ago. I was pleasantly surprised to see the hotel seems to have gone through some renovation. The lobby is small but very nice and comfortable. I love the location right next to the John Hancock building as I always have to visit the signature room for a drink! Within 2 blocks of the hotel there are all my favorite shops and i like being close to rush street for food. This hotel is not the most luxurious but I love the large rooms. The hotel is clean and the staff are very helpful. We booked a King Suite and upon arrival were upgraded to a Presidental Suite with free internet access and free breakfast. The suite had a bath and half, washer and dryer, full kitchen, dinning area, living room, seperate bedroom, seperate shower and tub. If we can find a decent rate ($150-$250/night durring the summer on a weekend) we will definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: mamareada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senaca for a "Sister" get-a-way and you can not beat the location / price. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. We opted for self-park across the street, which was super easy to do, and saved 20 something dollars for parking. I was a little surprised that everything was as old as it was, I think the rooms could use a little updating.... but everything was very clean. Beds were very firm (which my sisters prefer), no padding on the matresses. However the linens were nice, not at all stiff or scratchy. As I said, we LOVED the location. We walked to Second City and to the river for boat cruise. It is a wonderful location and far and away the best priced hotel I could find anywhere near there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMelon
Reviews.Content: When we booked our hotel reservation, we chose this place because of its location - right by Michigan Ave. We should have known that for where it is located, its price was way too cheap. When we arrived, we had to put our luggage in storage because our room wasn't ready (we were an hour early), which was ok except that the guy who came to get our luggage barely spoke English and had tons of bags sitting in the lobby- all of which were supposed to be in luggage. So we were concerned about leaving our luggage with him. We came back in the evening and got our room keys. They never told us that our keys had an electronic chip in them to open the main door to get to the rooms, and as we were trying to figure it out for several minutes how to get the door open, no one at the desk told us even though they were just sitting there. Other guests coming in told us and said that they had the same problem when they arrived and no one had told them. Then we got to our room, and the door was very difficult to open and shut. The bed sagged on one side, so if I rolled over too far, I would roll right out. The place was fairly clean and a nice size, but the bed wasn't comfortable at all. We stayed for 3 days, and on the 2nd day the toilet would not flush and was actually backing up from whatever was in the lines already. I went to the desk and told them the problem and said that we would be out all day. They promised the problem would be fixed by the time we got back. When we got back, our door was unlocked (we had definitely locked it before we left) and nothing was fixed. There was a message on our phone saying our door was double locked (which is impossible if you are not in the room) so they couldn't get in and it was our fault it wasn't fixed or cleaned. The toilet was absolutely disgusting. There was literally stuff backing up into it. So I went to the desk and complained. There were 2 people at the desk and they just looked at me and said, "what do you want us to do about it?" I told them that I wanted it to be fixed because we had no working toilet in our bathroom. They sent someone up, and he did fix it but used all of our clean towels to wipe his hands. But he told us he was going to personally see that a maid came to clean the bathroom and give us fresh towels, and no one ever showed up. Also, on the phones, they had no numbers or information to call the desk. And to use the internet, they never tell you what you need to do unless you go specifically ask for a password. Luckily, we assumed that we needed one. We had to walk downstairs every time we needed something, and we needed a lot since nothing would work the first time. Like other visitors have commented, the hot water only exists occasionally and water pressure is not good no matter what time of day you choose to shower. I'd suggest paying the extra $100 a night if you want to stay at a hotel close to Michigan Ave...at least then you will have working bathrooms and beds that aren't broken.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Great location (one block from the Magnificent Mile). Convenient in terms of public transportation. Great price $140 (discounted price). Clean. Quiet. Very spacious. Essentially a one-bedroom apartment complete with kitchen, dining area, sitting room, bedroom, 2 TV's (my son liked that), and multiple closets. If I had to change anything, it would be to upgrde the carpets--a little dowdy. The pillows were a little too firm for my tastes. If you like having your head at a 45 degree angle, they are fine. My son had no issue with the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price”
Reviews.Author: datz70
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in early May. The room was very spacious and included a fully equipped kitchenette. There was plenty of closet space and a safe in the room for no extra charge. Also included was breakfast each morning up to $7.50 value, which was excellent in nice surroundings. There are two restaurants and a bar within the hotel. The bar is great for a late drink before bed and we found the staff to be very hospitable. The hotel is next door to the John Hancock Centre and yards away from Michigan Avenue. We paid $135 plus taxes per night which is great value for the location and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca Hotel--Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Storyspinning
Reviews.Content: My three sisters-in-law and I spent four nights at the Seneca, while touring Chicago. We had two rooms for the four of us. It was perfect! The location is between Lakeshore Drive and Michigan Avenue, and very convenient to bus lines and/or walking. It's also across the street from the Watertower Shopping Mall & Food Court. The hotel was a jewel. Each room apparently has a unique lay-out, and all of the rooms (I think) have complete kitchenettes: stove, microwave, refrigerator, some dishes, sink; also ample closet space. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel has two places to eat, a coffee shop for breakfast and a nicer restaurant for dinner. But the staff was really what won us over. The front desk personnel were friendly, helpful and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a find! My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: MangoTango007
Reviews.Content: Honestly I was hesitant about staying at the Seneca, based on some previous postings here at TripAdvisor. I actually called the manager in advance of my visit to discuss my concerns and found him to be very responsive and forthright. So I went forward with my booking and am THRILLED that I did. As other travelers have stated, the location CANNOT BE BETTER. (The Ritz Carlton is a block away.) You're 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue. It's fabulously convenient. Our room had been renovated, so we had excellent accommodations. Loved having the kitchen. Housekeeping service was A+ -- the room was very clean. The ladies at the front desk were super helpful, I would especially commend Katherine. I was traveling with my 8-year-old daughter, so safety was always my first issue. Katherine never steered me wrong on any recommendations. The doormen were also VERY helpful and cheerful. All in all, it was a terrific experience. This will be my new home away from home when I am in Chicago. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: icing70
Reviews.Content: The Seneca is located just next to the Water Tower place, the best shopping mall in Chicago. So the location was fantastic, there was also a Starbucks just down the same road. Other stores like Victoria Secret, FileneÂ´s basement (a great designer outlet store), Barnes & Noble , The cheese cake factory were just around the corner. I stayed on the third floor and still the pressure wasnÂ´t that great for the shower and it took 15 minutes or more to get warm water. Apart from that the room was great. All rooms have a complete kitchen with fridge and microwave. This made my week-long stay more nicer. Free internet service in the entire hotel too. I really recommend you to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine.”
Reviews.Author: nll1982
Reviews.Content: The Seneca is perfectly pleasant. It's not a high end hotel, so if you go in understanding that, you'll be fine. Pros: -The rooms are very large, with full kitchens and dining areas. This is great for traveling families. -The front desk staff is helpful and responsive -The lobby area is comfortable and beautiful -Fantastic location -Low cost -The room cost does include a continental breakfast. It is very simple (bagels, toast, muffins fruit) and does not contain any proteins. Cons: -The beds are very uncomfortable. I was in a king suite and the mattress was just worn and sloped down to the middle. -You have to toggle back and forth between a large room key and an electronic key fob for access to different points within the hotel. -The doormen could have been more responsive with things like hailing taxis. -The bathrooms are very outdated and are awkward to function in. -The rooms are a bit oversized for a standard business traveler in town for only a day or two. Your money would be better spent at a place with better beds. All in all, it was just... fine. It's not spectacular, but it's functional and clean for a traveling couple/family who is looking to stay in a great location on a meager budget and plans on cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirlsDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca Hotel, Chicago for six days in February. We had a queen suite which was huge. Location was fabulous, right beside The Hancock Building and The Magnificent Mile. Reception were more than helpful with any query we had. Breakfast was included, selection was good, but not a huge amount of seating room. Overall, wonderful value for money. We plan to stay there on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Seneca”
Reviews.Author: mo617
Reviews.Content: On a 4 day stay at the Seneca Hotel in Chicago. Had a 1 bedroom suite. Was spacious, clean and a heck of a deal at 110 per night. The bonus of an added kitchen was great and the location cannot be beaten. Right in the heart of it all. I cannot say enought nice things about the hotel and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Went with my mother and 3 year old daughter. The added sofabed in the living room was a big bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mrniceguy1102
Reviews.Content: The Seneca Hotel is a very understated place to stay while in Chicago. I've been there six times in the past four years, both for business and pleasure. The location is excellent, the price is perfect, and the rooms are large. Each room includes a kitchen; complete with fridge, microwave, oven, and sink. A small supply of cooking utensils are even included. It isn't the newest hotel out there, and it isn't impeccibly clean. You won't feel like a superstar staying here, but unless you make that much money, you will no doubt appreciate the savings. That being said, I have never enjoyed a hotel more than The Seneca. Step out the door and within two minutes you're on Miracle Mile. It's right next to the John Hancock Center (you know - the second tallest building in Chicago). Cheesecake factory is in the base of JH Center, and a GREAT place to eat. There's a market around the corner if you want to make your own meals. Within a ten minute walk is the Water Tower, Chicago River, 100's of stores, Rush Street, and even the lake. At $100/night less than most hotels in the area, it is an excellent place to stay. There is a steak house in the hotel, which I've heard is good although I've never tried it. Some typical problems at the Seneca are the same as most hotels. There may not be much hot water during peak times, I wouldn't check the cleanliness with a white glove, and the front desk workers aren't naturally friendly; although just talk to them nicely and they will return the favor. You'll find from my other reviews that I enjoy spending less on the hotel and more on having fun elsewhere. I've stayed here by myself, with a business partner, and even with my family including five kids under 6. I'd recommend the suite with valet parking. There is a large living and dining area, a bedroom with its own bathroom, and you can go in and out with your car all day long. Parking in Chicago is expensive and difficult to come by especially in this area.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Little Secret in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Kouris
Reviews.Content: Chicago: The Seneca Hotel, Chicago, Il Date: Nov. 26, 2006 Reviewer: San Clemente, CA Just got back from Chicago and had a fabulous time. This hotel was the greatest. Clean and reasonable, friendly staff, great location, directly across from the Water Tower Plaza and John Hancock Building (go to the 96th floor for a cocktail). In walking distance to everything, one block from Michigan Ave. (The Magnificent Mile). Fitness center very clean with all the necessary equipment. Didn't use any other facilities. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite, perfect for 4 people and you can't beat the price. I will definitly stay at this place again and recommend to everyone I talk to. You can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: tvlldy
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay, Nov. 6-9, 2006 , at this property because of the location in downtown Chicago. The first night we were in a room with an inoperable air conditioner. We were given a another room on the second day of our stay. I went in the bathroom to use the jacuzzi and lo and behold, there was rusty water coming out of the faucet when I turned it on. We were moved to another room on the third day and this rooms refrigerator was buzzing like it was about to explode. Needless to say, we would not be able to sleep because of the loud noise from the refrigerator. So we had to be moved to yet another room which was the last night of our stay. The general manager of the hotel expressed his apologies, but only after the third day of moving us from room to room. My travel agent on a 3 way call with us called the property to speak with the manager and was told he was not on property, which we knew was not true because we had just spoken to him. Needless to say, I would not recommend this property. It is in a great location, but to be moved to three rooms during a four night stay is unbelievable. The rooms need updating and maintenance needed on the appliances in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fortunate
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay in Chicago. The Seneca hotel was in a perfect location... close to shops and restaurants and nightlife. We had a great time. The rooms weren't huge, but they had all the space you need for a very comfortable stay including a full kitchen. We had one small problem with the gas stove in our room, but had it fixed within about ten minutes of calling the front desk. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The cafe downstairs makes a great breakfast if you just want a casual bite or delicious omelet. Service was friendly and prompt. A+!

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Siesta_Key_Sara
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked a 2 night stay in the Seneca in early October 2006. We'd been to the steakhouse in the Seneca for an incredible meal on a previous occasion. The location is fantastic and the building looked very nice, so we thought it would be good to stay there on our next visit. The room we had was small and could use some updating but the rates are unbeatable for downtown Chicago. The morning after our first night we were contacted by the front desk @ 10:30 and informed that we needed to check out of the hotel because we were only booked for a 1 night stay. We had booked the room with their local sales manager, she had said there would be no problem with 2 nights when we made the reservation. Checkout time is 11am and their calling us @ 10:30 makes me suspect they must have overbooked the hotel. We asked them to help us find another place to stay and the manager printed out a list of hotels in Chicago which he gave to us and said that was help enough. Our situation was already stressful as we were in town to see a family member that is in the hospital. Mr. Corey Steinberg is the hotel manager, he didn't apologize, he didn't care about us being in Chicago with no place to stay nor did he seem to care about how he treated us. The staff appeared to be embarrassed and did try to help us once the manager had stepped away. Either way they basically kicked us out with no place to stay and it was insulting and frustrating to be treated in this manner. In our haste to pack up and get back to the hospital we ended up leaving our cell phone in the room. Which we didn't realize until several hours later while standing bedside at the hospital. The local hotel staff couldn't find our new razor phone and now somebody else is answering and hanging up when we call with the hope they will return the phone. In 30 years of traveling around the world I've never met a hotel manager with less care or concern for his guests. And I think the rating of horrible needs to be added below terrible in order to describe our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seneca”
Reviews.Author: normamull
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Seneca, Sept. 28 & 29. We paid for a queen deluxe room and for whatever reason, we were placed in a one bedroom suite with a kitchen. It was spacious & very clean. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The location is fabulous. We enjoyed a great steak dinner at the Steakhouse Saloon also at the hotel and danced to the jazz trio at the Grill Lounge. A wonderful Chicago experience. We'll go bacxk. The Mulligans

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: chris248
Reviews.Content: As my friend and I continue to tour every ballpark in the USA. The Seneca Hotel worked great for our 1 night stay and our trip to US Cellular Field. The hotel is within walking distance to an EL station on Chicago Street and the red line took us right to the ballpark. It's right across the street from the Hancock Center and only a few block from The Mile. For $110 on Hotels.Com; the price could not be beat for the location!! Also within walking distance from some quality neighborhood taverns (a post-game ritual). The pillow wasn't the best and the bathroom was tiny. However, after a night at the ballpark and a night on the town. Who Cares? Just needed a place to crash and it worked great! I would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Really yucky”
Reviews.Author: andrealulu
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights Aug. 17 and 18 at about $110 inclucing taxes per night (bundled in a package from yahoo travel). Location was great, staff was friendly, lobby was lovely, but our room was seriously lacking. Decor was horrid as was the view from the 17th floor. But it was clean enough, just really worn down with water stained ceiling, mismatched furniture, uncomfortable bed, pilly bedspread, and extremely stained carpet. Also had terrible water pressure and the toilet ran nonstop. On on 2nd night we had the opportunity to stay elsewhere (free of charge) so we split after one night. By the way, I am NOT a neat freak or a germaphobe, just a normal person. Now I know 110 a night for downtown is "SUPER FANTASTIC" for Chicago... but it is still 110 dollars and who wants to be grossed out for 110 a night? I regret paying $110 - I should've upgraded and not been such a cheapskate! Readers who are sceptical about the Seneca have to decide 1) the value 2) personal tollerance of the "yucky" factor 3) the benefits of the location If you want to save $75 to $150 and can deal with old shaby lodgings... this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: jkloville
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this hotel, especially after it had been recommended by friends and family. We were expecting it to have just been renovated, but apparently, the room we received had not. First, check in time was 3:00, but our room was not ready for at least an hour after that. I couldn't get the bellman to take my luggage, so someone had to wait with it in the lobby. The room seemed old and dark, the bed and sofabed were not comfortable, and the bathroom was very small. The service was slow when it happened. We called for towels, but they never came. The staff was not very friendly, except for the doorman. After one night, we decided to move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: stuckinthemiddle
Reviews.Content: Okay, if you want to spend $350 a night for a room, go somewhere else. But if you want great value in the shadow of the Hancock, two blocks from Rush, one block from Michigan, two blocks from Oak Street Beach and a $10 cab ride (for four) to just about anywhere in the Loop and surroundings then go to the Seneca. Our room was clean, updated, roomy and included a kitchette. Our price? $102 Thursday, and $165 Friday and Saturday. (Two million people were there that weekend for the air show - not to mention a sold out Cubs/Cards game, a Bears preseason game and the Tut exhibit!) Would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug808
Reviews.Content: great hotel! huge room! small bathroom. had a kitchen which helped when we brought back leftover pizza! we loved giodarnos and had them freeze it, we put it in the freezer until we left for home...very handy-also had a microwave! great location too..a great mall right across of the hotel, go to the john hancock tower for drinks-great view! we had a blast in chicago...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Go for it - better than reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: cjules13
Reviews.Content: Ok, here's the scoop. Lots of spotty reviews here, but all relatively minor. I was nervous too after reading all of these, but found myself pleasantly surprised with the Seneca. First of all remember this: You are flanked on the south by the Ritz-Carlton, on the North by the Drake Hotel, and on the west by the Four Seasons. You are also 1 block from the Mag Mile and in the shadow of the amazing Hancock building. So right away, your are doing good if you end up here. On to the hotel itself, we stayed for 2 nights in mid-august for $109/night. Again, anything remotely close to this location will cost you at least double. Another win. The bellman and doormen we very professional, funny and nice. Front desk staff gave fine service, and the lobby construction is complete and looks very nice and not cramped at all. We were given a king suite on the second floor. I didn't hear a spot of noise and slept fine all night. The room was a little tired, but one should be able to overlook this for the price and location. If not, go spring for a room at the Ritz. This room had 2 giant rooms, closets galore, and a small kitchen. This would be an amazing find if I had kids as we could all stay comfortably in one room. There were 2 TVs. The kitchen has everything you could need for a trip, and the bathroom was recently remodeled. There were little things wrong, like tables not being completely wiped down, a small tear in the sheet, one TV remote need batteries etc, but nothing really major. Breakfast room service was awesome from the Deli, fast, cheap, and hot. The Saloon Steakhouse is ok, but given the 10 other steakhouses in downtown Chicago, you can do much better. Get a reservation at Gibsons instead. So all in all, I think all the complaints about this place are a wash when price and location are taken into account. As long as you're not trying to impress a first date or be on your honeymoon, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have liked it more”
Reviews.Author: Frobozz
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could have liked the Seneca more than I did. The space you get for the price is sensational and the location is terrific. However: --When we checked in, we were given a smoking room on the second floor. My reservation was for a non-smoking room. The desk clerk insisted that her list showed the room she gave us was a non-smoking room. Uh uh -- there were ashtrays scattered around the room and it reeked of cigarettes. --Air conditioning never worked worth a hoot. We understood that on the first day, when the temps were nearly 100 degrees in a city where it doesn't get that hot, but the temps dropped after that and our room never cooled below about 78 degrees. I heard several other guests with the same complaint. --We left a wake-up call for our second day there and never got it. Fortunately we had set another alarm. --The kitchen lacked some basic cooking utensils (it had pots and pans, but one kitchen knife and nothing like, say, a spatula); the handle on the oven door was missing; the reflectors were missing on two burners on the stove. --Maid service was so slow the first day that when the maid finally did show up at 4:30 p.m., we sent her away (this was on a weekday and the hotel appeared far from full). It was better after that. --The security lock wouldn't work on the front door unless you did some serious door gymnastics. There were several other minor annoyances, but they added up to a hotel that has some potential but has basic problems with maintenance and staffing. Still, if you're willing to put up with the quirkiness of the place and the spotty problems, you will get a lot of hotel room for your money (at least, for your money in this part of town). However, it just didn't pass the test for me -- and I'm not that picky.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Lady Dy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Seneca. After reading some of the reviews, we were a little nervous. The hotel where we usually stay (also a small boutique hotel) was booked. We travel to Chicago annually "just because" we love downtown. I now have two hotels I would love to stay at and with GREAT prices. The room was clean, huge and staff was very helpful and friendly. With the exception of the 100 degree weather, it couldn't have been a better weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Seneca. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: slimshaney
Reviews.Content: Hi, My girlfriend and I stayed at the Seneca from July 3rd - July 6th. Got to the hotel around 8pm - had no problem checking in. Lobby is being refurbished, so looks messy at the moment - but not a problem. Checked in, and got a King Suite on the 12th floor. The suite was fantastic - very large lounge with nice decor, fixutes and fittings. Two sofas, coffee table, dining table and 6 chairs, large TV, nice lamps etc. Big kitchen - with everything we could want - cooker, fridge, microwave etc... Bedroom was nice - very comfy King size bed, large TV, nice furniture etc... Bathroom was fine - large vanity area, bath and shower. Never heard any building/construction noise whilst we were in our rooms. The location is more than perfect - right next to the Hannock Building/Mich Ave. Doormen/cleaning staff etc were nice and friendly. Price of the stay was extremely good value. We would most try and stay there again (returning to Chicago for a longer stay next summer), and would advise people to give it a go too. Cheers, Shane :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag of a place”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVolunteer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to Chicago and so we alloted a full week to "do" the town, and we chose the Seneca hotel based upon the reviews here that we had earlier read. My wife booked the flight and hotel all through Orbitz, however. When we got to the hotel we were very pleased to see its excellent location. The hotel is only about two short blocks from the FREE SHUTTLE that Chicago has to all of the museums and tourist attractions in town. It is immediately next door to the Hancock Tower, and also kitty-corner from a shopping mall which has inexpensive food stalls for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. In short, an excellent location. But the service is horrible, and the "caring attitude" is completely missing. We were told that as we booked through Orbitz, we were not "entitled" to the free continental breakfast (roll, coffee, and juice), and we were not "entitled" to ask for a room change. The room that we had was on the second floor, back, and it had a mini-kitchen, so we were not terribly disadvantaged, but the picture on the back of the door showed that it was the smallest room on the floor, and there was construction going on nearby so that we awoke one morning to jackhammers! Also, we reported that our coffee maker was missing a leg, and so it woobled, but nothing was done. The chambermaid, whom we never met, must have never had instructions. One day we had two towels left, and the next day: four. One day there were no washcloths, and the next day we had them. Three days she left every light in the room on and they were burning when we came in, and on the other days the place was pitch dark. Who knows? In short, any review would be the mixed bag indicating the great location and the poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, surly service”
Reviews.Author: MarkToronto
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my wife and 3 yr old, found it a wonderful location in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. It's a faded beauty, with much of the charm of a European style hotel. We stayed in a King Suite - had a old but functional kitchen, large outdated rooms, clean. There are few of the chain hotel amenities, like room service and ice machines on every floor, but with the kitchen, we saved on breakfasts and snacks. The main drawback was the unhelpful and often surly front desk staff - uniformly uninterested in our needs and uninformed about the hotel and area. If any of them have been to hospitality school, they probably flunked out. The doormen were great however. Go for the good price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca was eclectic and will go there again!”
Reviews.Author: neighbor_nancy
Reviews.Content: I agree there are reasons to love and hate this place. My family group booked 3 rooms. We could easily have stayed in the King suite that was essential a 2 bedroom apt, but they'd told me it wasn't available when I'd tried to book it originally. That one had a jacuzzi tub, washer dryer, and 2 separate bedrooms. It was gorgeous! My suite was a bit run-down, but I found the problems charming - they go along with any older hotel/apt. A ltitle force was necessary to close the bathroom door (multiple layers of paint without sanding first, I suspect). When the bathroom door closed the vanity door popped open. It was cause for much laughter on my part, but not all appreciate a bit of character in a place. Pros: Location wonderful. Lots of renovation in progress. Concierge/doorman very helpful in getting limos to airport and directing to public transportation. It was wonderful having a full kitchen! Cons: definitely more renovations needed. More deskhelp needed. Since we're currently from NY the attitude of the help behind the desk didn't strike me as terribly rude Those traveling from the Midwest seemed to have a different view of the same situations (I'm originally from the MW, so I do understand the preference for civility). NOTE: as others have mentioned, it helps to have a room on one of the higher floors or on the back side of the bldg to reduce noise problems. There was a lot of street/parking garage/jackhammer noise for others. HTH!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you enjoy a lack of Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just a few weeks ago............March 2006. Held my family reunion there. I was attracted to the location of the hotel and to the fact that each room includes a kitchen. Well, I should have paid the extra $100 and stayed at a 5 star hotel. You get what you paid for! This hotel is old......where do I start with my list of complaints, the door locks to the rooms are actually keys, not key cards, the door knob to the presidential suite fell off the door and didnot go back on the door nor did the hotel send anyone to repair it. The carpet is dirty and the air is stale. The maids failed to leave the proper amount of towels to days in a row........hello everyone needs a face towel....... guest services mixed up our rooms gave single beds to those who needed double beds. There were issue with the water in the rooms. And my credit card was not properly billed, either! Enough already...........I can't even give all the issues we had with this hotel............. Dont waste your time or money on staying here. Oh yeah, the upper management don't care to hear your problems either.........all they do is pass the buck!

Reviews.Title: “A reason for the divergent reviews: revealed”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have noted divergent reviews of this hotel and could not figure out the reason for the discrepancies. I may have figured out at least one reason: Travelers, especially those on business, choosing standard, deluxe, i.e., non-suite rooms visit a very different hotel than those staying in a suite, especially one on an upper floor. I can only support this theory with my experience below: I have stayed at this hotel two years ago on vacation in a queen suite on an the 10th floor and have been very satisfied. March 18, 2006 I went for two nights on business and requested a standard "deluxe" room. My experience was very different. I booked on Expedia months in advance. I had called the hotel directly two weeks beforehand requesting a quiet room since I was going on buiness and needed the room to work. I was told I could only get what was available when I arrived. I guess they felt they already had my money and I had to take what I could get. I checked in at 5:30 pm, the earliest I could get there. I was given a room on the second floor over the bar. I heard Sinatra recordings until 3am. I could even hear the lyrics. No joke. The room reeked of nauseating ancient cooking odors that seemed to permeate the walls and furnishings. The furniture (some of it broken) and window blinds were coated with grime, the floor buckled, the rug was frayed. I had to be careful where I stepped due to the tripping hazard. I was told they were booked and there was nothing they could do. This puts travelers from the West Coast at a disadvantage who cannot always arrive by noon when rooms open up. The hotel won't help them since they won't accommodate room requests in advance. There is not enough staff to accommodate guests. I don't fault the staff. They are simply swamped. I would recommend this hotel only because of its location - close to the Miracle Mile and many other attractions. The street is quiet too. The hotel is better for vacation travelers. I don't recommend getting a room that is not a higher floor suite. However, I don't know that you can get the hotel to accommodate such requests. I certainly don't recommend this hotel to a business traveler who needs quiet and comfort in order to work in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware? More like, Buyer Be AWARE of this great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: World_X_Plor
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about my upcoming stay at The Seneca Hotel after reading Buyer Beware's comments and pictures... I must tell you, I had a completely different expereince! The hotel was lovely! You can't beat the price, location, cleanliness, and warm staff. I would highly recommend it! Buyer Beware was so off the mark I was compelled to take pictures to prove it!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: wisconsintripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seneca for 2 nights, Dec 28-30..We are not fussy travelers, and have stayed at a variety of hotels around the country. Before you book this hotel, read our pros and cons: PROS: Excellent location, one block from Hancock Center and northern end of Michigan avenue; clean room; nice wine bar (expensive like everywhere else); valet parking ($38-most hotels around that price for 24 hours); jacuzzi tub (1 person only) in bathroom; great price of $59 booked online (CRShotels online booking site).. we were a little concerned about the cheap price. Here is the reason for the lower rating: CONS: We booked a Deluxe Queen room. Person that checked us in was not very friendly. Other staff were friendly. Room is very small, bathroom can only accomodate one person in front of mirror (smallest bathroom I have ever been in at any hotel); there was not a walk in kitchen like the website shows, but a kitchenette inside a small closet- it served our needs, but if we were of larger size, we couldn't squeeze into the closet to use the sink..the refrigerator had a loud buzzing noise, if you closed the doors you couldn't hear it; there were no dishtowels or hot pads, so we had to use the bathroom towels; the floor in the bedroom area is uneven; the furniture looks like it came from a rummage sale, and there is only 1 chair at a desk, so if you want to eat in your room (which we usually do at hotels we stay at), you have only the chair and the desk--sorry, but we took a chair from the hallway to use during our stay.we put it back when we were done; no VCRS like the website states; our room was on the 5th floor, and it faced the back of the buildings behind us, and included a garbage dumpster and a construction site. We were woken up both mornings to the sounds of pounding and drilling (7:30am).we just opened up the kitchenette door to hear the sound of the buzzing refrigerator instead of the noise outside!! WE also didn't have a drain in our bathtub, and had to call housekeeping to get one. So our recommendation would be to: 1.)look at the room first before you accept a room, 2.)ask for a room away from the construction site 3.)maybe upgrade to a king suite or other room if you don't like the one you get. 4.)ask lots of questions about your room, the websites are deceiving-I saw one website that says this hotel has a pool-it does not, only a fitness room 5,)if you plan on not using your car, think about parking at a public lot for less money instead of at the hotel. There is public parking on the same block. 6) book this hotel if you get a rate under $75 We would consider staying somewhere nicer next time we are in Chicago, however the rate was Awesome...maybe good for a group of people who just want a cheap sleep!! There are plenty of other nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Michigan Avenue touring!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaW
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews before we went, I was getting a bit nervous about staying at the Seneca. I was actually quite pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The location is excellent for touring on Michigan Avenue. We were in Chicago for the Mag Mile Lights Festival, right around the corner from the John Hancock building and across the street from Water Tower Place. The room we had was a king suite. It is set up like a small apartment, with a full kitchen, a dining and living area and a separate bedroom with full walk-in closets. The bathroom is a bit on the small side. Our room was on the 7th floor and we did have to wait on the elevator once to the point where we just took the stairs down, not a big problem for us, but something to consider. There is a lobby where they were offering complimentary warm cider and holiday cookies, a very nice touch. There is also a deli/breakfast shop in the hotel and a restaurant, which looked quite nice. There is a fitness room, which also looked good. The only real negative I can think of is the kind of older locks on the room doors. You need to be careful that it is locked...I am used to the more modern key-cards with hotels, but they use actual old-fashioned keys at this place. The front desk staff was very nice, the bellmen were plentiful and also quite nice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “OK but website decieving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what it shows on the website but it was ok. There was no air conditoning and the elevator broke causing some problems and the front desk ladies were not helpful or friendly at all. The door man was awesome. Also be careful the locks on your door may not always work well.

Reviews.Title: “Old; but not horrible”
Reviews.Author: travellrp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we needed a full kitchen and two rooms during our stay. (We have a 4 year old and 2 year old and food allergies.) All in all it was fine, but not great. The bad: very old and worn (bed post was broken and fell onto bed); no sprinkler system (which is saying something because the hotel is full of 25 year old ovens); less-than-helpful staff; no luxury whatsoever. The good: two good-size rooms; huge closet (very good for 4 people and luggage); very quiet; very clean room and kitchen; great location (behind Water Tower place and 1/2 block to nice park for kids); and kitchen with basics. For the price it was fine and I might stay there again with children under 6 but as an adult or adult couple you can do MUCH better for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, but that's it. Very old, slightly tattered furniture in room. Bathroom fixtures are rust stained. Claustrophobic reception area and hallways. Confused check-in. Poor value. The location is good, but I really wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: mikedent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Seneca end of August for a family visit in Chicago. Nice doormen, friendly and gave good info on clubs/foods. Rooms are converted apartments, so very large! Full kitchen w/dishes and utensils, fridge, micro. Separate bedroom, large closets and dressers. All very clean and quiet. Furniture is slightly worn but clean. Super location, walking distance to Lake, Art Museum(a longer walk), Navy Pier, great shopping and restaurants, directly behind Hancock Building, all the city amenities, small grocery nearby. Quiet nice neighborhood. Great small jazz bar on ground floor, well made drinks. Can't beat it for the price we got $109/nt. Probably is normally higher but less than other high-end "name" hotels nearby. I would definitely stay there again! Taxi and shuttle drivers also gave it high marks.

Reviews.Title: “The Seneca was great!”
Reviews.Author: thersa7
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago from Sept 26 thru 30 and stayed at the Seneca. The staff was most helpful. Out maid service was good. Rooms were nice and kept clean. We felt safe in the area which with two ladies traveling alone this was important. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends that travel to Chicago.We loved going to the John Hancock Center next door and looking at the view of this wonderful town....check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It”
Reviews.Author: SB668
Reviews.Content: I always get nervous when staying in Chicago. Past experience with other hotels have been really bad. You pay in excess of $100 for a room that is filthy and has horrible service - but The Seneca changed my mind about taking my kids to Chicago for a vacation! 5 of us stayed in this suite comfortably. The bathroom was impeccably clean - even had a working jacuzzi tub. The kitchen was also very clean. The dishes, pots, pans, glasses and utensils looked barely used. The stove was one of the new glass top stoves - even had a new dishwasher, stove and microwave! The Seneca provides you with enough closets to store any amount of luggage that you bring. We joked that one of the closets could double as a room for one of the kids it was so large! There were two televisions so the adults didn't have to suffer through cartoons. The couch, loveseat and chair were all in good shape and comfortable. The service received from the staff was very professional. The doormen were all very pleasant and gracious. The room was cleaned daily and when we called for extra sheets and towels, they were delivered to the room within minutes. The location is right next door to the Hancock Center so it's within walking distance of Michigan Avenue. It was $11.50 for a cab to the Museaum Campus if you were tired of walking. It looks like a few people have had some bad service and the photos obviously don't lie. But don't let these few bad experiences scare you away from this hotel. For Chicago and the price ($169 a night) - You can't beat The Seneca.

Reviews.Title: “Fond Memories”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca Hotel in 2004 with my girlfriend & her husband. She was undergoing cancer treatment at Northwestern. I can't believe the hotel has changed that much to rate such horrible reviews. Each time she & her husband came in, I stayed with them & we found the hotel a treasure. We enjoyed the kitchen, the spaciousness, & the old world charm of the place. This journey was from May to December. When you are living in a hotel, three to four days a week over 8 months, you appreciate having a kitchen & space. We come from Chicago & enjoy old buildings, so this hotel was right up our alley. The location is great, but because we are from here, Michigan Ave & the lake are just apart of life. The hotel becomes important. The staff was great-kind & considerate. I spoke to other travelers & they all enjoyed staying there, too. We haven't been there since, but we do have fond memories of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seneca Aug 9-12 and was also nervous given the reviews here. I think what you pay for the room makes a big difference. We paid $99 a night for a deluxe queen 2 room suite (2 Q beds in another bedroom) on a Travelzoo promotion. This was a steal, however if I'd paid $200 a night I would not have been very happy. The location is great and the rooms were huge. Perfect if you are traveling with children. Unlike several reviewers, I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly (I went out of my way to be friendly to them too since they can make or break your stay), the room was cleaned and straightened up every day and the kitchen was fully stocked with dishes. We arrived early (11:30) and parked in the Self Park lot at 275 E. Chestnut for $25 a day - much cheaper than the $39 the Seneca charges. We didn't need in and out priviledges, however. The room wasn't ready until 3:30 even though they said it would be ready at 3:00 - that was really the only service complaint. The Seneca is in an older building so you have to accept the fact that the paint won't be perfect and the bathroom will be small. Big deal. The furniture was a bit worn and the carpet has seen better days but the couch was long and comfortable enough for my husband to nap on! There's a full service grocery store at the corner of State and Chestnut (Potash Bros.) that we used to make dinner at home one night. Huge loaner umbrellas at the door were a nice service when the rain started. I wouldn't pay over $150 a night to stay there but we got a great deal. If you are looking for something newer in a residential suite hotel the Residence Inn on Walton (about two blocks north of the Seneca) is very nice but more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca from July 29 to Aug 1 3nights. I read reviews and was extremely nervous about the stay. I am a Travel Consultant so when I read a review of a hotel, that is horrible, I am worried about putting any client there. I was scrambling to find another hotel but we kept The Seneca. My mom was a patient at Northwestern Hospital and we were able to get a reduced rate. The hotel was not far from the hospital and to the Whoster House where my dad was staying. We arrived to find a very large 2room suite. A seperate sleeping room 2 queen beds, a very large window with nice curtains to close at night. Keeps all light out. A small bathroom. Older hotels tend to have small baths, and a large walkin closed. The sitting room had another walkin closet and another coat closet. A couch, loveseat chair and a desk. There was a dining room with four chairs. Off the dining was the narrow, galley kitchen. Fridge, stove, sink, dishwasher with plenty of metal cabinets and counter space. The kitchen cabinets could have been wood, since metal cabinets are a little dated, but they were in great shape and we did not mind. There were 5adults and 1child in the room. We did bring an air mattress for extra bedding. We did lose our remote but it was in the coushion of the couch. The carpet between the closet and sleeping room was pulled up, a lilttle, but that was no big deal. The room was clean, well stocked, and when we left the maid a request it was always fulfilled. We did tip the maid a little each day. The doormen were very nice and helpful. When we came back with our hands full they were ready to open the doors. I loved the location. The location is quieter than being on Michigan Ave. Just a few blocks walk and there you are. Not far from the lake. Close to the Watertower to catch the free trolly or sign up for a multitude of sightseeing tours offered at the street corner. I know all rooms are different and maybe we just got lucky with a nice room and a nice staff. Based upon my stay I would recommend this hotel to my clients. I would advise them, of the fact, that the hotel is in an older building.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this 'Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: grampian
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst hotel we have ever stayed in during our many trips to the USA. We arrived to unmade beds with dirty sheets, dangerously worn carpets, dirty room, dirty bathroom, no plug in the sink etc, etc.etc No one would take responsibility for the problems and no-one fixed them despite many requests. They did not even acknowledge them - neither did they challenge them which I would have expected if they were going to deny them. They would not let us change rooms, and unfortunately Chicago was VERY busy and we couldnt find another room anyway. Even if we had we discovered that they had taken the full amount due for all 5 nights UP FRONT ! I believe that Oprah lives in the apartment block opposite. She must have bought it so she could look out of her penthouse windows for a real good laugh any time she wanted. Avoid this place at all costs

Reviews.Title: “probably better choices out there”
Reviews.Author: yorkistrose
Reviews.Content: I arrived there on July 17 for a 3-night stay and found that the room was clean but small, furniture was scuffed and handles broken on the desk and nightstand. Floor there is so strange -- like the carpet was laid over really lumpy concrete with no pad. I couldn't locate a remote for the TV so I called for one and since it was very late I said next evening would be OK. It wasn't there by 6 p.m. on Monday so I called again. By the third call I finally received a remote (9:30 Monday night). Bell-kid said they were fully booked and very busy. By Tuesday morning, remote stopped working. Faucet dripped, Tuesday my room wasn't serviced all day. No internet, only dial up and a per minute fee, ouch. Tiles missing in the shower -- rooms just overall kind of shabby and tired. My stay was only fair -- at half the price of the Drake you might consider it a thrifty choice. But I wouldn't stay there again. It was a shame, really. Great potential and a FABULOUS location, right next to Hancock Tower and within easy walking distance of the Drake and all the shopping. But I saw and heard a lot of angry people in the lobby complaining about one thing or another. I just couldn't recommend this hotel in good faith.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived only to fing out they had lost our reservtions. The front desk lady was rude and arrogant and pushed the problem off onto AAA. She continued to argue with me even after we had reserved the room. I had to tell her that I was finished with the discussion and walk away. The manager was of little help.
