We paid double the amount we booked the room for. Two days later, AAA called and had convinced the manager to refund the difference. The air conditioner leaked down the wall and all over the carpet in the closet. The vents in the living room and bedroom were covered with mold and mildew (see photos). Even after telling the fron desk of this problem, nobody cleaned the vents. The television remote did not work in the living room and the cable went out consistently. This is a bad place to stay and other hotels are very close and are similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Seneca Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Seneca Hotel on Sunday, July 17th and departed on July 20th. The hotel was older. I found the staff friendly. The room was a nice size. We had a one bedroom with a livingroom and kitchen. The bathroom was small. There was 2 queen size beds in the bedroom. The kitchen was nice for when we would get up earlier than the others we could go in there and shut the door. The location was great only 2 blocks off Michigan Ave. We also dined at Joey's on Superior Ave. Nice place to eat. Went to the Oak Street Beach very nice and close to the hotel. Seneca Hotel was a nice place to stay I would go back there again. Our hotel room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: dr_foucault
Reviews.Content: I actually never stayed at the Seneca hotel. I tried to make a reservation but for three days the computer system was down. (June 6-8 that would explain the previous review) Once I had a reservation I unfortunatly needed to cancel my trip to Chicago. I later found out that my room was charged and not canceld. When I called to find what had taken place I was charged because of a no-show. One week later no one will return my phone calls or resolve this issue. Very bad managment at this hotel. Please stay away, there are many better places within the city of Chicago to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Old and not clean-better hotels for the money on Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was shabby and not very clean. The carpets were very badly stained. We had a 1-year-old with us and it was hard to control a baby from being on the floor. We then discovered our toilet didn't work properly---had to be moved to 2 additional rooms to get a working toilet. Still had dirty carpets though. Furniture was old. Room is big and spacious with kitchen but kitchen items seemed dirty so we did not use it. All in all, there are cleaner and newer hotels on/off Michigan avenue at the same price. I will not stay here again. Also, the valet guys were rude to us. They offer in/out privledges for the flat rate parking fee but aren't happy to help you get your car in and out!

Reviews.Title: “Good location Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimaak01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night on May 20th. Location is very good, right near the Michigan ave. The building itself is old, needs some renovations. Room was OK. Bathtub didnâ€™t drain water down. Decision on weather we will stay there again depends on the price per night (for the price we paid bathtub had to work better).

Reviews.Title: “Great -- better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor, and although many were positive, some were less than positive regarding the staff of this hotel. So, I'm happy to say that my three-night stay was more than satisfactory; it was excellent! Other reviews have mentioned the rooms in detail, so I'll add just a little bit more. I was very happy with the room, which was more like a small one-bedroom apartment. There were two televisions, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. The bed was very comfortable. The first night there was somebody in the next room talking very loudly on the phone while I was trying to sleep -- so I did have to use earplugs that one night. Otherwise, I slept very well and comfortably. The hotel has good security, as there is a locked door between the check-in desk and the elevators. Although the Seneca is located in a nice neighborhood, in a big city extra security is always welcome. There is a deli on the lower level of the hotel that serves excellent breakfasts. Also, they were very accommodating about letting me sit for a long time with a coffee when the hotel couldn't let me check in until 3:00 when I arrived early. This hotel is recommended--

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smdnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The room was in very nice condition, and contains a kitchen as it was a residential building (Some rooms are still used as long-term rentals). It is right off the Magnificent Mile and is convenient to everything. We got a great weekend rate, about $80/nite plus tax which is incredible given the location. I definitely recommend staying here. Also, check out the bar right off the lobby. They have a piano player and drink specials.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Week at a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Tanista
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent seven nights at the Seneca Hotel in downtown Chicago at the end of March and had a great time staying there. For a special rate of $88 a night we had an actual suite complete with full (though narrow) kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom and bathroom, along with two separate walk-in closets. We had more than enough space to spread out and make ourselves comfortable- and privacy enough so we each had opportunity to spend time alone if we wished. Our room was high enough above the street and the building was far enough away from the avenue to turn all the traffic sounds into white noise. The hotel served as a great "home base" during our downtown stay. The Seneca is literally steps away from the Hancock Tower (our room was directly across from it), Water Tower Place (where we went every morning for a terrific breakfast at the food court) and the rest of the upscale stores of Michigan Avenue. To get to all the Museums and other attractions, we caught a bus or went a couple blocks west to the Red Line of the subway- purchasing at least a 3-day transit pass is highly recommended- and whenever we needed directions, there was always a transit worker or helpful stranger to get us where we needed to go. And every night our room was clean and ready for us when we returned. The kitchen certainly came in handy, too, serving as a place to keep our soda pop, orange juice and other purchased sundries, as well as a great place to keep restaurant leftovers refrigerated until they could be warmed up in the microwave. In fact, the room service dinner sent up from the hotel's steakhouse was ample enough to feed us for three nights! We also liked the Seneca's intimate atmosphere, courteous and helpful staff, and sense of security- for example, no one can access the elevators without a special electronic "tag" attached to the room keys. Our problems with the hotel were minor and few- it took a couple days and a chat with the day-shift staff to finally get my mom an ice bucket, and the number of towels kept changing in an erratic fashion. I also found the beds to be hard and a bit uncomfortable to sleep on, but it's really more of a non-issue since I've found that seems to be the same with most hotel beds everywhere. It wasn't a large, luxurious, 5-star hotel or major chain to be sure, but we found the Seneca Hotel to be absolutely perfect for our stay in the Windy City- the location and amenities simply couldn't be beat for the same price anywhere else in the city. We would definitely stay there again and heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: amills
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seneca in Downtown Chicago for St. Patrick's Day weekend and I have to say the rooms were huge!! We stayed in a deluxe double queen suite and the bedroom alone could have been the whole room. This hotel also has apartments which may explain why the rooms are so very large. The rooms are in need of touch-ups here and there but are clean and can I say spacious again! Service was quick except that valet took quite awhile when we were checking out but the Big 10 Tournament was also going on that weekend so they were very busy. The location is perfect! We were a block off of Michigan Avenue, next to the Hancock Observatory and Water Tower Place. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice at Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In February 2004 my wife and I and another couple stayed at the Hotel Seneca under a Winter Special deal of $109 per night including either parking or full breakfast. Due to slow bookings both couples were given king-suites. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated, and very large. They included bedroom, sitting area, dining area, and kitchen. The rooms showed some signs of wear, but nothing bad. The staff was friendly and helpful in clearing a slight reservation snafu. The location just off Michigan Avenue near the north end of the Magnificent Mile was excellent! At this price in the heart of a major city with the extras it was a great deal! We'' watch for special again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I first booked this hotel through Travelocity, I thought the price was possibly a mistake...a Queen room w/ kitchenette for $79/night? Upon check-in (no hassle w/ credit card) it was definitely true. We live in the area but were taking a "Spring Break Trip" to the city - mom & 2 kids, for 3 nights. I did not think to ask for a non-smoking room, but should have, because our room definitely had accomodated smokers in the past. Still, we were very pleased with the two queen beds in the bedroom PLUS the living room & kitchen. There is a Treasure Island grocery store at 666 Lake Shore Drive, so we stocked up on snacks and breakfast stuff. We weren't going to be lolling around in the room, anyway so the view didn't matter. Bathroom was OK but could use some repairs - nothing but normal wear & tear, though. Having lived in several vintage apartments in this city, it was par for the course in a vintage building, which I find charming. The bedroom closet was stocked with iron and ironing board, which was great. We did not use any of the services in the hotel, but one of my kids used the fitness room in the basement which was just fine. The Front desk staff/bellman were very nice and allowed us to check-out, but still leave our bags there for later pick-up on our way home. The location is about as stunning as you can get in Chicago for the price! Given the same rate again, I would re-book this property in a minute, especially if you are traveling with kids and need a home-base, and don't need/want to pay for over-the-top amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to give the Seneca a 3.5”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I can't quite decided if the Seneca deserves 3 stars or 4. I recently stayed there four nights. It was alright, but if I go back to Chicago I'd probably look for another hotel. The Seneca handles all the basics well--it's quiet, dark (often a problem in urban hotels), has decent beds. It provides a small kitchen in each room, though in mine there was barely enough room to stand in front of the sink. The refrigerator buzzed off and on all night, so I had to shut the doors to the galley kitchen area (which in turn made the area rather warm). The Seneca doesn't have minibars, which to me are just an annoyance, not a service. I had a hassle with my credit card checking in. The desk staff insisted that my credit card wasn't working. To keep my rate--which I'd reserved through Hot Rooms (which seemed to get better deals)-I had to go out and find enough cash to cover it. I was very concerned because the first night was much more expensive than the other three. It turned out that the credit card was fine--that the hotel had incorrectly entered some of my information. Good points of the Seneca: It's across the street from the John Hancock Bldg. and close to the shopping malls of Michigan Ave. (like many Chicago hotels). Inside the hotel are a good steakhouse, a mediocre deli and an American restaurant I didn't try. There are laundry facilities on many floors--the building is partially residential, which I like (makes me feel more like I'm really in the city). There were places where my room was shabby around the edges--it didn't feel like much work, for good or for ill, had been done since I was last there 10 years. I wound up on the 5th floor but you're unlikely to get a room, almost every building in the area is as tall or taller. The Seneca also had the best rate (through Hot Rooms) of any AAA approved hotel in downtown Chicago, except for a few chain motels. All in all a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place - if you're deaf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like hearing your neighbors' television, telephone conversations, coughs and sneezes, you'll love this 1920's era apartment/hotel. Front desk, bellmen, and common areas are all very nice, and the rooms are otherwise quaint and attractive. They ought to supply earplugs as a standard amenity - between the thin walls and the early morning garbage trucks, you won't sleep well otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seneca and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seneca Easter weekend 2004. We had a great time and really enjoyed the hotel. The people who worked there were friendly and very helpful with restaurants and bus schedules. We would stay there again and not think twice about it. Our room was nice and big and clean. The TV worked just fine. Didn't use the kitchen but there seemed to be plenty of dishes, pans and silverware. Maybe the people who had a problem with the staff had an attitude of there own. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We ate in the restaurant upstairs and had a super meal. The hotel is right off of Michigan Ave, where you can walk everywhere you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “the good, bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: SEODelafield_wi
Reviews.Content: The good part was the low internet price we got, the fabulous location and the large rooms. It was obviously an apartment at one time - with LR, DR, BR, Bath and full kitchen. The bad was very small bathroom with hot water only in the A.M. Be warned - shower in the morning or not at all. Also, the door locks are poor, little security and you have to affirmatively lock them with the key when you leave!! The ugly was the view to the north - alley, dumpsters etc.. ask for a view in any other direction, - and the hallways which are identical to the hotel hallways in the movie "Shining". My wife was worried she'd see Nicholson walking around with an axe. All in all worth it for the good prices you get on the internet (we paid $80/night incl tax).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay. Home Away from home”
Reviews.Author: KHMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Seneca Hotel in August 04. It is a lovely place to stay. I like the ideal of an all suite hotel. The images of rooms on the internet were exact representations. The hotel is quiet, housekeeping is prompt, and I love the kitchenette. The pricing for this suite was great also. Would recommend to a friend and Would stay there again.
